Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O sons, when I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, by its accomplishment in it and by its expositions and declarations, it has seemed to me that you will understand this treatise, which is a part of the operation with the hand, that is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation with the hand is spread abroad in our realm and in our time deprived of all, while the science of it perishes, and its vestige is obstructed; and there remain of it only a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have altered the most part and led to errors and confusion, so that the minds of men are closed to it, and its force and art are prolonged.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it has seemed to me that I should animate this with the arrangement of this treatise in the second place according to the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that the forms of the instruments of cautery and of other tools of the work might come by addition of declaration, and by preparation of it, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause why no good artificer is found with his hand in our time, is because the art of medicine is long, and that requires one to be exercised in the science of anatomy, which knows the joints of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and has the knowledge of bones, nerves, and tendons, and the number of these, and the issue of them; and of the pulsating veins and the quiet ones, and the places of their issuing.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And therefore Hypocras says that by name is much, but in the work little, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said this in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not learned in what we have said of anatomy, it is not vacated that he may not fall into error by which men will die, as I have seen troops of these, for some are formed in this science and throw themselves from it without experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and experienced doctor open an abscess of scrofula on the neck of a woman, and he cut some arteries of the neck so that much blood flowed and the woman died under his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who had taken a stone from a man who was in his condition, and the stone was great, and he brought it out with a part of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I called to take it out, and I saw that by the size of the stone and the disposition of the patient that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who received stipends from a duke of our land for surgery, and he treated a broken black slave; and through the ignorance of the doctor, when he had extracted the fracture, over the wound with poultices and bandages with strong pressure, he did not leave the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he did this according to his desires, and he released it, and he bound it for many days and commanded that we should not loosen the bandage; and he did so until the thigh and foot were apostematized, and he came to perdition.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I prepared to loosen the bandage, and I obtained tranquillity and he was eased of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But indeed the corruption was confirmed in the member, so that I could not restrain it, and the corruption did not cease to wander through the member until the man died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who opened an apostema of a canker, and it was ulcerated for some days, until the malice of it was magnified with his lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of this is that the black cautery is pure of melancholy humor, therefore it does not come to him with fire from all, but that there be a member which suffers that from all.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation with the hand be considered in two ways: first, in operation which is associated with health; and second, in work with which there is peril in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already exhorted this in all parts of this book in which comes operation in which there is error and fear; so that it is necessary for you to guard this and leave that, so that the foolish may not obstruct the way of speaking and disgracing you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take up your weapons with solicitude and with protection of God, and your patients with facility and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the better way by the grace of God to health and laudable success, and leave terrible diseases of difficult cure, and bear your arms against that which makes you afraid, so that solicitude in your faith and in your name does not abandon you; for there remain for your glory, and most in the world and beyond to your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gaulish already said in some of his maxims:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	“Do not heal ill disease, so that evil doctors are not named.”
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter arranged of the head-to-toe, in the forms of the instruments and in the tools of the cauteries, and of what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter of bleeding and puncturing, and of cupping-glasses, and of bandages, and of extraction of thorns and of their likes, all capitulated and arranged of the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter of restoration and of dislocation, and of cure of torsion and their likes; a chapter arranged of the head-to-toe, and of the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cautery with fire and with acute medicine and reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will tell you the quality of the humors of that cautery and the pains of it, and in what complexions cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the term of the quality of the humor of cautery and of the pain of it is long and prolix, and subtle through science, and secret hid; and of it have spoken greatly many sages, and of it are they disagreed, and for me a little suffices of their terms, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery confers with all complexions universally the which is of matter or of matter, excepting two complexions, which are cold and moist complexions.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the cold and dry complexions with matter they disagreed; for some said that cautery is beneficial to it, and others said the contrary of that, that cautery is not convenient in disease which is by quality and by dryness, for nature of fire is quality and dryness, and convenient is that disease cold and dry with that which is cauted and dried be healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And I said the contrary of that, that by cautery is made benefit in all disease cold and dry which you see in the bodies of men; for when you compare the body of man and its humidity to the complexions of fire, you rub the body of man moist.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I speak from experience, as I have tried this myself several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not advisable for someone to attempt this who has not already been instructed and practiced in the art of cautery, and become familiar with the variety of human complexions and dispositions of illnesses within them, and their causes, and the accidents of those illnesses, and the span of time involved.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other complexions there is no need for fear, especially in moist and humid illnesses, for all doctors have agreed on these, and they are not at odds over the use of cautery in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my children, that the secret of healing with cautery by fire and of its goodness is that cautery is a simple action, the effect of which does not reach except to the member that is cauterized, and it does not affect another member by it except for a little harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of a burning medicine reaches to those members from which it is removed, and it strongly brings about an illness in the member that is difficult to heal, and it strongly causes pain.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, by its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not do that except to make it superfluous. And it is known to us by experience and by long service in the study of art upon the truth of causes; and because of this I am excused from the length of speech. And if it were not for the fact that my free will is not read in this hidden secret of fire, and the quality of its operation in bodies and its expulsion by which illnesses are expelled, in philosophical speech demonstrated, which would be sharpened in your hearts.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, my children, that they disagree on the time in which it is convenient to perform cautery and they pause at the best time in spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the harm from the accidental time is submerged in the benefit of what is drawn by cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and fierce, which do not tolerate delay, so that it is feared that evil may come, which is greater than the little harm that comes from the season.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And yet, do not wonder in your hearts, o my children, at this, for it is not esteemed except by the common people and foolish doctors; it is that to that illness which is healed by cautery, there is not a reduction in time, and they pause at that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they think it to be, for cautery is only in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries up the moistness which are causes that bring about pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, cautery surpasses medicine in the strength of its value and the power of its operation and the greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the illness may return at some time according to the complexion of the patient and the location of the illness, and the power of it, and what is prepared in the body of it from the aggregation of superfluities in it, and what is come to it in its acquisition in foods and likenesses of those causes; unless that the illness on which cautery is administered is a subtle illness in a member with few superfluities and moistness, so that as with cautery for tooth pain and likenesses, it is possible that the pain will not return in him, but what happens in him is small.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And yet, the common speech is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a just speech, not to what they understand about it, for they believe that there is no cure that benefits by medicine nor by any other cause except cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the intention that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is not except when we administer the manners of cure in some illnesses, and those medicines do not confer it, and then at the end of the cause we administer man cautery, and it benefits to that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And then from here it happens that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the intention which the commoners and foolish doctors understand.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery does not do harm, when it is not absolutely true, for I have already tried this and have proven to you that it does not do this except in some bodies without the others, and cautery with it is good and better than with iron as they said; but when you perform cautery with fire and gold, it is not declared to you, because it is kindled according to the quantity that you desire by the heat of the gold, and because it prepares to receive burn; and if you apply fire on it some leaves so that the craftsman sees by the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And because of this, cautery with iron must be made more gently and closer to the site of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter in cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head into the feet, so that also ask me what you want from him.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for headache due to coldness and moistness.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers to the moisture and coldness on the servile accident of which there are two causes, it is cause of soda and multitude of flux, called rhachitis, from the head to the tips of the ears and from the ears flowing, and multitude of sleeping, and toothache, and generally of all illness that comes by chill, so as paralysis, palsy, and likenesses in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is this: that first you command the patient to be evacuated by laxative medicine the head cleansing, for three or for four days, according to the strength of the patient and his age and habit.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command that he shaves his head with a razor, and then let him sit between your hands on a heated bed and let him rest his hands on his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the root of your palm near the foot over the root of the nose between your heels.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when you have reached the mid-point of that location, mark it with a tent and then apply the olive oil cautery whose recipe is as follows:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place this over the marked spot, in such a way that it covers and presses down gently, and you shall keep turning it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand gently and examine the spot, and if you see some of the bone exposed, with some amount of flesh, then lift your hand again, and if not, return your hand with that iron, with another one of those, if it is cooled off, back to the spot until you see what I have described to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the spot, and let that stay there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place raw meat over it, wrapped in a cloth, and let this stay until the burn scar is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the spot with four-ingredient ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they also say that when the plague sores open up, the better the pus flows out, and so it is healthier and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the bone should be cauterized within, and that the cautery should stay until some part of the bone is charred.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then it should be cut away from the bone, and then treated.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cautery should reach down to the nerve, causing strong pressure within the bone until it breaks, and this is the recipe for alphecat in small amounts:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they consider that location to be where the brain's vapors escape from.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the plague sore remains open for a long time, then it should be treated until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two cauteries used in their entirety except on some men according to the way of fear; and it is better for them as they are, since the head is made transparent by solution of continuity from there, as we have testified in other members, especially when the patient's head is of a phlegmatic nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first cautery is more gentle and better for them; and it works in this way with advantage.
Capitol segon.	Chapter according to St.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in every part of the head there is chronic and long-lasting pain, which has been prolonged in the patient, and he uses oils and salves and clysters and poultices and compresses and bandages and other similar remedies without any benefit, then consider that if the patient's head is of a strong constitution by nature, not phlegmatic but having a great deal of heat, then cauterize him with another cautery after the first one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that at the crown of his head with a cautery until the bone is split.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	The bone split and the amount we have described exposed, then cauterize that with a cautery at the back of the head in the place called the foramen magnum — and it is the location where the ventouse is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And move your hand back and forth, and do not expose the bone, for by doing this he will experience great pain unlike with any of the other cauteries on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will describe this cautery in its place, for the cautery by which the horns of the head and the occipital are cauterized is more gentle than that cautery by which the middle of the head is cauterized; and this is its recipe:
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of cauterization for non-ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is pain in the head caused by a cold disorder, or pain within the eye socket, first let it be evacuated with purifying medicines, and let other remedies also be administered as described in earlier diseases; and if nothing helps, then cauterization can be performed in two ways: either cauterization with burning medicine, or with an iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you take a piece of wool and burn it and then put out its ends in both parts of the head.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then prick the location of the pain in the temple with a sharp lance, going deep enough to reach the bone, until it is covered over.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then press down on it with a tight bandage, and let this remain there for the space of three hours; and then remove the bandage and treat the wound again, letting it heal in two or three days, and then apply raw meat to the spot, covered with a cloth until the wound breaks out.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines which I have written about in the two sections on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But cauterization by iron is performed like this: heat up the cautery, of which this is the recipe:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	And it is called a closed nail, for the head of it is like a small claw with some curvature and in the middle of it is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then apply it to the place of the pain, and move your hand — so that it is not burned — and turn the iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount that is burned by the nature of the bone is equal to the thickness of it, and you raise your hand so that the artery underneath is not burned, so that there is no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then dip the cautery in salt water and apply it to the spot for three days; then apply raw meat wrapped in a cloth, and treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the edge of the blade according to the cautery, and be careful to avoid cutting the artery in this non-ancient hemorrhoid.
Capitol quart.	Chapter four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of cauterization for ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat hemorrhoids with what we have said about its cure, and what we have said in the divisions of diseases, and if this cure is unsuccessful, then consider that if it does not yield to this treatment, or to cauterization with medicine, or with fire, then light the cuterry until it turns white, and then press down on it with a bandage, pricking the artery underneath, until it bleeds into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	But you must take care that the jaw is not broken due to chewing, and that no artery is burned and no nerve underneath it, and that no spasm ensues.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the caution and protection of blood flow from the artery which is cut, for in the cutting of it there is danger, especially to one who is ignorant, and unaware, let the operation be performed at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will give you instructions on the course of blood flow from the artery according to its own way, in your own house.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this disease does not yield to this cautery and the patient' body tolerates it, then cauterize him in the middle of the head as we have described, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you administer the cautery we have described in the section on stretching of the artery with two prongs, then this cautery is better and more effective.
Capitol .v.	Chapter .V.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cauterization for ear pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear from a cold cause and it is treated with remedies that produce lacrimation and also with other remedies which have been mentioned in the division, and if the pain still persists, then ignite the cautery and it is called punctum, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then point to the heat, and move it all around the ear as a wheel is turned, or in circles throughout each part if the pain is in any part.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Along with the cautery from the root of the ear, inch by inch as you heat the place with it.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery makes ten points all around the ear, and then heals those places in between so that they become healthy again.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter .VI.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cauterization for torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture which is cured by cauterization and not only of the humors that come through phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the humor that comes from dryness or from a spasm in the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that kind of torture with syringes and blood-letting and poultices, if your treatment does not work, then apply cauterization to the patient in three places: first at the root of the ear, then a little below his temple, and the third at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And apply your cautery opposite to where the pain is, because softening does not come except in the part that appears healed.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize at the right side of the most upper part of the ear, and in the temple another one whose length is according to the length of your finger, and hold your hand with the cautery over it until that quantity of half the thickness of a hair is burnt.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is the specialty of the surgeon, whose form is represented in front of a table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But however more subtle it is that one goes there with the cautery just as it is, and then he puts some on the wound to cover the superficial roughness.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the place with what is before you until it becomes healthy again.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter .VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of cauterization for old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you treat it with what we have said but your treatment does not work, and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize that person in four places: over both corners of his head, as we have said, and also the middle part of his head, and also cauterize in the throat.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of the cautery is done according to what has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And you have cauterized on the mouth of the stomach, and it is more difficult to cure; then let it be healed by what comes out.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter .VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cauterization for obliteration made by phlegm.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Let the patient receive at the beginning large syringes and purgatives.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then scrape the whole head of the patient, and place on his throat the ointment described in the treatise on ointments.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply that several times because this is the manner of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do that according to the methodical order which I have said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if he is healed by that then well and good; but if not, then do to him three cauteries in the back part of his head which descend from the highest part of the head to the lowest part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And apply between each cautery the thickness of a finger, and then cure the cautery with what comes out.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you can and the patient can tolerate it, then do to him cauteries in the middle part; and if you see greater tolerance, then cauterize on both corners.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then cure that until it becomes healthy again; and let the cautery be olive oil according to the form given above.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter .IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization for parasites and of softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Let the patient undergo blood-letting of the head with syringes and with what we have said; and then scrape the head of the patient, and cauterize that with cauteries on the middle part of his head, and also cauterize on both corners of his head, and also cauterize on the back part of him, and also do three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the illness of softening of the body and the patient can tolerate it, then do four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and finally with cautery over what has been burnt, raise your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then cure that until it becomes healthy again, and let this be olive oil.
Capitol .x.	Chapter .X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cauterization for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	Let the epileptic be cauterized only when epilepsy is caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And let the brain of him be purged at the beginning of his illness with syringes and with other remedies which have been mentioned in the division when the patient is large and can tolerate the exception of the remedies.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if he is a child who does not take the remedies, then give him poultices and masticables which the servant will apply, before what comes out for several days, with good food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then scrape the head of the patient and then cauterize that with one cautery in the middle part of his head according to the previous method, and also cauterize on the occipital bone, and also cauterize on both corners of his head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and can tolerate it, then cauterize him with cauteries which I have said, having paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae of the neck and also the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let this be olive oil according to what precedes it.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child then apply a subtle cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter .XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of cauterization for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupt humidities and gross phlegm, then cauterize that with cauteries which I have said in the case of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excessive decline into melancholy and the body of the patient is humid then let him drink what purges the brain according to what precedes in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then scrape the head of the patient and also make a decently twisted bandage over his forehead, and then place that over the middle part of his head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	Let the patient be quiet and let him lie on his back.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a poultice and it is also worthy of being bathed with hot water from sheep.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	Let that be heated over the fire by moderate heat according to measurement so that it does not suffer when it is put on him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then apply vinegar in the middle part of his head in the forehead and pour it over so that it runs down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do that to him for a week with vinegar, and let him have the other regimen of him until he is healed; or if you wish, cauterize him by making small points according to his strength unless you have your hand with one cautery as it is ordered: this is the cautery which moistens the brain with equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that wet cloth in a bowl or in a basin of warm water.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of cauterization with water descending into the ear.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When to you has been revealed the beginning of water in the ear through the signs which I have told in the division, then begin and give the patient something to drink that cleanses his head, and keep him from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let him sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command him to wash his hair, and cauterize that with a cautery in the middle of the head; and then cauterize it with two cauteries over the two temples if the beginning of water is in both ears, or on one side if the water comes from one ear.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Then, with a cautery, cut all the veins and arteries which are below the collarbone; and let the cauteries be in that length in the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And beware of any bleeding when it is cauterized; and if you see any bleeding from it, stop it with some medicine which is possible for you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I came with wisdom which is in the extraction of arteries and veins, and cauterization of them and cautioning against bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized in the neck below two bones with two cauteries recently produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the ears are old and persistent and through veins and arteries which are in the manifest location of the head and it is verified that this is surplus phlegmatic moisture, then cauterize that with a cautery which we recounted in the chapter on the beginning of water coming into the ears, and with a cautery in the middle of the head, and with two cauteries over the temples below two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you see the need for addition, then cauterize that on all sides of the ear canal at the end of the outer ear with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cauterization of blood in the neck for veins and arteries in the neck, and for the throat.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat him with that which we said in the division and your treatment does not profit, then prepare and give the patient a poultice for three nights, and then shave his head, and cauterize it with an olive-oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that with a cautery of garlic with two cauteries over the two outer ears below the hair, one small.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of the artery that you do not ignite it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And of the cautery of garlic, this is its form.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of the cautery for softening of the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by sickness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery which has this lunar shape; and this is how you make it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize that on the two eyebrows a little bit with two cauteries all divided, and let them be elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is affected.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the cautery for the eyelid of the eye when the hairs are converted into the parts within and close up the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye are converted into the parts within so that they close up the eye, there are two ways of cauterizing them: one cautery is with fire, and another cautery is with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize it with fire, order the patient to open his eyes so that he cuts his hairs as they grow, while you prolong and burn them; and if he closes it you must strengthen the eye with a bandage so that he does not hurt himself as the hairs are growing.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then as they grow and burn, put the patient's head in your lap, and then mark on the eyelid of the eyes with a piece of coal, the shape of which is like a leaf of an oak tree, and let the beginning of the mark be near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then put cotton soaked in white vinegar or in mullein tea on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then light the cautery of which this is the shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the figure which you have marked, little by little, until it burns the surface of the membrane which is like a leaf of myrtle, appearing properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the sign of health from your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the hairs of it elevated above the puncturing of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and open that for three days, and then put on it a poultice until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if they return because of the hairs for some cause, and the eyelid is softened, then do the cautery on it again completely as you did at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are in the eyelid, then cauterize that until it is elevated to its natural place and burned and that the hairs do not poke into the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you order the patient to open his eyes so that he cuts his hairs as they grow and burn; then make the shape of the leaf of myrtle out of cloth.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take one ounce of dry salt and a quarter ounce of vitriol. That is: Take this mixture and stir it well so that the vitriol does not stick to the bottom; and then spread this mixture over the cloth which is made in the shape of a leaf of myrtle, and put that on one eye or both; and put under the eye cotton soaked in white vinegar, and let the patient's head be in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And put the finger over the medicine and press that gently so that he does not hurt himself while the patient feels the burning of the medicine, for it burns in him as fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And then when he perceives the burning, let him open it with your finger; and then take away the medicine and wash the eye with water; and then consider if you see the eyelid lifted as it is washed because of the cautery by fire or by cutting, for then it is well; and if not return to that on which the medicine has not bitten and is not blackened until your operation is healed and the eye is contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then put on it a poultice until the membrane of the cautery is eradicated, and treat that with defynition ointment or other until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary that you watch over your operation so that no residue of the medicine falls into the eye; and if the eyelid after a few days is softened and for some cause the hairs poke into the eye, then repeat your medicine on that place from which the eyelid is softened, and do it just as you did at the beginning, and bandage him until he is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of a leaf of myrtle:
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that men's eyes are different in size and smallness, and therefore according to this is your contraction made.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way of straightness does not lead to that one who is taught in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cautery for the fistula which is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you heal fistula by what we have said in the divisions of sickness and do not trust your healing, then know that you cauterize it according to this way: order the patient to put his head in your lap, and let some servant hold his head between their hands in such a way that he is not hurt nor agitated by his head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then put cotton soaked in white vinegar or mullein tea on the eye of him.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then light the cautery of which this is the shape:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which is hollow, like the shape of a reed or of a feather of an owl, from one extremity which is made the cautery.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see that it is penetrating to the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to come out like a thread.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, that which is hollow is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open and draw from him the pus and dry that.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and take out the pus of it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then put over it the cautery which is lit, and hold your hand over the eye at the part of the nose so that you or the patient are not hurt, and then put the cautery on the edges of the eye and rub that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then if at the beginning of your cautery it penetrates into the bone, well; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice as need is; let him open his eyes for three days, and then put over that a poultice and bandage him until he is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if after ten days it is not healed, then put over it sharp medicine which erodes the bone and let it be open so that you see the membrane, and scrape it according to what it says in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another way of cautery for the fistula which some first said: stop at the place of the fistula and pierce that and then put in that fissure a thin wire of which the shape is: And melt in that one ounce of lead molten; and hold your hand over the eye with good retention so that he is not hurt as the molten lead does not come to the eye from that; and see that you put on the eye of the patient cotton soaked in white vinegar or water, for the lead erodes the place of the fistula and heal it by a wondrous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about the cautery and the treatment, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer an incision in the nose and reduce the fistula to the body of the nose according to where it will go into its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Here begins the eighteenth chapter.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of cauterizing the wound in the fistula.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times there occur fissures in the lips, and mostly in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you heal those fissures with what we have said in the divisions and your treatment does not work, then light the cautery knife in this way:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And its cavity according to the thinness of the blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place it gently in those fissures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissure.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that with bandages so that it will be healthy.
Capitol .xix.	Here begins the nineteenth chapter.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cauterizing a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or the palate or the roots of the teeth there is an ulcer and it is swollen and broken and old and has a fistula, and you heal it with what we have said about healing but it does not work, then know that you should ignite cautery according to the quantity which was received in the fistula; then put that fire into the hole of the fistula, and hold your hand over it so that the hot iron reaches the bottom of it; and at the end of it make an incision or two; and heal that with what we have said about healing so that it will be healthy.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And therefore if the sore is healed and healthy, that's good; but if not, then it is necessary to discover the place and remove the rotten bone according to what will come in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Here begins the twentieth chapter.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cauterizing teeth and softening gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are rotten, and you heal them with medicines but they don't work, then put the patient's head in your lap, and ignite the cautery in the form which will come here, in such a way that you place the hook over the tooth and insert into it the ignited cautery quickly, and hold your hand gently over it so that the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift up your hand, and repeat the cautery several times according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should gargle with salty water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out; for the rotten tooth is hardened and the softened gum is strengthened, and the corrupt moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Here begins the twenty-first chapter.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cauterizing a toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When a toothache is from coldness, or in it is cold or wormy, or the medicine does not work, then the cautery in that place is according to two ways: either cauterize with cow' hide, or cauterize with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with cow hide is that you take a cow hide and boil it in an iron pot, and then grab it by the tail and wrap it around the end of the tooth, and then plunge it into the boiling hide and place it quickly on the painful tooth until it is cold.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that several times until the goodness of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, immerse wool or hide in the said boil, and place it on the painful tooth, and hold the hot iron over it so that the iron reaches the bottom of the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But the cautery with fire is that you take an iron or ram horn, and it should have some thickness and the heat of the fire not reach the patient' mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cautery in the form which will come, and place it on the tooth and hold your hand over it so that the cautery is cold; and do this several times because the pain will be reduced or on that day or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And know that because of that cautery, the patient should fill his mouth with good salive and hold it for an hour, then spit it out; this is the way of cauterizing.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize with whatever you want according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the way of the hook:
Capitol .xxii.	Here begins the twenty-second chapter.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cauterizing hernia.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernias are of phlegm and cold humors and they do not yield to digestion with medicines, and you see that light digestion, then ignite the cautery in such a way that it has two ends bent so that smoke comes out of the cautery through one end, place the ignited cautery on the hernia once, and if it does not yield from that, then hold it over the hernia until the heat reaches the bottom of the hernia.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the hernia is small, then place the cautery according to the quantity of the hernia; and then let it cool for three days, and place wool soaked in cow' hide over it so that what the fire has burned is cooled down.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that with ointment and bandages until it is healthy.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the way of the hook or cautery is as follows:
Capitol .xxiii.	Here begins the twenty-third chapter.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterizing rawness of throat and constriction of voice.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When moisture comes from the lungs, and especially when it is from coldness of constitution, then know that the patient should be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines; then cauterize him from the root of the gullet in the place which has been weakened.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And beware that you do not reach with the cautery to the gullet or burn the membrane of it, but only a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize him with another cautery from the joint of the throat in the last vertebra of it.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And the cautery of him should be like a nail, according to the preceding way.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that with what has been said so that it is healthy.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Here begins the twenty-fourth chapter.
