And know that when blood flows from an artery, it is not possible to restrict the flow of blood in those places, especially when the artery is large, unless by one of four methods: either by cauterization as mentioned earlier, or by extraction if it has not been extracted; for when it is extracted, its extremities are burned and the blood flow restricted. Or it may be tied with a thread or with a ligature to tightly constrict it; or medicines whose virtue is to restrict the blood flow should be applied to it, and it should be bound with a pad with a decent constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who administers a decent restriction to it with a ligature and constriction with cloth or by position of burning and similar causes, should not confer it but slowly.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if it is aimed at someone and neither the doctor nor medicine is present, then open by pressing on the said hole of that vein as we have said before, and understand to the great constriction of it within so that the blood may be stopped from the upper part of the plague; and over the artery let it not be rubbed; and over the artery, let it be sprinkled with water rubbed with a very cold thing until the blood is congealed and thickened. And when there is need for cauterization or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begins the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and piercing, and of bleeding and phlebotomy, and of plagues and their likes.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all about sicknesses for which cauterization with fire and burning medicine is convenient, and its occasions and causes, and the instruments in which they are necessary, and the forms of cautery; and I have ordered the chapters from the upper part of the head to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And we will go through this chapter in that same way so that it may be clear to the one who reads it and then ask about it.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before I begin that, listen, you children, that in this chapter there is what is terrifying to you that is in the first chapter of cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And because of that, one must be very cautious in it, for the operation which is in this chapter many times involves evacuation by bleeding which is through blood through the vein or incision over an abscess or opening of a wound or purification of the plague or extraction of arrow or incision of stone and their likes.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And from all those are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in most of them death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that it does not happen to you in which there is a loss, for sometimes because of men's ways many sicknesses occur.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And of them is the one who goes away because of his sickness and escapes death, but also because of the vehemence of that from which he suffers because of his sickness, and because of the length of his sickness and because of the sickness which signifies death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of them is the one who gives you hope and says it to you, you waiting for that health, but his sickness is harmful.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore do not consent to one who comes to you whose nature is like that; and your caution should be greater than naivety and your rapaciousness; and do not presume any cause over it unless by certain science which verifies it for you, and to whom there comes laudable success.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your sicknesses from prediction and indication for that to which health is converted, for in it is your helper for acquiring fame and memory, praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	O children, may God inspire you with his understanding and not refuse you direction and protection, for that is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have ordered this chapter distinguishing according to the chapters that preceded in the chapter of cautery, of the cure of the head to the feet, so that it may be clear to you that which you ask about and for which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of water that is contained in the head of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this sickness many times occurs to children because of childbirth, and when the nurse tightens the head of the child it becomes loose.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes because of a hidden cause which is not washed off.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this sickness except in children; and to all of them to whom I have seen it occurs death, and because of that I saw the act lessened in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that a child whose head was filled with water and the head of him magnified so much that he could not move his neck because of the size of his head, but also because the moisture increased, causing death by fire.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity is added between the scalp and the bone, or is added below the bone on top of the skull.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	For the operation on that if the humidity is between the scalp and the bone and the abscess is small, then you should cut in the middle of the head with an incision in the breadth, and let the length of the incision be two inches long so that the humidity may flow out, and this is the shape of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore if the humidity is more increased and the abscess is larger, then here are two incisions according to this way:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is below the bone, its sign is that you will see the edges of the head swollen and the water is pushed out when you compress it with your hand at the edges within, and that is not hidden from you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	That you should cut in the middle of the head with three incisions according to this way:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And then draw out all the humidity; and then tighten the incisions with cloth and bandages; and then anoint it with oil within the fifth day, and then loosen the ligature and cure the plague with ointments and poultices, and tighten the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food of little humidity so that the member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another way of incision that considers where the abscess appears and the collection of water, for sometimes it is more in the occipital, or in the front, or on the right, or on the left; and therefore pay attention to the incision where the abscess appears and the collection of water, and cut it according to what is best possible for you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not split the artery and draw out blood flow and cause death to the patient through that flow of blood by evacuating humidity.
Capitol .ii.	Second chapter.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of incision of the arteries which are properly the aureolas, called hilasseysse.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When it occurs to someone cataracts or raucous in the eye or in the foot and it is old, and the cure of medicines does not confer on it, then the latter cure in this is incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore when you want to cut them so that the patient's head is loose, then compress the place with a rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and let it be tightened on the neck of the patient with some cloth; and therefore consider where pulse the vein; and the locations of each over the locations where they are depressed, and as much as they are hidden except in some men.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And therefore press on the artery with a tent, and then cut each one with the spatula of each wound penetrating into the bone, and let it be that by the breadth of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you wish, cut beneath the artery and draw out the blood to the point where it meets the skin above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And the length of the incision should be about two fingers wide, because when a vein is cut the blood flows out in pulses and gushes out frequently.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear in the measurement, then you must measure from the ear the amount of space of three fingers, and then pierce with the needle and enter into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And what is needed to stop the bleeding is an amount of wine equal to one ounce, and pour it quickly in a little or a lot, and all of this is according to the amount that appears from the nature of the patient and the pulsation of his artery.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the wound, and if something remains on the bone that could cause an ulcer, then cut it out so that an ulcer does not form.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the wound with cotton wool and strips of linen cloth, and then heal it with ointment inside so that it may be cured.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the extraction of arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When someone suffers from old migraines or headaches caused by cold and moist humors in the temples, or severe old headache with symptoms similar to those, and is treated with the methods of healing medicine but does not respond, then we have discussed in these maladies the extraction of arteries in the temples, or cauterization of them as we have demonstrated.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the manner of the operation and extraction of these is that the patient lies on his back with his head turned to one side; and feel the artery in the temple as it will be shown to you by its pulse, and it is hidden in most people because of the heat of the skin.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then have the patient's neck held tightly with some cloth; and rub the area with an abrasive cloth or apply warm water to make the artery appear clearly to you.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take the needle, which should be formed in this way:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then pierce the skin with it easily as you reach the artery; and pour in it wine and extract it from the upper parts as you pull it out of the skin and uncover it from the tunics which are beneath it, from every part.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is slender, then wrap it with the end of the needle, and then cut it from one part according to the amount by which its ends are elongated and are contracted, and there will be no flow of blood, for if they are not cut, the blood will not flow at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then pour out an ounce of wine. and let it flow out to three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then tie it in two places with a strong double thread of linen or with cords long enough that putrefaction does not come before the healing of the wound and it experiences flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then cut away the superfluity which is between two strips; do this in that hour or another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you wish, cauterize it with a cautery within the bone with a sharp cautery as far as its ends are cut, and it will be in place of that missing part.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better to do this when the patient does not have fever or is of heated constitution; for cautery is one of those causes that help drive out humors, and therefore is better in youth.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And it is proper to extract the arteries that hollow out the place of an old wound, and have powders decently made placed upon it, and let it be healed with dry medicines that make the flesh grow and with cauteries so that it may be cured.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you operate another vein begins to flow from the artery, then you must stop that blood with your hand or with a cautery, or by pressing the place of the wound and strengthening your hand so that the blood is restricted.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if any of those causes is not present to you, then place your finger on the place where the blood congeals, and wet the spot with water of violent coldness so that the acuity rests, and let it be bound according to what is needed.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And that which is easier in the extraction of an artery is that you cauterize the vein with this cautery having two points, since you have felt the two places with the needle and have laid them open, burning the places with fire so that they reach the bone and cut the vein in two places so that it is elongated between its ends, for it is not consolidated at all by this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And let the acuity of its two points be blunt.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But if it is better with blunter acuity than two points, for if they are acute as two points it approaches each other by quick friction and does not cut into the flesh.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore when there is any thickness in them, the heat of the fire is held in them and the flesh is cut more gently.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better in all work and more gently.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And let the space between its two points be the quantity of the thickness of the finger.
Capitol quart.	Chapter 4
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the curing of bodies with sharp and sour pains in the joints.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When there are sharp and sour pains, and the veins of those which are above the head are torn away, and no cause for the cure of medicine is found in that, and the face of the patient becomes red and he feels a walking sensation as if it were from ants, and his eyelids are scorched by the acuity of tears, the ancients used to cure those with this operation using a sponge.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And it is that you command the patient to scratch his skin which is on his forehead, and then pierce three slits evenly distant according to the length of his forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the slit is two fingers: let the first slit be evenly distant to the length of the nose in the middle place of the forehead, and the second according to the length of a small movement of the tear ducts which are in the eye socket, and the third on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And beware of cutting the arteries which are on two sides, and lengthen your hand from the continuation of both jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And let the space between each incision be the quantity of three fingers placed together.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a sponge or dry rags with which to stop the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the needle between two acute ends of which this is the form of its incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	that it is from the joint of the temples to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Excise with it all the membrane which is between two incisions by the bone which is above the bone, and then do this of the smaller incision within the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then stretch this needle and insert it into the first incision another tool which is called a sharp blade, sharp on one side and blunt on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And lay the sides of it which are sharp against the flesh against the membrane, and the side of it which is blunt against the bone, and insert it so that it reaches to the smaller fissure, and cut with it all the vessels that descend from the head to the joints.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	May the incision be continued until it appears at the base of the tailbone, and then do this in the small crack between the other cracks.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	Then, as blood quantity flows out, press on the places of the frozen blood.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	Then place in each crack a piece of old wood heated in fire, and place over these powders mixed with wine and oil and vinegar, so that there is no wound blisters.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, loosen the ligature and administer a large infusion of hot water or tea, and then treat this with basilicon ointment made from rose oil and others within so that the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5:
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the treatment of ulcers by cauterization and for descending humors from the parts within the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When to someone come cauterizations and continuations of humors, and you see the orifices of the patient weakened and small, and already the protection of them is debilitated, and the eyelids are ulcerated and from this the hair, and in the brain there is acute pain and consequent throbbing, then understand through these accidents that the matters and cauterizations do not come except from many veins within proceeding.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure in those is this: that you command the patient to raise his brow, and then make a cut in the middle of the forehead, small in width (and begin with the cut of the left temple between the right temple; and it must be an incision into the bone; and you must extend your hand from the lacerts of the temples which are hurt because of mastication), so that the bone is uncovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry all the blood with sponge or dry cloth and then fill between the two lips of the cut with old wood or with rags of it.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then tighten above it with powders mixed in wine and oil so that there is no wound blister.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you loosen this and see that the blister has diminished, then know that it is necessary to heat the bone where it begins that new flesh is growing, and then cure that with an exsiccative regimen which makes the flesh dry, thus as if you take two parts of wheat flour and four parts of rosin and mix them together, and from this make an ointment and administer it to these wounds of the native flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6:
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the cure for cauterizations in the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	All causes that cauterize in the ears are of four species, either it is mineral stone or cause like stone, thus as iron and glass, or is from plant thus as chives or beans, or is fluid cause thus as water and vinegar and their likenesses, or some beast.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And thus when stone cauterizes in the ear or other cause like those causes which do not attach to or grow within the ear, and put the ear to the sun, and if you see the stone then distill into that some cause of viola oil or sesame, and then administer its extraction, and make it sneeze with some condiment, and close its nostrils due to the action of sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then put around the ear some pieces of cloth or wool, and extend the ear to the parts above it, for many times it has been torn away by these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not torn away then administer extraction of it with the instrument called a subtle epicyclic hook for which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is torn away by the hook around the ear then make it sneeze with condiment that is negated, and then with the subtle epicyclic hook make extraction of it from the other circuit.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore if it is not torn away by that then make a tube of ram and insert the end of the tube into the hole of the ear and close around the tube with wax and softened oil so that only the tube is open.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract it by your own wind with strong attraction because many times they accompany what we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not torn away in this manner then take from ash alumbat or from wood prepared with which birds are trapped a little quantity, and put that into the end of the ray, and then wrap around it decently with wood paused over it.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the hole of the ear with ease, and then dry the ear from moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore if it is not torn away by all the causes which we have recounted then you cut before that it becomes wound blister or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of cutting it is that at the beginning you cut the patient's vein in the sephatic vein and extract blood according to the manner of its virtue, and then make the ear to cese between your hands and turn the ear to the parts above it, and finish with a small cut at the base of the ear due to the pressure on it.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the cut be moon-shaped so that it comes to the stone, and if you find the stone then stop it with appropriate instruments; and then close the cut in that hour with speed, and cure it while it is healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause that cauterizes in the ear is one of the fats that grow and so inflates then administer its cure and extraction; but if it does not obey your command then take a subtle needle according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	And you insert the end of that into the hole of the ear and then put the ear to the parts above it; and if it is torn away by that then distill viola oil or sesame.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do that when you think that it is already moistened by the vapor of the ear, and put that into many pieces, and then extract them with pins or with a subtle hook, or by incision as we have said before, for its extraction is eased.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water which is entered into the ear come to use sneeze with condiment at the beginning, and fill his own ear with some old wood, and put on that ear in which there is the water, and if by that it is torn away then it is good; and if not then take some stone teals and lions according to the length of the finger, and heat those in the fire a little, and let the patient insert one of those into the hole of his ear and press on that spot with another stone which is within the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore do not cease that with stone until all the water is torn away.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And then the water is torn away let the patient take some paper or gons, i., and put one end of it into the ear and extend the other end with fire until its end is burned.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then put another gons and do that as many times until all the water is torn away, and draw it with the tube as we have said before of the stone extractor.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of a beast entered into that ear, if it is a small cause like pus and to him similar then cure it as we have said in the division; but if it is of great cause which causes appear within the brain then administer its extraction with hooks and pins, and the cause of it is greater than all other causes that cauterize in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of worms generated in the ear, when you heal that with what we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillation and do not confide in your cure, then you must look at the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if any cause of the worms appears, then extract that with a thin or sharp instrument; but if no cause appears, then take a tube with a narrow end and a wide top, of which this is the shape:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the narrow end into the ear according to the amount that the patient can endure; and then suck with a strong suction several times, until all the worms are extracted.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if he does not obey your movements, then you place a plug of wax in the tube as we have said; then administer distillation remedies which the ancients have tested for the cure of worms, and you will find these remedies in the treatise on distillation.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your effusion be the means by which you pour medicine oils into the ear with this instrument of which this is the shape:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it of silver or bronze, narrow at its end and wide on top, with a small hole in the middle.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And thus let it be closed so that no content escapes from the cavity of the tube where the necessary medicine is contained.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take the needle and wrap its end with a piece of cloth, then pour oil into the cavity of the instrument, or juice from some herb, or anything from these medicines in the tube — and that is placed in the ear — then insert the needle wrapped in cloth above it, and squeeze with your hand this medicine in the cloth until it is pressed against the ear, so that the oil is expelled into the cavity of the instrument and the patient feels the oil inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what is inserted in the ear shall be already warmed by fire a little.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And beware that the cause for which you distill into the ear is not too strong, because ear remedies cannot endure that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the cure of an ear blockage.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Sometimes some children are born with their ears closed, and this happens to some adults, by blockage in the middle of the ear caused by pus or by swelled flesh inside; and this blockage sometimes occurs in the outer part of the ear, and sometimes in the inner part.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which occurs in the middle part, which does not allow hearing, is in a more difficult disposition for healing.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that one in which you achieve hearing, let the patient look towards the sun and pay attention to that.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if you see blockage, open it with a thin spatula of which this is the shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the width of its end is small, one side should be sharp and the other not; and the spatula should have two sides smooth so that it does not cut the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the blockage is due to flesh grown in the ear or in its middle part, then cut that with thin instruments and remove it thoroughly so that all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the blockage is in the middle part of the ear, then take a thin needle and heat it in fire a little, and insert that into the middle of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And therefore if you have felt blockage due to the patient struggling with difficulty to hear, relieve the pressure of it with ease; and beware that you do not cut the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place on the ear a bandage according to the width of the opening which you have wrapped in the Egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are sure that the wound is healed; or take some gum arabic, soak it in rosewater, and powder it over the wound; and if you see that the ear is already swollen, then let you remove the gum and replace it with another which you will wrap in cerot made of rose oil, until the swelling is reduced; and heal that.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if bleeding occurs, then immerse sponge or bandage in warm water and place it on the ear, and use the other cure which constricts the flow of blood, which is said in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of the cure for white film which appears on the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	White films which appear on the eyelids of men sometimes are humid, and sometimes they are dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore let you have them with thongs or with instruments, and cut those with a spatula from their roots, and then place over the wounds powdered with rosewater.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if pain comes with the flow of blood, then cauterize those with a small, thin cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cautery is to cut and pull out the roots which return when any cause remains in their roots; and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	The cure for granulation which appears on the eyelids of men.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Many times it appears on the eyelids of men some cause which is similar to granulation in its strength and hardness, and therefore granulation is called.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an aggregation of thick moisture under and over the eyelid.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	And its appearance is that you should consider whether the granulation comes from the eyelid and is swollen on every side; and the cause of it is inflammation.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore cut it with an incision all around its width, and then scrape it from every side with ease so that it is relieved, and suspend it with a thong and cut it off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not prepared for the incision of it if not that you penetrate the eyelid with a little incision, then that will not be noticed in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then adjust it with a suture; and heal that.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, then you will not harm that because its edge restores that and incorporates it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the granulation is declining to the inside parts of the eyelid beyond its surface, then cut open the eyelid and suspend the granulation with a thong, then that you pierce an incision, and press it from every side, and if the eyelid by incision is stretched out, then that will not be noticed in any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then the incision, wash the eye with salt water; and heal the wound so that it incorporates.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the cure of axcyrna above the eyelid on top of the eye.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Axcyrna is gray matter which is generated in the tunics of the eyelid above, and mostly occurs in children, harms the eyes of those and comes to them cataracts; and they cannot look at the brightness of the sun because tears close up to them.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And therefore you see them over their faces all the time, and over their faces they sleep; and on their eyelids under the eyebrows are humid, which have already covered inflammation, and imminence of axcyrna appears in the eye; and when you press the place with your fingers, you feel axcyrna within them.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And some way of operation is in that the patient holds his head down with his chin to his chest, and then place bandage on him and make a cool poultice, and do a circle according to the amount which contains the arthernach all around, and then place that over it and press it with your fingers from all sides so that axcyrna is gathered within the circle; and then cut in the middle of that humidity with a spatula cutting through the width, and the incision should not be larger than the one made in phlebothomia.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the majority of cases where you split the tendon all the way until you reach the Achilles' heel, in most cases the Achilles' heel is processed by fissure according to the shape of white grease.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then remove with drapes which you have wrapped between the teeth to the ends outside and roll between the right and left hand until it is unwound.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to tighten the fissure, so that with the spatula you do not reach the heel and damage it.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if you do not see the Achilles' heel at the beginning of the fissure, but only tighten the fissure a little to facilitate the process; and then remove it as we have said; and then moisten the drapes in water and wine vinegar, place them on the site and apply the powder.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And those who break salt and place it in the cavity of the fissure, so that what remains of that humidity.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if the wound becomes pustular, then cure it with soft bandages until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter .xi.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of ways of touching the heel.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When the eyelids of the heels are born by tightening the natural hairs and are old, then those cause damage to the heel and cause diseases in such a way as constant tears and softening of the eyelids and membrane, so that this is the cause of destruction of the heel which is called tactinir of the heel, and it is cured in four ways: either by cauterization with fire; or with sharp medicine according to what was said before in the chapter on cauterization; or atactinir is caused by incision and suture; or with reeds according to what I will say.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And then you place the head of the patient towards you; then turn the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it is turned, that's good; and if not, insert a needle in that part where there is pus under the eyelid, and let the needle penetrate above, close to the margin of the eyelid where the hairs grow, and close to the hairs, and pull the needle up towards the upper part of the eyelid, and turn it with your finger.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then split the part inside the eyelid under the hairs with a spatulate incision of the major lacrimal into the minor lacrimal; and then remove the pus and place small pieces of cotton or cloth underneath the eyelid, and then close the eyelid with sutures, and it should be like a leaf of myrtle.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But indeed it should be the shape according to the amount of elevation of the eyelid, because that has been varied in men, for there are those who require that the eyelid is greatly split according to the amount by which the eyelid is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then split with a spatula above the two lines you have drawn, and begin from the major lacrimal into the minor lacrimal.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is close to the natural hairs as the thickness of the king's hair.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then place the hook in one of the two angles of the tendon, and then scrape away all of that, and then tighten with the suture the two lips with wax or fine wool thread, and wipe away the blood, and attach what is superfluous of the hairs above the two eyelids with some causes viscous, if you want to do so, and if not, don' t cure.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then loosen the suture of the hairs after three or four days, and then cure it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you want, remove the poultice after the suture, and cure it with what dries it out and constricts, for the eyelid is lifted due to the sealing of the poultice and the accumulation of moisture; but the suture is better. So therefore I say this about the ancient taxanir.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But indeed it should be careful on the patient, and it is a good operation, and there is no fear in it.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And there is another way in taxmir, and it is that you draw on the eyelid a figure like a leaf of myrtle, and then elevate the eyelid with three hooks separated and gathered together according to this shape:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if that is not possible, the hooks are not available, and it is not greased, then take a needle with thread and place it in the middle of the figure, and insert the other end near the major lacrimal, and the other end near the minor lacrimal, and tighten between the teeth the hairs with equality, and then with these elevate your hand with an equal elevation, elevate all the tendon on which you have drawn as we have recommended.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then tighten the two lips of the poultice with a suture, and cure it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if pustules occur due to your incision or your split, stop that pustule with cerote and something similar, and with ointment.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And some times the eyelids turn inside out, then you should use what we have said about incision; but in each case, suture is more artificial.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Taxanir with reeds is according to this form:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And it is that you turn the eyelid inside out and split the figure which is inside according to what I have recounted; and then with skill make two reeds or two astils which are thin, of whose length is according to the length of the eyelid, and their width is lesser than the width of the spatula.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already split at the ends of some parts, where you hold the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then add some with subtlety underneath what is superfluous of the eyelid of the heel, and tighten the reeds from some parts with a strong grip, and leave it for several days, for the tendon will die due to the tightness and turn black and fall off by itself.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it is delayed, then cut it with tweezers, and then cure the poultice until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Then when it is solidified, the eyelid is elevated and the hairs do not sting.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the form of two reeds which you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and have the quantity of length and width neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of elevation of hairs pricked in the heel with a needle when the hair is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the hairs are not natural, hard and rough and sting the heels, then the operation on it is that you take a thin needle and place it in the hair of wool, and then tighten the ends of it very subtly, and not each one in a subtle manner.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the hairs be the quantity of a palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you place another subtle hair underneath it briefly, and tighten the ends of that if you want to.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then place the patient's head towards you, and be in front of the sun so that your work is revealed, for it is a subtle and minute operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle in the root of the hair which has need of cunning, and let it penetrate the eyelid quickly while you pull out the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the hair out from underneath and insert that into the wound, and let there be one or two or three hairs and not more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand with it so that the hair is drawn out, twisted in the eyelid with the natural hair.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is drawn out twisted and the hair is not drawn, you will draw out the wound from underneath with the thread which you have composed there, so that in it is drawn out twisted from the root.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And you will apply it to the eye, and when you remove the bandage and the patch, and clean the eye, and let it remain for two or three days, until the skin adheres to its place and new good flesh is born over it.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the hair is short, then you should attach a long natural hair, and it will be elevated with that, or you can attach it in between so that it is stretched out a little bit, and then you elevate it.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the cure of a growth which comes in the upper eyelid.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When there is a growth in the eye and it is a contraction of the eyelid, either on the right or left side, due to bad consolidation of plague or sectioning or cauterization, and it is called leporina, and this growth, whether natural or accidental, is caused by consolidation of plague or sectioning or cauterization, or something similar.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The manner of the operation on this is that you should split that consolidation and separate its lips, and place in it a piece of linen that is between those two, and ligature them together until they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And be sure not to use remedies for this which cause drying and constriction; because if you do that it will return worse than it was before.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use in that one of the causes which softens, like fenugreek, and steep it in water in which are cooked aniseed and sesame seeds, or ointment of squill, which should be liquefied with some oils, and immerse the piece in that, and heal it with that.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the treasure of your cure is that you should not pierce anything which has not been consolidated according to its shape from the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have described is not but a rectification of the growth which does not return the shape of the place according to what it was before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the cure of a growth which is done in the lower eyelid.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This growth which is done in the lower eyelid, which is called verrraderamente a growth; and it can be natural or accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	More accidental is done by plague or sectioning or cauterization, or others like them.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way of operating on this is that you should take a needle with a double thread, and insert it into the flesh, and make it pass from the tear duct on the left into the tear duct on the right, so that the thread passes through both ends of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	Then stretch out the flesh at its upper ends with the needle and sew it up with the needle, and insert it with a wide spatula.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And if it returns the shape of the eyelid as it should be, that is good; and if not, take the thread and place it in the split figure, and with that convert the eyelid, and sew up both slits on the side of the lower eyelid.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And the ends of the two slits are at the two angles of the incision, which you have made so that they meet, and there is made an angle between them when they come together, and a figure is made from them.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is a Greek letter: the lambda.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	Then stop the flesh that is the length of the side of it below it, that which covers the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	Then sew together the separated parts with the thread of wool; and then heal them with what we have said about the softening remedies, and the poultices until it is healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if the growth occurs due to sectioning or suturing or cauterization, then you should split it with a flat incision over the hairs of the eyelid as has been preceded.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	Then separate them with the poultice between two lips as we have said before.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the total number of words of the cure of a growth when it is above or below, the operation should run according to how it is prepared in the form of a growth, and that is in the form of diverse dots.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the wise artisans always prepare everything in every way which is possible for them so that they may return the figure to its natural shape, or close to it, and the patient according to what he requires from the operation and the instruments in the greatest dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adhesion of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation happens to many people that the eyelid is glued more above the white of the eye, and it is prohibited from the facility of movement and its natural actions, then you should insert the end of the thread below the eyelid, and elevate it up, or stretch it with the unguent.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	Then you should insert the adhesion with a spatula which is not sharp at its edges, having made a small one so that the patient is not distressed after the operation, and remove the spatula so that it does not irritate the eye with its acuity.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And your incision should cut that adhesion with ease so that it is returned the eyelid according to its natural shape, and all the adhesion be healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And then put in the eye salt water with which you wash it, or distill on it water of vitriol dissolved in water.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	Then separate between the eyelid and the eye with poultice of it, and place over the eye wool infused in white of egg, and then the third day use causes of consolidation until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Of incision of the unguis and of eminence of flesh of the tear ducts.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that the unguis is according to two manners, because it is nervous, and is like a hard thin ciphac; or it is not-nervous, like white congelated humidity, which when the iron touches it, or it is forced, takes on the unguent, it is separated and the unguent is not put in it.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both species do not begin unless from the great tear duct, which goes little by little and covers the sight, and prohibits light and the movement of the eye.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	But the way of operating on it is that the patient should close his eye and open his eyes, and elevate the eyelid with your hand, and then gather up the unguis with unguent of little doubling, and stretch it to its upper ends.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	Then take a needle and insert into it a hair of horse or of ox, or of something similar, or of strong pitch, or double the end of the needle little by little and put it in the center of the unguis, and pierce with the needle the unguis; and stretch that to its upper ends, and open up the side of the unguis which is the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And then follow it with the hair into the back of it.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	Then you should insert the remainder in the root of the tear duct with a subtle spatula or small forceps, and cut the flesh of the natural tear duct so that through the incision it does not bring continuous flows of tears.
