E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	Then rest a little; then if the water has gone down, let you lift it up another time before your palm is pushed away.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And so when it is dried up and does not go down, then you remove your palm with ease, and move it a little over the eye; and dissolve in the water a little of clear salt of gemma and wash the inside of the eye with it; and then place on the eye cotton or a pad or wool infused in rosewater and vinegar and let him hold his eye shut.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But we do not do this now, but they who are of our time put it on with cotton infused in rosewater.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if he does not submit to your palm in the instrument of the eye because of its hardness — for it is hard of men whose eye is very hard —, then you see that you take the spatula which is called albarido, of which this is the form:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	Then pierce it with that the conjunctive membrane, and do not press your hand into the cut, and do not force your way to a subtle place.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	Then insert your palm according to what we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And after you have completed your work, let the patient be prepared for sleep in a dark room where he sleeps on his back in a dark room, and all movements are prohibited.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And let him lie still so that his nature may be quieted, and do not move his head to the right or left in any way.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And let him rest according to his condition on the third day.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And let him go back to that dark room and open his eyes wide, and let him see some causes, and then let the condition return on the seventh day.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And do not do this in the time of the baths or at once but also after the infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	After you have removed it so that the water can run freely and violently for a long time.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if suppuration occurs, then let you open the eye on the seventh day and cleanse it with that which eases suppuration.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Then you open his eyes wide and place your hand over his face so that he sees nothing for several days, lying in the dark room.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And let him go to that dark room gradually and converse about his causes.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And you know that it is not permissible for the disciple to see some things, and then you will be anxious about the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And it has already come to us from some of those whose names are in the book of Artach, and some say that fire was made in Ayrac magma which is sucked out, the water.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	However, I have not seen anyone in our land who has perfected this, nor is it written in any of the books of the ancients; and it is possible that it is new.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	These are the ways to prepare the various kinds of magdaad, so that one who is ignorant of them can prepare them.
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they are made from either copper or iron specifically, and the ends of them must have this triangular subtlety, the pointed end just as it is described.
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter 24.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the cure for a nosebleed.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When there are various meats growing inside the nose, of which some cause is found, which is like a scorpion sting, or a polyp, and this disease is called polypus, because it resembles that pe.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And in it there is cancerous, lumpy meat of a dark color; and from it comes the non-dark colored lion meat.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore in that which is not fraudulent or cancerous in the lion meat, cause the patient to sneeze between his fingers and be exposed to the sun, open the nostrils of him, and prick his thumb into that meat.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then draw it out into the split foreskin, and cut off what you have understood from that with a pointed spathe of the one side between which you know that all the meat has been removed; because if anything is left in it of the cause of the separation, then you will easily cut that away with one of the subtle tools.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if there is bleeding or an ulcerated pustule, then you pause it that sneezing; or if they are from the malignant pustules, then you cut and cauterize them that the pus bleeds and all the cavities are exposed.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And then it is put into the nose near the incision with vinegar or water or wine.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and from it there comes moisture into the palate, then know that it has healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the moisture does not penetrate as it sneezes, then know that inside him is meat growing in pus over bones of the nostrils to which there has been no separation.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore then cause him to sneeze and put into him the bile of which there is any thickness, and let fall into him nuts, nut-sized, and place between each nut the quantity of the tip of your finger or less, and cause the patient to sneeze and put one end of the bile into the nostril with the ray or with another cause that it is possible for.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And then that this has been done, that he breathe out his odorant into the canals of the nostrils, and spit it out over his throat, for troops watching him do this action make children in schools, and it is a lighter cause to whoever wants to do so.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then place the two ends of the bile, one end that goes over the nose and the other that goes into the nose, and then administer the cutting of meat with the nuts that are in the bile, and do this until you know that the meats have been cut by the nuts of the bile.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then pull out the bile and place in the nose the abstraction of the blood a cauterization, and do this for three days or more until the paint corrodes everything that is left of the meat.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And then at the end of the cure, place in the nose a lead tube for several days until it has healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you find that the cure is dried out, use that one.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument of a purging cupping-glass with which oils and medicines are distilled into the nostrils.
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And do this from silver or copper, which is like a small open lamp, just like a small hole, and the meat similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you want, make a closed tube just like a cane, and the cup of the purging cupping-glass be flat and uncovered; to which is handled at its end, with which you have that when you heat it in it oil or water that you want from the juices and the sucking causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these are the ingredients for the cupping-glasses: take oil of beaver testicles, white vernal oil, ginger, and long pepper, saffron, pepper and spikenard, each a dram. You mix them with the juice of borage and of celery, and they are made into pills, and one pill is mixed with tepid water, and it is sprinkled into the patient's nostrils sitting up.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of ulcers in the ends of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times an ulcer is born in the ends of the nose, and it is magnified and swollen for several days until it comes to a head.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And for this cause you pierce that in the beginning of its appearance, and drain all of that.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And then place on the spot a cauterization or burning medicine which is placed in the location of it.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if its piercing is delayed until it has become magnified, then consider that it has suppurated, has become hard, of a dark color and of little feeling, then do not touch that with iron which is the cranky ulcer; because many times when you pierce this ulcer in that way great malice comes upon him who.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the ulcer is of lion touch and not of dark color, and its piercing is possible in all of that, then discharge the patient and pierce it with fearlessness, and heal the spot with what drips out and constrict it until it has healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the sewing of the nose and of the lips and of the auricle when the continuity is dissolved by a ulcer or similar.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when solution happens in one of these cartilage, few confer in that operation except in some men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when for any cause of those, you consider that it is fresh blood with your blood, then sew the two lips of the ulcer with sewing, and then heal it until it has healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of solution of continuity are already separated, and each is healed, then cause that you cut each part of its apparent tendon until blood comes out.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then sew the two lips with sewing and strengthen those, and on top of them pulverize blood of dragon and unmixed ashes, and place on the powder a piece of emplaster diafinicon, or of any other of the consolidating plasters, and let that lie for two days or three, and then remove that and change that plaster and let it lie until the sores are healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the manner of sewing is that you add the solution of continuity or with needles just as we have mentioned in the sewing of the belly, or add the solution of continuity with bile just as I have told.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those causes that come in the two lips in the parts inside.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many times in some men in the parts inside of their lips there are some hard ulcers like grass of worms, and some are small and some are large.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore cause that you turn the lips and split each of those duress from all parts, and then the piercing fill up the place with ground sage within that the blood is restricted, and then wash it with vinegar and let it be healed by what has been constricted, until it has healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	On the beginning of meat being chewed on the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	There are blisters on the gums which the ancient ones called albus, then you should suspend that with tweezers or what you have, and pinch its root, and let the pus flow out or the blood.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	Then place on the spot sage that has been cut up into pieces or another powdery astringent or caustic.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if the meat comes back, then you should cut it again secondarily and cauterize it, for then the cautery will not come back.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	On the reason for teeth with iron.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When in the surface of the teeth of the molars and of the incisors, and between the gums are found rough scabs, callouses, and some blisters that are blackened and are made citrine or green within which causes corruption to the gum, and these callouses are made thus.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And so you should make the patient open his mouth between your hands and place his head in your lap, and rub the teeth in which these scabs appear, and cause them to become like sand, so that no other cause remains within them, and this is what makes the blackness and citrinity and others within so they are cleansed.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	So if this is left as in the beginning of the process, it is good; and if not then you should repeat the process over them another day, or on the second or third within which it comes to its final state in what you will.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth have need of many резоры of diverse forms and of many figures according to how they are prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And thus the rasp used for the tooth to be rasped on its molars side is another than that used for rasping between the teeth according to other forms, and these forms of rasps you should prepare them immediately as you will see.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	On the removal of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	You should cure the tooth of its pain with every remedy and delay in its total removal as there is not any cause that prevents the growth of it when removed, for this is a sublime substance that is excused in its removal.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But when the patient is forced to have that tooth removed you should be certain which is the painful tooth, for many times pain deceives the patient and it seems as if it is in a healthy tooth, and you remove that one and the pain does not cease until the diseased and painful tooth is removed, for we have already seen this through operation of the gums.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	So when you are certain which is the painful tooth and that you know well, then you should scrape around the circuit of the tooth with a spathe in which there is some virtue so it is dissolved from the gum all around, and then cut that with your fingers or with thin forceps little by little until you concavitate it.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then grab it firmly with strong tweezers for good speech or stupor strongly, and place the head of the patient between your thumbs which you hold well so he does not move, and then pull the tooth according to rectitude in a manner that you do not break it, nor give greater pain to the patient.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And so if it is not loose, then take one of those instruments and place it beneath all around with ease and force the removal of it thus as it was done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is split or rotten then you should cover that split with a cloth and press it with the end of a thin ray so that it is not broken in the hour of your constriction on it as you hold it with tweezers.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you should open completely by scraping all around the gum and guard much of your strength that you do not break it or cause a split to form from it, and return upon the patient for the wickedness he has done to him.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And guard yourself that you do not do as unskilful barbers do in their foolishness and audacity on the removal of them, who do not administer what we have recommended; for many times they bring upon men great diseases which are more difficult than to be broken, or that you extract those with some bones of the jaw thus as we have testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And then the removal of it is washed in the mouth with wine or vinegar and salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if it still flows blood from there then take some quantity of chalk and sprinkle on the wound, and if that chalk does not help then cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps and tweezers which are used to pull out the tooth at the beginning is of long length, short handle and thick, so that they are not bent when you operate with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And let it be thus as the gross handle within that when you stretch with them they are not bent and are short lengths.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And let it be made of iron from India descendingly made from right angles and in the angles of those there are teeth of which some enter into each other and stretch by strong constriction, and sometimes the angles of those are in the form of a goose beak which has the name ciconia, it is hooked, and they are of strong constriction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the removal of teeth and of the extraction of the bones from the jaws that are broken.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you need the removal of a tooth which is broken then let there be placed on the spot a poultice with boiled water for one or two days until it becomes soft; and then insert your fingers or tweezers at the angles of which some are like the beak of a goose called ciconia, or hooked, the form of the forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The angles of them are made like teeth as with lime or file.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if it does not obey you with these forceps or tweezers then let there be dug into the root and cut away all the meat and insert the instrument which is called atile, it is a small lever of which the form is thus:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And let it be of short length thick in the end and not bent so that it is not broken.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	So if by this the root is loose then it is good and if not help yourself with these other instruments of which these are their forms, the form of the first instrument is triangularly angled in which there is some thickness: the form of the second instrument is of a half circle within which there is some grossness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The form of the second instrument is that it be triangular and more thinly ended.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And now help yourself with this instrument having two ramps of which this is the form, then follow thus:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments which are used in rasuring of teeth for youth is made by this instrument which is assembled to great oncis and this is its form:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	Of the triangularly twisted or short end, which there is some thickness, and it is not bent so that it is not broken.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And know that the instruments of teeth move and likewise similarly to other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the cunning and subtle artesian in the art, attains by himself the materials according to what he means is the operation and diverse diseases, for there are diseases of which the ancients did not tell or give proper instruments, through forms of diverse species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the jaw bone or other bones of the mouth are broken, or if you have sprains then let it be pressed in its place with what is convenient to that of the instruments and of the forceps which we have said in the extraction of the roots of the teeth, and help yourself with the gesture of which this is the form:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And if there is any swelling, let it be reduced little by little, and bound or held with a bandage so that it does not escape or leak until the bone has been punctured; then treat the area with appropriate medicines.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a small pustule on the bone, then open that pustule and draw out its darkness, and cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the cure of teeth that protrude above the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent, not according to their natural form, and especially when this occurs in women, and most especially in elderly women; therefore you should consider: if a tooth is adjacent to another tooth, and it is not possible to cut or file it down, then extract that tooth. But if it is attached to another tooth, then you insert into that tooth an instrument of which this is the shape, and it is similar to a pig's jaw, and it should be made of very acute Indian iron.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And you should make your incision in such a way that you insert it into the tooth for several days according to the hardness of the tooth, and so that no other tooth is affected.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if there is an prominent tooth exposed to filing, then file it with Indian iron file of which this is the shape:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And it should all be made of Indian iron, both the edge and the handle; and it should have very fine points like a file with which needles are made, with which the tooth is filed little by little over several days with ease, so that no other tooth is affected and falls out.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	Then smooth it at the end, and shave it with a very sharp razor.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if there is a tooth of which one part is broken and cuts the tongue, then you should smooth that so that the sharpness of that fracture is removed and blunted, and it is flattened so that the tongue is not cut nor speech impaired.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of the restoration of broken teeth with gold or silver foil.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When there is a concussion and displacement of the teeth due to a blow or falling, and the patient cannot bear to bite down on it, and your treatment with astringent medicines has not worked, then so that they do not fall out, it is useful to strengthen them with gold foil rather than silver, for silver turns black and rots after a few days, but gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the foil should be of such thinness and thickness according to the quantity that can fit between the teeth; and the technique of this is that you take the foil and place twice as much between two healthy teeth, and then let it grow with two twists of the foil between two broken teeth, or if one or several, until the material reaches the healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	Then repeat the twisting between the part from which you began, and strengthen your hand with ease and skill so that it is not broken.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And your twist with which you strengthen the foil should be between the roots of the teeth so that it does not escape.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	Then cut off the excess foil with tweezers or tongs, and join those ends together with wax, and conceal them between the healthy tooth and the broken tooth, so that they do not hurt the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	Then let it set tightly like Roman cement.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or broken, strengthen it or those with other foil in the same way at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the twist between two healthy and two broken teeth, as follows:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when one or two teeth are pushed back into their sockets due to a blow, and they have grown back as we have described, and they break again:
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And it is not done except by skilled and wise artisans.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And some people use cow bones for this purpose, and make it in the shape of a tooth, and place it in the place where the tooth is missing, and strengthen it as we have said, and they remain and serve with it for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the incision of the membrane which comes in the tongue and prohibits speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This membrane which comes underneath the tongue sometimes occurs naturally or accidentally and happens due to a wound that has already healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation on it is that the patient opens his mouth, and you raise his tongue, and then cut that nervous membrane according to the width so that the tongue is loosened from its attachment.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or knotting, and it has been caused by the hardening of a wound, then you heat oil and cut that according to the width through which you cut the membrane so that the knot is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful that there is not a tear in the flesh of the lip and that you split the membrane and cause blood to flow.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	Then wash the area of the incision with wine or vinegar or water rubbed with vinegar, and then place the tongue in a relaxed position; this is what the patient should do every night so that it does not harden again.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if blood flows from it, place powdered vitriol on the spot; but if the blood clings to it, then cauterize the area with a red-hot cautery that is appropriate for this.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with the other causes so that it heals.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Of the extraction of a ranula under the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes there occurs underneath the tongue an apostema similar to a small onion that prohibits the tongue from its natural movement, and it is enlarged when it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation on it is that the patient opens his mouth widely and you examine the apostema.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it of a dusky or black color, hard, and the patient feels nothing, then do not touch it because it is rotten.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is inclined toward whiteness and there is moisture in it, then you put oil on it, and cut it with very thin spatulas, and cut it all around; and if blood flows when you operate on it, then you place powdered vitriol on it, so that the blood is constricted.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then return to your work so that it has been treated with wine and salt, and treat it with the other treatment so that it heals.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of an apostema from two ears and that which is nothing in the gullet, and of other apostemas.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When pus occurs in the gullet and they are glands which are attached to each other like almonds, and they come out from the ears, and when you treat them with what we have said in the division and it is not healed, then consider if the apostema is hard, dusky-colored, with little sensation, then do not touch it with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is red-colored and the root is thick, then do not touch that with iron because of the flowing blood; before you let it set so that it hardens, then either you will pull it out or break it up itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is white-colored and the root is thin, then that is what should be cut.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on it is that you consider, before your operation, if the apostema has rested due to being cauterized with complete rest or if it has diminished due to any diminution; and then let the patient open his mouth in front of the sun, and his head be in the usual position, and the servant place his hands between their knees, and the server press the tongue of the patient away from below with a noble instrument of which this is the shape:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	Let it be made of silver or of bronze, and let it be thin as a needle.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Therefore, when you press upon it with your finger and the ulcer is revealed to you, and you put upon it your medicine, then take a needle and pierce that into the wound, and draw out from there as much of the humor as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another thing is that you should withdraw some cause from the membranes, and then cut into that with an instrument in the form of which this is.
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and is like a pair of tongs, except that the ends of it are bent, so that the aperture of each one is facing that of the other, very sharp, and made from iron which has been tempered.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not available to you, then cut into it with a spatula, of which the shape of this is: and let it be sharp on one side, but not on the other.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And then after you have cut one slit, cut the other according to this manner of cutting, and then let the patient be healed from water which has been rubbed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is bleeding instead, then heal it with water of the cooking of the husk of a pomegranate or of the leaf of a myrtle and similar to that of the causes which constrict within so that the flow of blood is restricted, and then cure that until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes it is seen in the gullet other ulcers other than those two ears, and cut into those according to what I have said about the cutting of two slits evenly.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I have already treated a woman of an ulcer which had come in her throat, that ulcer extending to the color brown, with little feeling, and which had already closed her throat, and the woman was breathing with difficulty, and had already prohibited eating and drinking water, and she had already been brought to death if not for one day or two.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the ulcer had pushed so much that it had caused two bumps where pus came out through two holes.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore I cut into it skillfully and put my finger in one of them, and I drew out that, and a great portion came out of him, and then I cut into that where I understood the other hole to be, and then I bound his mouth, and pressed his tongue, and then I put my finger in that ulcer.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I cut away a great portion of it, and not much blood ran from him but a little.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	And then the throat of that woman was freed, and she began immediately to drink water, and then took food, therefore I did not cease cutting into that ulcer many times over a long time, and another ulcer came in place of that one which I cut while it was prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore I cut and cauterized her throat again, therefore after a few days; and then I wandered and did not know what God had done to that, therefore I am astonished.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter .xxxvii.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	Of cutting of the veil when it is ulcerated.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When there is discharge from the membrane and it is ulcerated and long, then it is called a perpendicular ulcer; and if it is in the part below thick and round, then it is called a bubo.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is healed with the water which we have said in the division, and does not yield to your treatment, and you see that the ulcer cauterizes there and is thin, then beware that you cut into that which is added around round; and if it is to that length, and is bloody, of brown color or black, and there is no feeling in it, then beware that you do not cut into it, for there is fear over the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see that according to the manner which I have said of its whiteness and length, that you make the patient fast and press his tongue with an instrument in the form of which is the process of it, and then put your finger into the new one, and draw out that one downward and cut into that with one of two instruments of which I have spoken about the cutting of two slits.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And beware that you do not cut into that except what is set over the natural term by addition, for if you cut more of it, you will injure his speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And after the cutting, use that which we have recommended in the cutting of two slits, and heal that until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is frightened by the cutting of it, beware that you use the cautery on it without fear, and the manner of the cautery in him is not but with acute water, and it is that you hold the head of the patient in your lap, and then press his tongue with the instrument which we have said, and then take the water which we have spoken about in the chapter of cauterization, and apply with that cause alive, and pause that not thick nor thin, and from that fill the cavity of the instrument of which this is the form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the end of it be concavitated in which is paused the medicine thus with the concavity of spoon, and pause the instrument with the medicine over the ulcer, and let the patient lie on his side so that run saliva or mucous from the mouth of him so that not descend any cause upon the throat of him and that flow that.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then hold your hand over the medicine, and express that over the uvula over the space of about half an hour until you see that become blackened and sedated by the biting of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take thread and wrap that around the end of the rod, and submerge the thread in the medicine, and insert the rod with the thread in a tube of above so that the thread adheres in that tube, and do that as many times until you accomplish what you want from the cauterization of the uva, and then let it fall when it is dried and after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that it iterates the medicine, iterate that, and then after the cauterization wash off in the circle of the uva with a rod which is dipped in vinegar, and cleanse with that what is in the circle of him from the medicine, and let it be washed with water which has been rubbed, and let it be healed outside with embrocation, and within with ointments until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of treatment is more safe than cutting and also less frightening.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is healed with that which is more thin than cauterization and cutting, for it is healed by sub-fumigation in this manner: take calamen, hyssop, origano, ruda, arabic scinche, camomilla, and bruised and similar to those of the herbs, and mix all those causes, or some of them, in a wave, and let them be dipped in vinegar water, and boil; and let the wave be washed with decent lye, and let there be in the middle of the wave a hole, upon which is paused an instrument which is made of silver or bronze.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And let the end be inserted in the mouth of the patient so that the vapor goes to the uvula over the quantula, until the uvula is very fogged.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then iterate over that many times until it is dried, and beware that you do not do this treatment at the beginning of the aliment of ulcers, for too much would constrict in the ulcer, and not beware that you do that unless after the declaration of cautery of the ulcer.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if that instrument is not available to you, then take a cane and put at the end of it a plug of wood, so that the mouth of the patient be bent, for the plug of wood prohibits the vapor from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is beneficial for health.

Capitol .xxxix.	Here is the text with the translation you requested:
