Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	Here is the translation of the text:
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are many kinds, from many sources, as one will see in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they differ in their opening and section by two ways, one of which is through the nature of the abscess itself; the other is through the moisture that is contained within it.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is according to the location in which they occur, for an abscess on the head is different from one that occurs on the bottom; and an abscess at a muscular site is different from one that occurs at a joint; and each of these has its own treatment through operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And among abscesses there are some which should not be opened, but rather allowed to mature until the pus is discharged from them or they are completed.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And there are other abscesses which should be opened when they are cross; and they are not matured according to their nature, such as abscesses that are near joints, for an abscess when it approaches a joint, its essence is prolonged into the pores of its surroundings, and strongly corrupts the tendons or nerves of that joint, through which there occurs contraction of that member; or it is an abscess near a principal member, and if you delay its opening until it matures, it will harm the principal member; or it is near the bottom, therefore open it so that it does not mature, but rather one that is near the bottom, so that its pressure may not increase, lengthen into the parts within the bottom, and a fistula be made, or that there be made in the end of it what may not heal.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But you should know the time of opening an abscess, and that is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you should know that it is matured when there is a decrease in pain and fever, and an approprate decrease in heat and pulse, and the sharpening of the head of the abscess, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And because you should know the opening to be made in the most low part of the abscess and from pus coming from the healing of the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the opening is always to be made through the length of the flesh or the body, if the abscesses are in parts of the hands or feet, and at places of the veins, of the cords of the nerves, of the tendons; and, finally, in all places alike from which there is reflection; for those in which there is reflection, use opening according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is at a muscular site, it is better that you delay its opening until its digestion is confirmed according to its nature; for if you open it before this, there will be lengthening of the pore of it and much filthiness, and strongly the lips of it will be hardened and its depth.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses are opened according to the breadth of the flesh or the body through necessity, or according to that of which the member is in need.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should administer small opening in small abscesses, and large opening and ample or many incisions in great abscesses according to the diversity of their size.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And others are of abscesses in which the membrane is hollowed out and incised when it has been made in such a way that bread is done to it, and it is done in term that it was already, as well as that which occurs in trops of doubt and of blisters.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those there are that are cut with three angles; and of those in which it is cut in the figure of a bay-leaf, as well as the abscesses of the angles.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And there are some in which round section and lunar section is administered, and similar to those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But that at which there is not head as of superficial abscesses, you should open it with superficial opening or plain incisions only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the abscess is great and has collected much pus, you should open it and not be afraid to extract all of its pore in that hour; after having extracted some from it, you should then pack the abscess so that there is a filling within it for another day, and again after having extracted a greater part, you should do this many times according to degree until it is foro-getat.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of weak nature or a pregnant woman, or small child, or old in decrepitude, for the animal spirit is many times resolved by the exit of pus, and strongly the patient dies, and you operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Therefore guard this chapter with great caution, and when you open the abscesses in which you operate on these abscesses, after having washed the wound consider if there is little pus or the section is flat, then administer leeches of larch or oak-tree; but if the abscess is great, and the fissures of the opening are many, then you should pause a hook in each piercing until they come together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess there is a part of the membrane cut or hollowed out at its perimeter, then you should complete it with old linen or thread made of linen-yarn, as well as when you have extracted pus or roots, without moisture; and strengthen it on the third day; and then process it and heal it with that which one of the ointments within until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if blood occurs in the hour of your operation, then you should administer water mixed with vinegar in which one of linen is, and pause it upon the place of the flow of the blood many times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the flow of blood persists, then you should administer regime and cure, and powders which I have recommended in many places of this book and of division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in the time of winter, and the location of the abscess is a place of many nerves, then you should mix powder with wine and oil, and pause them upon the locations.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in the summer, and the locations are muscular, then you should pause powders dampened with water and oil or wine and oil, and all of this should be rubbed until the third day as we have said, then you should dissolve the abscess and wash it and administer in its cure that which to it convenes until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is that which is necessary of the knowledge of the cure of abscesses universally, but according to the way of distinction I have said of every abscess in what manner is its way of cure by chapters singularly.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of section of abscesses which occur in the membrane of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the membrane of the head there are small abscesses, and they are of species of nodes which contain membranes that are to them made; and their species is many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And from them there are pustules, and from those one contains moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And from those are ones that contain moisture similar to powder, and resembling it; and there are some that are scaly, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all, and in the extraction of these there is not fear, as one must the extension of those does not contradict artery.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in section of these is that you express those with an instrument the form of which see there, the which is called entromes, so that you know that it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if that which is contained is moisture, then cut this with section according to length by superficial section according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And he begins at the section of the line of B. into the line of G. Therefore when the moisture is evacuated, then you scrape that which contains that moisture, and do not seek any cause from that, for many experienced physicians return, if something remains from that cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then immerse the wound in Egyptian ointment, if available, and if not, in water and salt; and fill it with that, and leave it until the next day, for with that you will dissolve all that is broken of that membrane.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then apply Egyptian ointment a second and third time on the wound if you are confident that there is no cause from that membrane; then heal the wound with ointment until it is cured.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if an abscess contains a hard nodule, then you cut into that according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with a cross-shaped incision, and cut between the two lips of the incision and scrape that entirely out from the membrane that contains it, and exert your strength in extracting the lining which contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your arrow causes you trouble, then do what I told you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do for an abscess which is suppurating with an incision and treatment as we have said before; and an incision on a suppurating abscess is easier, because it contains little pus and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are some of these abscesses which are on the head in some people, for whom there is not any moisture; and the cause is that I incised an abscess on the head of an old woman and found the abscess like a hard, rough, white stone, which could not be broken up, and if someone hit it, it hurt.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in the other abscesses which occur on the head, it is not like this, as with the abscesses which come to the heads of children and because of the roots of the ears; but the incision for these should be superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause at the penetration of those in the lower part of them, so that the body is relieved from the sanies to the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Then treat those with what is appropriate for that type of treatment.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter .XLVII.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of an incision on scrofula which occurs in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Often these abscesses occur in the neck and armpits and in the groin; and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those which occur in the neck, and many of them are engendered among themselves; and all scrofula of these is within its own membrane, and so with the nodules and abscesses of the head, as we have described.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the species of these scrofula are many; for some are stony, and some contain moisture, and some are malignant and do not submit to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore in that which you see with a good disposition in the touch, of which the color of what is seen is close to the color of the skin, and is swollen to all parts, and is not attached to the nerves of the neck, or the veins, or the artery, and is not deep, then you cut into that with a superficial incision from above to below the body along the line of G. into the line of B., and scrape that entirely out, and cut between its two lips with an incision, or with many incisions if you have need of those, as we said in the abscesses of the head; and extract that little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more cautious that the vein or nerve not be cut.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And be careful that the spatulum not strike suddenly, so that it does not hit your hand with an incision, or upset the patient, and cut into what is not necessary to be cut; for if you incised a vein or artery and prohibited yourself from your operation, then stop in the wound vinegar mixed with trass or other powders which stop the flow of blood, and close the wound, and leave it until that subsides the acuteness of the abscess, and becomes soft, and begins to become suppurating.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is stopped.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation until you have finished.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	Then inquire with your finger if any cause remains of the other little scrofula; then incise those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if there is a great vein in the root of the scrofula, then you should not incise that scrofula at its roots.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	But if you see that it falls by itself without harm, then leave that alone.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the wound with old ointment which you have already immersed in Egyptian ointment, and then heal that.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incised that scrofula entirely, then you should attach the two lips of the wound and cauterize it so that no suppuration remains.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is suppuration because of the greatness of the scrofula, then you should understand how to incise its root, and drain that and administer a poultice and what is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And those of the scrofula which contain moisture, pierce that with a superficial incision where you see the place of its maturity to be, and pause an incision so that it drains the pus from below the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	Then administer an incision, poultices with ointment and similarly to those, so that it dissolves what is broken in the corrosion.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	Then when you see the wound already cleaned, then heal that with ointment of generative flesh until it is cured.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter .XLVIII.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of an incision on a boil which occurs in the gullet.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	Others before us made this incision in the pilhot, and I have not seen anyone in our land who had that done.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And that is the inscription of their name.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men who have a hernia, then the extraction of the pilhot should be avoided, so that all the veins and the greater nerves of the patient are not cut.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have abscesses cauterized in the mouth or gullet or two ears, when the illness is not in the neck, then they should avoid an incision of the pilhot so that they avoid the danger which is done by penetration.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Then when we want that, let us incise the pilhot below three circles of the circles of the pilhot, or four with small incision for the width in that which is between two circles for quantity; and the incision should be in the pharynx, not in the cartilage, and that place is convenient for incision, because it is deprived of flesh, and the vessels of blood from him are long.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the patient is timid, then let the doctor stretch the gullet with an incision, and then cut the gullet so that it penetrates into the canal, but avoid the vessels of blood if he sees from those any cause.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	Then incise the pharynx according to what we have recommended; and it is understood from the incision of the gullet by the flame which comes from him who is broken, and from the incision of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Then when the hour is swollen in which the penetration is seen, unite the two lips of the wound of the pharynx, and cut that only to the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that promote the growth of new flesh where it is needed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Al-Bukhari says that the meaning of this discourse which we have narrated is merely this: sometimes some of these abscesses have forced open the gullet of the patient; the patient has died, his bowels are protruded and some people cut into the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe on the spot where the plague is located and thus be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this reason I command the opening of the pustule to be left open until the poison of the illness is expelled; and this poison lasts for three days; and then when the pustule is opened and treated in this manner, it will heal.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen with my own eyes is that a servant held a pillow to his mouth and inserted the end of a pulmonary tube into his gullet; I was called to treat him, and when I discovered the pustule, I found blood coming out of it in small quantities.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	And then he was made to confess that he had not punctured a vein or a nerve, and the wind escaped from the pustule and it healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And nothing happened to the servant unless he breathed through his mouth; then, after a few days, he returned to his usual condition.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that there is no fear in puncturing the epiglottis.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of an incision on an abscess which occurs outside the gullet and is called a gullet hernia.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This hernia of the gullet is called a great abscess depending on the colour of the body, and it occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it happens in two ways: either naturally or accidentally.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And the natural one is incurable.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one happens in two ways: the first is like fatty nodes and the other is like an abscess which occurs due to a knotted artery, and there is danger in that.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And one should not make an incision on it with an iron instrument except in the case of a small one.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you should probe it and examine it with your finger; and if you find it like a fatty node and not attached to any vein, then you should open it in the same way as nodes, and extract all that the skin and bursa contain; otherwise, you should probe its whole substance, and treat the place with something suitable for healing until it is cured.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the sections of nodal tumours.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are various kinds of nodes, and I have already described all their types in Division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And what I will now account for is the difference between a node and an exit wound which causes doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	And I say that an exit wound is accompanied by heat, fever and violent pains until the ebullition of the superfluous matter ceases; and there is complete putrefaction when the fever, pain and heat subside.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But a node is not accompanied by heat, fever or pain; it contains its own sac.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it depends on the colour of the body; its beginning is like a cyst and it occurs due to vacuousness, being either greater or lesser in size, and they are of two kinds: either fatty and containing moisture whose colours I have described in Division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you come to treat a nodal tumour, you should probe it and examine its beginning with an instrument called an intrometer, depending on the form which will be described in the following chapter.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And this is the manner of examining an abscess and any node: you should take this instrument and insert it into the most moist part of the abscess which you find, and turn the instrument with a small movement until you know that it has penetrated the membrane.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	Then stop your hand according to the size of the abscess, extract the instrument and consider what has come out through its orifice.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the moist matter has run out, regardless of its colour, then you should open it with a superficial incision as I have said in the case of other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moist matter coming out through the orifice of the instrument, then you should know that it is fatty.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry it with an incision having a cruciform shape according to this shape:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	cut it in this way and suspend it with hooks, and excise the membrane from all parts with ease, and keep the skin or sac over it, if you can, and extract that pus from the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken in the operation, it is not possible to extract that pus; it happens many times that you should extract it little by little so that nothing remains inside which could cause any harm.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if anything remains inside, a little or a lot, the node returns as before.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that a little remains inside, then complete the pustule with some caustic and corrosive powders, close the pustule and place your hand over it as before, and cure it by another method until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large node, then cut its two lips and cure it with that which is encrusted.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if the vein is pulsating or not, then cut and plug the place of the pulsatil vein which is opposite to it with a mixture of quicklime and vinegar and close that for two or three days until the pustule has suppurated and the effusion of blood has ceased; then return to opening what is broken in the node.

Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter XLVII.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the cure of the breasts of men, which are like those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some men's breasts are swollen because of the act of sleeping with women, and then they become like women's breasts, swollen and pendulous.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when you have done this, cut into those with a lunar incision according to this form, from the line of B to the line of G, and then remove the swollen flesh completely, and fill the wound with medicated ointment, and sew up the two lips of the wound, and cure that part which is healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast droops towards the armpit and is made soft by its weight, as in women, then it should be cut into two parts on either side with two incisions resembling a lunar figure, of which each part contains the other according to its end, so that the longer line contains the shorter according to this form, from the line of B to the line of G. And then remove the swollen flesh completely, and stitch up the lips of the wound, and administer what we have said about the sewing and the powders, which is necessary in the cure, until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of that which must be cut for the inquietude of the patient and for the flow of blood, then fill the wound with cotton soaked in corrosive ointment and leave that part until it is corroded by the ointment, and then cure that part which is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter XLVIII.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of the piercing of abscesses which come from beneath the armpits.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses which come from beneath the armpits are of the species of scrofulae, hard, containing a pus sac.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And some contain moisture; and those which contain moisture should be cut with a lunar incision thus: from the line of G to the line of B. And when all the pus is evacuated from that in the abscess of the armpit, then fill it with yellow ointment and leave it for another day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And then the wound is healed with a convenient ointment until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the abscess of the species of nodules and scrofulae, then cut it thus as we have said in the incision about scrofulae, equally.

Capitol .xlix.	Chapter XLIX.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Of the incision of abscesses which occur by artery or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is broken and the vein is closed over it, then many times abscess occurs by artery or vein: for when the abscess is by artery it is long drawn out into the body; and when it is driven in by the veins, it feels in the place as a string does.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is by vein is drawn around the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And the incision upon this abscess is error, and greater in that which is beneath the armpits, and in the angles, and on the neck, and in many parts of the body; and it is greater, therefore, when its cure with the iron is avoided, and that which is in the extremities, or on the head, let it be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But upon that which is of them by inflammation from the orifice of the artery, cut into the vein in its length; and then open the incision with pincers and then the artery, and free it from the tissues as far as it is uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	Then place an needle on the spot and make it penetrate to the other side, and tighten the artery with a double thread in two places — which causes you to lose your breath due to the constriction of two arteries located in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	Then pierce the area between the two muscles with a spatulum so that all of the blood is drained from it and the boil is dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then administer treatment to the area in which pus is formed so that the muscles are released from tension; and cure it with an appropriate ointment until it heals.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an apostema caused by a cut vein, then you must hold with your hand the area of the apostema with the thread, and insert the needle below the spot where your hand has been holding, and make it penetrate; and have a double thread inside so that you extract it from the other side, and bind the apostema with a good ligament according to what I told you in the ligament of grapes into two parts with two ends of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you are afraid of pulling out the thread, then insert the thread with that needle below all the apostema towards the incision of the first needle, and tighten your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the apostema in the middle of it so that when it is dried out you insert the superfluity of the thread, and leave what is tied to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then place on it a powder which you have soaked in wine and oil, and administer the treatment made with eggs and ointments until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 1 On the apostema which happens due to twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	As it happens with apostemas in arteries and veins, so apostemas happen in nerves when they experience impact or due to excess work and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is mostly formed in the places of the assistants or the ankle, or in any place where joints are injured.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a serious apostema, and is similar in color to the rest of the body, and there are six symptoms of it when it is constricted with vehemence, and the patient experiences a stupor-like sensation.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an apostema located in the abdomen, and for that reason it has no thread, and it is injured on every side, and does not go to the sides in front or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore for those who have apostemas in their joints do not need to be bound with iron, because they will experience contraction very quickly.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But for the one who has it on the head or forehead, cut the thread with a spatulum.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small apostema, then grab it with tweezers and pull it out by its roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then suspend it with a hook, and cut it open, and draw it out; and stitch the wound closed, and cure it until it heals.
Capitol .li.	Chapter .ii.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On the section of apostema which happens due to chyle that happens in the abdomen.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	This happens to some men a few times in their bellies and in the other parts of their bodies, those whose heads are small and the rest of them are like mushrooms due to similarity to mushrooms, whose roots are thin but their caps are large; and already their lips are twisted, and they are either very petite or highly magnified.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have indeed seen one such person, and in his belly there were two things which looked like mushrooms, and there was no difference between them and white ones, with thin roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already their lips were reversed and splitting, and humidity flowed from them all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore I opened them up and found in one of them 15 small stones. And the other six inches.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation at the incision of them is that you consider whether the patient is cold, and if the color of the wound is white, then you open it with a spatulum from the side, and let it be cauterized in the fire, because many times after the section some blood is expelled; and if you stop the blood, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the patient is fearful and anxious, be cautious about making an incision with iron; but take recent lead thread and tighten it on the wound, in the manner which we have described earlier; and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then adjust in the tightening of the lead thread; therefore, do not stop from tightening the large thread greatly on the wound until it is cut off and falls by itself.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the wound is of thick roots, then in its incision there is a cause for fear and terror, especially that which is in the abdomen.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible for you to split the majority of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	Then cure it until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And beware that you do not assume to incision a wound which is of dusky color, of little feeling, of weak pulse, because this one is certainly cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I come with the memory of knowledge.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter .ii.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the treatment of an outstanding umbilicus.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Eminence of the umbilicus is caused by many reasons; or by fissures of the liver which is over the abdomen, and from it the membrane or intestine according to where other ruptures are; or by blood which flows from a vein or artery as mentioned earlier, or by constricted vasoconstriction in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is by fissure of the liver and thickening of the membrane, then the color of the apostema is similar to that of the body; and it has little pain, and appears in various locations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is by prolapse of the intestine, then its location is as we have mentioned earlier, with more violent diversity, and when you push it in with your fingers it conceals itself, and then returns; and quickly it becomes large, and is magnified much due to bathing and violent work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is by humidity, then it is easy and does not conceal itself when you push with your hand, nor is it constricted nor burned.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is by blood, then with these signs the apostema turns black and declines.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is by pus, then it is a serious apostema, large and hard, and is formed according to an amount.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is by vasoconstriction, then the touch of it is tender.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on it is that you consider whether the eminence of the umbilicus is by blood of an artery or vein, or by vasoconstriction; then beware of treating it because in that there is fear and terror as I instructed in the chapter about apostemas by artery and vein.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the eminence of the umbilicus is by the intestine or membrane, then command the patient to hold his navel, and let him stand extended; then feel with your fingers all around the umbilicus, and then command him to bend towards you between your hands over his navel, and let him circle it with a spatulum from the side where you have felt with your fingers; then extend the majority of the apostema to the sides above it with a large hook; and tie in the circuit with strong thread or with twine in the decent manner.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	Then open the middle of the extended apostema over the intestine and insert your finger into that hollow and if you have tied it nor guarded by the intestine, then extract the herniated and push the intestine to the sides inside the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the hernia, then take it in your hand; and squeeze out the superfluities from it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your archery or vein, then surround that spot, and return to your operation; and take two needles and put them into those two warts very firmly, and pierce through the wart in a cross shape, making sure the needles penetrate; and tightly grab the wart in four places on the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and let the flesh extend and fall back by itself; or squeeze out what is being thinned and let it heal with ointment covering the wound so that it may be healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the protuberance of the navel is filled with flesh or by humidity, then you must hollow out the hernia as we have said and squeeze out the blood or humidity which you find there, and then cure it with ointment covering the wound so that it may be healed and consolidated.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53:
De curacio de cranc.	Of the cure for a hernia.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said, in the division, about the kind of hernia and how it is cured by medicines, and that it is cured with iron without being ulcerated; and we have also mentioned the generation of a hernia, as well as the caution regarding its cure.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that sometimes a hernia is found in places where its removal is possible, such as in the breast or in the groin and similar places in other parts of the body; they advised to extract all of it, especially when it is starting out small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and large, do not attempt to remove it, for I have never seen one healed by this method nor have I heard of it happening.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation on it, when it is located as we have said, is that you precede and let the patient fast and purge of black bile, and then bleeding is done if a manifest fullness is found.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	Then prepare the patient with a preparation in which he is placed for the operation, and then pierce him with hooks that reach into the hernia; and concavely, all around with a good sharp knife, examine thoroughly so that no cause of the hernia remains.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	Let the blood flow, and do not quickly cut it off; squeeze out the places and wipe away the clotted blood with your hand or with an instrument through which you can easily reach.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if you find that there is an obstruction of blood from a vein or artery, then cauterize it so that the flow of blood ceases, and then cure it with the other cure so that it may be healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 54:
De curacio de ydropici.	Of the cure for hydrocephalus.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recommended in the division about the kinds of hydrocephalus from water, and the signs of each kind, as well as the cure for it with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is cured by iron is only the kind called 'althitas', and it should not be approached with iron as regards the kind of 'timpanistres' nor the kind of 'ypotarcha', for both are mortal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have medicated this kind of hydrocephalus timpanistre with medicines and it does not respond to your treatment, then consider, for if the patient already has debility or another malady such as another hydrocephalus, just as if there is a cough or intestinal illness and similar to these, then be wary and do not treat it with iron, for fear of this.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient suffering from abundant vertigo and there is no other malady in him except hydrocephalus, and he is not a child nor old, then the manner of operating on him is to elevate the patient between your hands, and the minister should then squeeze his belly with his hand, filling the water up into the part below the navel, and then take a pointed spatula according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It should be in two pointed parts, with a pointed end just like the spatula; but indeed it should be a little shorter in length so that during the operation you do not pass into the intestine, and then lead him.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	Then consider if the generation of hydrocephalus is from parts of the intestines, for then you should lengthen him with the incision from the navel by the amount of three digits below, in his right side over the navel.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of hydrocephalus is due to illness of the liver, then your incision should be on the left side of the navel by three digits.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if its generation is due to a cold, then your incision should be on his right.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not let your incision be over the side on which the patient wants to lie so that the superfluities do not flow into that place.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	Then pierce with the instrument all around, and insert into that incision, and elevate your hand with the spatula between the membrane and the brain, and you should draw it out; and if it is the amount of a nail or so much.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	Then pierce the brain so that the spatula reaches the desired place, which is where the water is.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then extract it and insert an instrument of which this is the form:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	which is like a slender silver tube; it is made of silver or brass or lead; and in the lowest part of it there is a small incision, and on its sides there are three incisions: two from one side and one from the other side; and its end is split according to the manner of a feather, just like this:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And in the highest end of it is a ring, for when the instrument reaches the water, then that immediately slips over the instrument, thus evacuating the water in the momentary quantity; for if you evacuate more than this, then the patient dies from resolution of his animal spirit, or he experiences an attack which is close to death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But you should evacuate it according to the quantity of the vertigo and according to what the dispositions of the patient's vertigo, his pulse and health indicate to you.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	Then extract the instrument and pour out the water which is causing it, for as soon as you have extracted the instrument, it will pour out just like the water.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	Then return the instrument on another day if you see the patient tolerating it, and extract a little water, and do this for several days out of fear, and beware of mistakes so that the water does not remain except a little.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you fear for the patient and pour out a great quantity of water, then cure him with a burial in dry sand, and move him to the bath, and let him stay in the sun for a long time; and cure him with drying medicines so that he may be healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize over the stomach, and the liver and gallbladder, and especially the extraction of the water, according to what I have recounted before.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55:
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	Of the cure for children whose places of urine are not perforated.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes some children are born from the womb of their mother and their head of their mixture is not perforated (or it is pierced tightly or not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Then it must be treated with the piercing of him as soon as he is born with a pointed, slender instrument just like this:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then insert a thin lead nail into the wound and bind it, and keep it for three days or for .iiii. three.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when he wants to urinate, let him be turned over and urinate; then return him.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not use the lead, it is possible that the urine which goes over the area will not harm this closure.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But he from whom the wound is narrow should be medicated with a lead nail, as we have said, for several days until it is enlarged.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But those in whom the wound is not in its place, are led, the cause of which is that from those, he who is born and the nail is at the end of the penis so that he cannot urinate into the parts inside, by raising the penis with his hand to the parts above; and there is no generation for him because the sperm cannot reach the mother according to rectitude, and it is a very harmful disease.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the way of the operation in him is that the patient be turned over on his back, and you extend the head of the penis with your left hand by a violent traction, and insert the tip of the foreskin at the location of the perineum with a pointed spatula, as if it were inscribed with a pen, or that you do not scrape any part, so that the glans of him come to resemble the head of the penis, and the nail falls into the middle location according to how it covers.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And beware in your operation of the flow of blood, because many times this happens there; and give to him that with which you will stop the blood, and cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter .lvi.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of white leeching which happens in the foreskin on the head of the penis, and of putrefaction, blackness, and adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Many times this white leeching happens in the penis and is an eminence of harmful flesh.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And one of them is harmful and the other is not harmful.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	Non-harmful, suspend it with a thin thread and cut that off so that that entire world is cut off; and then place on that cut part which is submerged in Egyptian ointment; and then cure that with fine ointment until it is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the leeching is harmful, of leg color, then you should administer cauterization near its beginning and its end.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	But if the leeching is in the foreskin of the head of the penis not circumcised, and one part of the leeching is inside the foreskin and the other part is outside, then you should cut off the leeching which is inside at its beginning so that it is consolidated; and then you cure that external one, because when you cure that together with the foreskin, it is not certain that it will not return.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And indeed it has happened in the testicles and in the foreskin blackness and putrefaction, therefore you should hollow out all that which is already blackened and about to corrupt or what is already corrupted; and then line that with that ointment with honey, which is crushed with pomegranate peel, and sifted and strained.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And then cure that with the other cure until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if blood flow ensues, then administer lunar cauterization according to this form:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	Because the beneficial cautery is in two dispositions together, that is for blood flow and for the wound when it is corrupted.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is destroyed and ruined all at once, then you should insert into the middle of the foreskin a lead cannula so that the patient urinates through that.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis (and this adhesion does not happen except in him whose foreskin is loose, and on whom circumcision has not been performed; and when adhesion happens because of a wound or pustule), cut it with an obtuse spatula so that the binding is dissolved and the head of the penis is freed from all parts.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to separate them cruelly, then you should cut with a spatula some part of the head of the penis and the foreskin, and that is because the foreskin, when it is thin, is easily pierced through its thinness quickly.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And then separate between the foreskin and the head of the penis with a subtle thread, which is already moistened in the water wiped so that they do not adhere again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then let it be cured with white vitriol until it is consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter .lvii.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of purification of children and the cure of what happens to those who are circumcised.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution for continence like other wounds: but rather because it is of our operation and of our will, and because its cause is properly in children, it is necessary that we assign to her better operation and a shorter way lost less health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore we say that the ancients did not prescribe circumcision in any of their slaves, because they do not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired through experience, which cause is that we have observed the greater part of the artisans and barbers using to circumcise and purify with a new knife and with torches; and they use binding with pitch and inscription with the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.
