And I have already prohibited all these manners and not found better purification with tweezers, with binding with pitch which is used in purification with the nail, because many times the thread escapes above, because the thread of the foreskin has two tunics, and the loose one falls below, and it is easily forced to another incision and secure pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And through purification which is done by the apothecaries, and is with the finger, of which the surgeons use, is not secure the incision at the end of the member of a man, because it easily goes into his wound.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in the operation with the nail, very often iron and corrupts your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the foreskin of a child is short by nature, and many times I have seen that it has not needed purification, and I have seen that.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But of the purification which is done with tweezers and binding with pitch, the goodness I have discovered by experience, because the tweezers are of proportional incision, therefore that the acuteness which is above is also with the acuteness which is below; and therefore when you place your hand so that they are proportioned two acutenesses, and insert it according to a comparison at one time; and compression of the pitch is done in the shape containing the foreskin of the penis from all parts, with which there is no error of all.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the way of the first operation is that you make the child be completely still if he is one of those who understand a little, and do not do but that you tie the pitch on his penis only slightly, and that you let him for another day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then let him rejoice in all those ways which are possible for you who receives his intelligence.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And then let him be between your hands positioned preparedly, and do not be frightened; and conceal the tweezers in your hand or under your foot, so that the child does not see those nor any other of the instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And then insert your hand to his penis and blow into the foreskin, and pull that up so that the head of the penis is exited, and then purify that of what is accumulated in it of dirtiness.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And then tie the marked spot with a folded piece of cloth, and then tie a smaller piece of cloth under it, and then press on the spot with your finger and gently stretch the area below with good traction, and cut between two ligaments.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then elevate the scrotum gently and pull out the head of the testicle; and then let the blood flow slowly, for it is better that way; and put powder on top and on top of the powder place a cloth which has been spread with the yolk of a hen's egg mixed with rose oil; and let this remain there until the next day; and heal the wound with ointment until it is cured.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The shape of the forceps for cleansing, this is their shape:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Let the tips not be cut and the other ones be cut, so that the stem of the claw is not split, and let the length of both sharp parts be equal to the length of two handles equally.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	But the mistake in cleansing is that often the inner scrotum entirely escapes, or a part of it slips out through the incision.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	So you should extend that one with your finger in front of the apposition of the spot and cut that one according to equality.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your finger, then pull it out with forceps and cut it.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	But if it has passed three days and the swelling under the testicle remains, then let this remain until the aposteme is dried up, and cut it away with ease, and cut it according to how you are prepared.
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And beware of the head of the testicle, for it will not bear that.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	And so heal that with what the plague is consolidated from the powders which we have recounted in the treatise on powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is cut from the scrotum beyond measure, and obeys the parts above, then that does not matter to it.
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	But heal that with what we have said until it is cured.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter 58:
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the healing of urine retained in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is caused by obstruction caused by a stone, or by congealed blood, or by inflammation or by growths, and resembles those which we have recounted concerning the methods of healing in the division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved and you see that retention of it is due to a stone which is already in the neck of the bladder, then let the patient be bent forward over his knees.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	Then place the patient's feet on his back and raise his belly from the part above his back, and let the patient grip his elbow as much as he can.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Then the neck of the bladder is pressed and the stone is pushed out to the parts behind, so that the urine is voided.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved with what we have said and the cause made violent upon the patient, then let the stone be extracted from him with an instrument which is called a syringe, of which this is the shape: Let it be of silver and let its tube be thin like a quill pen with a subtle point long in similarity to one and a half inches, to which let there be a subtle tube at its head.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the manner of the ejection of urine through it is that you take a folded piece of cloth and wind it around the end of it with wool or cotton for good fastening; and insert the ends of the cloth into the part below the syringe, and cut away with forceps any excess wool, but push the rest into the tube with force. And then fill the syringe with water and with egg white of a hen.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And let the patient lie on his back, and plug up the orifice of his bladder and testicles with wool, and olive oil, and egg yolk.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	Then insert the syringe with ease until it reaches the root of the testicle; and then bend the testicle above at its base; and then press the syringe into that; and then press it in until it reaches the bladder, and let the patient be bent so that the orifice is empty, and if not done according to this order, but the meatus inclines towards tortuosity.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	Then slowly extend the cloth with the wool little by little, for the urine will draw in the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then pull that out and let the urine be ejected by healing, and use the syringe, do not cease to do this until the bladder is emptied and the patient feels relief.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter 59:
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of the quality of clysterization of the bladder with camphor and with similar instruments which are in accordance with that.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When there occurs in the bladder ulceration or aposteme, or congealed blood in it, or inflammation is constricted, and you wish to distil waters and medicines into it, then let this be done with an instrument which is called a clyster, and this is its shape:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	except that in its end there is a hole, so that it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in that there are three holes: two from one part, thus alternately.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	In the beginning there is a hollow space, in which is placed that which is plugged into it, and let its quantity be according to the amount that is pushed by that, without addition, so that when any cause is drawn from the humidities, it is drawn out, and when it is expelled, with what it is expelled, and when it is pushed out a long way, according to how clyster is made with which is burned naphtha in the battles of the sea.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Then when you wish to inject humidities into the bladder, insert the end of clyster into the moisture, and push with that what is pushed into the parts above, for the moisture is drawn into the hollow space of clyster.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	Then insert the end of clyster into the testicle according to what we have recounted concerning the syringe; and then press the moisture with that which you press it, for that moisture goes at once to the bladder, and let the patient grip that.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Form of a slender clyster with which the bladder is clysterized, and it is that form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And let it be made of silver or lead, and its head more round like a little feather, and below let there be a tube within ligament.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	Then take the bladder and place in it the moisture which you wish to inject into the bladder, and then tie that between two with a strong ligature with a folded piece of cloth, and warm that moisture over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	Then insert the end of clyster into the testicle.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then grip your hand over the bladder with that moisture with tension descending, so that the patient feels that moisture has already reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you do not have a bladder, then take a piece of parchment and make of it a circle; and pierce that all around its circumference; and then insert a strong ligature with a folded piece of cloth into those holes, so that it revolves within; and then add the circle as it is added also fat, when you place in that what you wish of the moistures, and oils and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	Then you tie that in the instrument and do to that as you have done to the bladder, and express with your hand so that the moisture reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter 60:
De extraccio de peyra.	Of extraction of a stone.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already recounted in the division the kinds of stone and the healing of it with medicines, and the difference between a stone engendered in the kidneys and a stone engendered in the bladder, and their signs.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	We have already said that the stone is in the bladder where we perform surgery.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone generated in the bladder itself is that which is lodged in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And I will tell you briefly and openly about this.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore, I say that the stone generated in the bladder primarily affects infants; and its signs are that the urine which exits the bladder is similar to water in its subtlety, and it appears as sand; and the patient rubs his penis, and often urinates, and it is almost always caused by this.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And there is a cure for children of that age who have reached the age of 12, and it is difficult to cure in the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young, it can be cured by this means because it occurs among them.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And if the stone is larger and the cure more distant, then it is contrary to that which is less so.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, when we come to the cure of this, first we must cleanse the patient with an antiseptic which extracts any wound in his intestines; for that wound sometimes blocks the exit of the stone after examination.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	Then let him be placed on his feet and pressed and made to move about so that the stone might descend into the bottom of the bladder, or jump from its place sometimes.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	Then make him squat between your knees with his arms under him, so that the bladder might be pushed down into the lower parts.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then push it out completely.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore, if you feel the stone in the passage, then you must at once cut him there.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if it does not come out at all from your touch, then place your left index finger in the anus of the patient, if he is a child, or the middle finger if he is grown; and insert that into his anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And push out the stone which lies beneath your finger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And gradually draw it into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	Then squeeze that with your finger, and expel it out the exit from where you cut.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the assistant to press on the bladder with his hand; and command another assistant to extend the anus above with his right hand, and with his other hand squeeze the rectum which is below the anus at the site of the incision.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	Then insert a spathula, the shape of which is as follows:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	And cut between the anus and genitals, not in the middle place, towards the left buttock; and let the incision be over the stone, and the finger be in the anus, and let the incision be transverse so that the exit incision is ample and the interior narrow according to the amount that can be extracted of the stone from him, and not greater, for then he will tightly compress the finger which is in the anus with the stone after the incision, and it is forced out without being broken.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that there is some stone whose angles and margins make its exit difficult.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And of this there is one resembling a nut, and it is round, and makes easy exit.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore if the stone whose angles and margins fit in the fissure:
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not forced out, then place your finger on it or tighten it decently, and the end of which should be curved with which to tighten on the stone so that it does not escape from him; or insert under it a slender tool with a curved end.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot force it out, then increase the cut a little, and if you see bleeding, then bind that tightly with powdered vitriol.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the stone is larger than one, then at first push your finger to the mouth of the bladder, and then insert it on that; and then push in a little bit likewise; and do similarly if they are more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the stone is very large, then know that it is foolish to insert it with a great incision, for two reasons occur in him: either he dies or acquires continuous urination due to the fact that the site is not fully healed.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But the assistant should extract it once it has been forced out, or use forceps to pull it out in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore when you have completed the operation, then fill the wound with cotton wool soaked in aloe and dragon's blood, and bind that tightly.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place a cloth on him soaked in oil and wine, or in rosewater and rubbed water, so that the wound heals quickly.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	Then rest for three days, and do not loosen the binding until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when that has been loosened, wash the site with water and a little oil, and then treat it with an ointment of diaphenicon and an ointment of diabasilicon until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if a wound occurs in the wound, and it is hot and swollen, and that looks like congelation of the blood in the bladder and through it the urine is prohibited (and that is known by the flow of blood with urine), then insert your finger in the wound and extract that blood, for if it remains it provokes corruption of the bladder and putrefaction of it.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then wash the wound with sweet wine, water and salt, and apply an ointment of all spices to it until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And know in the hours of all the cure that you apply both sides of the thighs and adjust the medicines which are laid on the site.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and lodged in the middle of the penis, and there is a prohibition on urination, then cure it by what you see before making an incision, for troops often come from this cure accused of incision; and indeed you have seen it and tried it, and it is that you take a punch of iron wrapped in velvet, of which this is the shape:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	Of triangular shape, pointed, made on an awl. [Illustration 19: Iron punch for removing a stone from the penis]
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	Then grab it firmly, and hold the penis under the stone so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	Then insert the iron into the penis, piercing with ease until the punch comes to the stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And turn the punch with your hand on that small stone little by little, and as you pierce it from one side, make the incision from the other so that the urine is immediately absorbed.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	Then squeeze your hand on that which is broken from the stone of the part from which the penis exits, for that is closed and forced out by urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this cure is not equipped for any reason which prohibits it, then grab a bar under the stone and another bar above the stone.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	Then grip on the stone in that penis between two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	Then extract it.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	Then loosen the binding and clean the congealed blood which is made in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary for the bar to be under the stone except that it does not return to the bladder, and the other binding above except that when the bar is loosened the exit of the stone is made, for then the urethra returns to its place and the wound heals.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary when you tie the gallbladder above that you lift up the cord to the parts above or return and do your duty again and heal the plague as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter 61.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Of the extraction of a stone from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	A stone in women is rarely generated.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if you see a stone in any of them, then its cure is difficult and is prohibited by many methods.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is because the woman is very young.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is because you do not find a woman well skilled who discloses if she has had sex with her husband or is a married woman.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is because you cannot find a woman well skilled in this art, especially in performing the operation with your hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the site of the incision for a stone in women is distant from the location of the stone, so it requires a long incision, and in that one there is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity compels you to do this, then you should take a woman doctor who is well skilled, and she is rarely found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you lack that one, then seek a doctor who is quick and subtle or present a midwife well experienced in the affairs of women, or a woman who in this art has partaken in the art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Then do that presentation, and command him to do everything that you command him, from the inquiry about the stone at the beginning; the cause is that she should examine whether the woman is a virgin, then she should put her finger in her rear end and feel for the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Then if she finds it, withdraw that with your finger, and then command her to insert your finger in that one.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not a virgin, then command the midwife to insert her finger into the vagina of the patient and feel for the stone, while she places her left hand over the bladder, and press that with good compression.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Then if she finds it, then she should gently push that from the orifice of the bladder to the parts below by the sum of her strength, until it comes to the root of the thigh.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	Then insert into that the tip of the vagina over the root of the thigh from whatever part it is stopped at her and center the stone in that part, and his finger should not be withdrawn from the stone by being pressed down on him.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the incision should be small at the beginning; and then insert the ray over that incision, and if she feels the stone, then adjust the incision according to the quantity which she knows that the stone will be pushed out of her.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the kinds of stones are many: for some of them are small and great, and lean and rough, and long and round, and having horns.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore you know how many kinds there are in her by that which you point out about what you want.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see bleeding, apply in the wound ground vitriol and hold her for an hour until the bleeding is stopped, and then return to your operation until the stone is pushed out.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And have you prepare some of the instruments which are used in the extraction of stones in men, so that you may be helped by those in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see bleeding and know that the outflow of blood is from the artery that is cut, then you should apply powder over the wound and tighten that with a bandage and not repeat that; and leave the stone and not extract it, for the patient will die quickly.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then heal the plague.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Therefore when the severity of the bleeding has ceased and the wound is healed, then you should return to your operation until the stone is pushed out.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter 62.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of incision for a hernia that is acute.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	An acute hernia is nothing but an accumulation of moisture in the white membrane which is below the diaphragm containing the bowels, and it is named diaphragm.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And in some cases it is in the subcutaneous membrane which nature has prepared for the part of the bowels, while it is another bowel; and it is the diaphragm between the white membrane which we have said, and it is not that but fat.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is due to weakness which occurs in the bowels, for to those it is infused with this material; and some times it occurs due to blow done on the bowels.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this moisture has many colors; for the color of it is inclining to yellow or to blood-red, or to red, or is black putrid, or is watery white, and that is what is most often.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which it is known that this accumulation of moisture is in the white diaphragm which we have said, then the pustule is round declining somewhat to length as the shape of a bowels, and appearing on the bowel; for the moisture contains that in all parts.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the moisture is in the subcutaneous membrane, then the pustule is round with the part of the bowels and from that one estimates that it is another bowel.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the moisture is between the diaphragm of the bowels and the white diaphragm, then it presses down from the center.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And when you want to know the color of the moisture, then you probe the color of the moisture in the pustule with a thread of which the shape is preceded; and according to that which comes out on the thread, judge what is within it.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore when we come to the cure of it by iron, then we command the patient to be phlebotomized if that is possible for you, and make him lie on his back.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And then let him be reclined over his back for some cause a little higher, and place beneath him several sheets.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And then sit you over the left side of him, and command the assistant to follow him on his right, extending his arm at the angle of two sides to the diaphragm of the bowels and to the part of the navel.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And then take a broad blade and cut the diaphragm of the bowels of that place for length in front, close to the penis.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And let the incision be made according to rightness equally distant from the line which must pass through the membrane of the bowels, so that it comes to the white diaphragm including it.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And cut that, and observe, and beware lest you cut into it; and your incision by which he cuts it according to the part that is suspended by the bowels more and gently probes with the incision according to the quantity as much as possible.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	And then pierce the full diaphragm of water with a wide incision, and extract all the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And then separate between the two lips of the incision with claws, and extend the diaphragm to the parts above; and do not touch the membrane of the bowels including it, and insert the diaphragm in that manner as much as is possible for you.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And insert that with its entirety or in parts, and especially its sides subtly; for if you do not probe carefully the incision of it, there is not made security that the water does not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if the bowels protrude from that out of its diaphragm in the hour of your operation, then when you have completed the incision of the diaphragm, return inside it, and then adjust the two lips of the diaphragm of the bowels with suturing; and then heal that as with other plagues, so that it is healed.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	If you find the entrails corrupted by another disease, then cut away the vessels which are above the suspenders, extract the entrails and treat them with that which we have said before.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	But if the water is divided into two parts, then understand that there are two hernias; therefore open that part according to how you have done it in the other, likewise; and if it appears to you that there is one operation, then do it.
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	Then you should cleanse the blood and enter into the incisions with wool soaked in oil or rose oil; and place outside another wool which you have soaked in wine and oil, and expand it over both genitals and the navel of the belly; and place upon it folded cloths and powdery lint, and apply to those upon ointment which is according to this form:
e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	and let two cloths be pressed and stuffed with wool colored red according to this resemblance; and the extremities with which it is pressed be made of wood or of wet wool, and be gathered with tightness in the waistband of the undergarments, and one extremity take hold of the buttocks within the two, and the second take hold at the part of the crotch, and two extremities over two thighs below and two other extremities over two armpits, and all tightness be made secure in the waistband of the undergarments.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta hernia es medicada artificialment am cauteri en loc de seccio am ferr; e es que tu prenguas cauteri cutellar subtil e que inscidas am aquel la codena dels ginitius, e es ignit segon que havem recomtat entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc contenent la aygua, e lahoras tu pren cauteri segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes this hernia is medicated artificially with cautery in place of incision with iron; and you should take thin cauterizing iron and cut into the flesh of the genitals, and it is ignited according to what we have recounted that it be discovered the white membrane containing the water, and then you take cautery according to this form:
e es asemblat a letra greca.	and it is similar to the Greek letter.
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	And then pierce through that membrane and it is ignited until all of the moisture is evaporated.
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque.	And then extend the membrane with hooks, and scrape it with hooks, and scrape it with thin cauterizing iron that is ignited; and cut into it according to what is possible for you until you eradicate all of it; and be careful that the fire does not touch the entrails.
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	And understand that this operation is more safe and more distant from flow of blood, and better than operation with incision.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat apostema caut en la hora de seccio o en hora de cauteri, o flux de sanc, lahoras cove que tu cures qual contrarietat fa a tu per aquo, am curacio la qual conveneys a lu segon que es dit.	But if it makes opposition pustule in the hour of incision or in the hour of cautery, or flow of blood, then treat that which opposes you according to what has been said with treatment that is appropriate for it according to what has been said.
Mays si le malaute es pauruc, e no spera la segonda operacio per la sua horribilitat, lahoras administra perforacio segon que yeu recomti aquo; e es quan es certificat deves tu, per aquo que havem dit de las significacios, que aquela hernia es ayguosa.	But if the patient is feeble and does not endure the second operation due to its horror, then you should administer piercing according to that which we have recounted here; and it is when it is certified that you must, through those things which we have said about the significants, that this hernia is watery.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos.	Then let the patient be laid upon some raised bed, then pierce the pustule in its lowest part with a spatulate iron, and make the piercing according to the length of the body.
E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And the opening should be ample so that all of the water runs out.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	And then place over it cotton and apply that and let it stay there until the remainder of the water runs out.
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then treat that until the wound is healed.
Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l’aygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l’aygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l’aygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	But if opposition is made to the exit of the water in that hour you pierce that: and that is not done except by that which the white membrane in the orifice of the wound makes opposition and prohibits the exit of the water, then let you put into the wound a needle or instrument with which the water is extracted from the water-pockets, the form of which is preceded; or adjust upon the pressure of the wound a small.
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And understand that the water returns and is driven away for an approximate period of months or years; and when it has returned, then let it be pierced according to that same methodical manner, for thus will the patient pass his days.
Capitol .lxiii.	Chapter 63.
De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	Of incision upon fleshy hernia and its treatment.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	Understand that in the incision upon this hernia there is lost fear of danger in the major dispositions; for I have seen its dismissal and being saved by that better.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And you should remember the operation upon that one and the species of the pustules.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore I say that pustules are born in the parts of which the genitals are composed and it is done for several causes; or by acute excessed humidity, which is distributed in the genitals, or by concussion.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And the color of the pustule is according to the color of the body, and it does not hurt in that place, and it is a heavy pustule.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	And often it is pustule of scabs, of which the color is dusky, and there is no sensation in it.
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas.	And sometimes it is done by nodding of the arteries, and by inflammation of those from which there has already been perceived memory of it, or by inflammation of veins.
Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	But that which is by inflammation of arteries is known by the dispersion of the pustule when you compress it with your fingers; and let not that be touched.
Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	But that which is done by inflammation of a vein is dispersed from it for no cause due to compression with the fingers.
E ja es possible que sobre aquesta specia sia fayta seccio e sobre les autres carns; e es que tu inscida la codena dels genetius, e aprop esten le huou a las partidas desus, e extratz aquel del ciphac blanc, e deliura le suspensori dels vaysels, e ligua les, e inscideys le suspensori pus que tu deliuras aquel de tota partida de las partidas del huou.	And it is possible that upon this species there is made incision and upon the other flesh; and you cut into the membrane of the genitals, and then extend the fire to the parts above, and extract that from the white membrane, and ligature those, and cut into the suspender more so that when you have extracted that from all of the parts of the fire.
Donc si l’huou ja es am aquelas carnadas consolida, lahoras cove que tu extraguas le huou e inscidas aquel.	Therefore if the fire has already become consolidated in those flesh, then let you extract the fire and cut into it.
E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.	And if there is adhesion for any cause of the membrane, or between that which is between the vessels, then let you loose all of that adhesion and cut into it by a round incision.
Mays si es nativitat de carn en le loc de la adherencia la qual es detras, lahoras cove que tu inscidas tot aquo que es de lu, e extraguas le huou ayssi cum havem dit.	But if there is generation of flesh in the place of the adhesion which is behind, then let you cut into all that is of it and extract the fire as we have said before.
Donc cum es complida la tua operacio, lahoras omple la plagua de lana imfuza en oli rozat e vi; e aprop cura aquela am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Therefore when your operation is completed, then fill the wound with wool soaked in rose oil and wine; and then treat that with the other treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .lxiv.	Chapter 64.
De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	Of the treatment of hernia which is of veins.
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute.	Vein is pustule enveloped by some envelope similar to bud with softening of the testes, and it is done difficult moving exercise and ambulation upon the patient.
E en la curacio de aquesta malautia es per temor per aquo del qual es precedida rememoracio.	And in the treatment of this disease there is fear for that from which is preceded memory.
Empero cove que diguam opperacio en aquela segon que fero les primiers.	However let us treat it in that according to how we made the first ones.
E dic que cove que fassas sezer le malaute sobre una cezelha elevada; e aprop enpelleys le suspensori dels testiculs a las partidas dejos; e aprop te la codena dels genetius am les tieus ditz am les baysels que so probdas a la vergua; e tengua aquels autre ministre que tu, e extenda aquels am extencio vehement.	And I say that let you lay the patient upon some raised bed; and then pule the suspender of the testes to the parts below; and then take hold of the membrane of the genitals with your fingers by the vessels which have been proved against the beam, and extend those by violent extension.
E aprop inscideys am spatum lat agut per seccio traversa en le dreyt dels vaysels entro que sian les vayssels descubertz.	And then cut into with a spatulate iron that is sharp by a crosswise incision in the right of the vessels so that the vessels are uncovered.
E aprop excorja de tota partida ayssi quo a tu havem dit en extraccio de arceria las quals so en las templas.	And then scrape all parts as we have said before in cutting of artery which is in the temples.
E aprop fica en aquelas un’agulha en la qual sia fiel doble, e lia aquel en le primier del locs en les quals accideys vit, e lia aquel autra veguada en le derier de lor.	And then put in those a needle in which there is a double point, and apply that to the first of the places in which vein occurs, and apply the other which has been used before in the last of them.
E aprop inscideys aquels en le mieg loc per seccio dreyta segon la longuesa del cos, e extratz aquo que es agreguat de las humiditatz fetulentas e corruptas.	Then insert them into the right side according to the length of the body, and remove what is accumulated from the foul and putrid humors.
E aprop cura la plagua am curacio de las autras plaguas en las quals vols sania esser engendrada per so que caian les vaysels les quals noyreysso un de dos genetius, quar no es mal per aquo.	And then heal the wound with treatment of the other wounds in which you want health to be generated so that the vessels fall, which blacken one of two genitals, because it is not bad for this.
Mays si accideys vit a totz les bayssels, lahoras cove que·ls testicols sian extragutz o que les testicols per aquo se cequo am les vayssels, per que sia privat de tot nutriment per la inscizio dels vayssels, e que sian estaborits, o que cequo per so que no sia juvament am aquels.	But if it happens to all the vessels, then the testicles should be extracted or that the testicles by that are cut off from the vessels, so that it is deprived of all nourishment by the cutting off of the vessels, and that they are atrophied, or that they are cut off so that it is not beneficial with those.
Capitol .lxv.	Chapter 65.
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	On the treatment of intestinal hernia.
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	The occurrence of this hernia is due to a rupture that extends into the chest from the anus of the rectum, so that as a result of this rupture some of the intestines pass out through the opening.
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	And this rupture is either of the chest or of an effusion from it, and these two types occur for various reasons: either from a blow, or from a fall, or from crying, or from some heavy object being raised, or from similar causes.
E·l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	And the sign of this, when it is due to an effusion from the chest, is that it occurs little by little over a long period of time, and does not occur suddenly, and it is like an abscess between the lung and the diaphragm because the chest compresses the intestine.
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e·l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	And the sign of it is when it is due to a rupture in the chest, because at the beginning it causes violent pain; and there is a diverse appearance of an abscess below the apparent collarbone, and this is due to the displacement of the intestine, and the body of it appears at the edges of the rupture in the chest.
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	And sometimes the intestine is torn with the membrane, and this hernia is called intestinal hernia.
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	And sometimes it is caused by wind, and sometimes a fissure occurs in the intestine, and here it is retained, and it is a great hindrance to the patient, and sometimes it causes wicked pain, especially when it is pressed.
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	And in the treatment of the kinds of this disease with a needle there is danger, because one must avoid piercing the intestine in it.
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	And the manner of operating on it is that you command the patient to draw in his intestine with his hand at the edges of its cavity, if he obeys its return, and then he should be turned over onto his back between your hands, and his legs are raised up.
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels.	And then tighten the cord which holds back the scrotum at the edges above, and insert the testicles all the way through the opening; and then fix in two lips of the rupture hooks according to what you command to open the rupture with them.
E si’ la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	And if it is according to the quantity that is possible for you, then let the intestine be torn out of it.
E aprop excorja aquela ciphaqueth les quals so dejos la codena dels testicols, entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc dur de quascuna partida.	And then cut away the chest which is under the scrotum, leaving the white tough diaphragm uncovered at each edge.
Lahoras tu entromet le tieu dit en aquo que siec le testicol, en aquo que es entre ciphac blanc, le qual es dejos la codena del huou, e entre le ciphac segon, e absolve am aquel’adherencia que es en la partida detras del huou.	Then you put your finger into that which holds the testicle, in what is between the white diaphragm and the chest according to, and remove with it the adhesion which is at the edge behind the intestine.
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	And then hold with your hand the scrotum at the edges out, and with your left hand stretch out the white diaphragm upon it, and lift up the intestine with the chest to the edge of the rupture; and command the assistant to stretch out the intestine towards you, and you dissolve the adhesion behind with completed solution.
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And check with your fingers that there is no cause for the intestine to be wrapped up in the tough white diaphragm.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	But if you find some cause in it, then you pull it down into the belly below.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And then you take a needle in which there is a large thread made of six threads, and insert it through the edge of the chest, which is under the scrotum, which holds the rupture; and then insert the ends which protrude from the thread so that they are four threads, and then tie some of them into a figure in the manner of a cross; and sew up with it the chest of which we have said that it is under the scrotum with strong sewing of two parts.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And then wrap up the ends of the threads and sew those up with strong sewing so that none of the vessels which blacken those can transmit any cause for an abscess to occur hereafter.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And pause another sewing according to the first sewing, long enough from it three fingers; and then these two sewings will leave of the chest which is under the scrotum the quantity of the size of the finger, and insert all the remaining according to roundness, and hold the intestine away from it.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And then insert at the edge under the scrotum by a rupture from which blood and health flow out as we have recommended in what we have said.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And then administer wool soaked in oil, and apply it to the wound; and administer the sewing which we have recommended (and sometimes the white diaphragm is cauterized, which we have said before the edge of it they fear a flow of blood, because many times it occurs with them), and let the sewing fall so that by itself.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	But if the sewing of it is delayed, then let warm water be applied, and apply it to that which falls according to what we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the wound with the other cure of wounds in which health occurs.
Capitol .lxvi.	Chapter 66.
De hernia ventosa.	On windy hernia.
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia there is no one who has been healed with the cure of it with a needle.
E les primiers diyssero que es fayta ayssi cum havem recomtat en la hernia que es am vi; la qual es que tu lies les vayssels aprop la seccio sobre aquela am fecilitat de lu; e aprop secca en le mieg loc en enviro le apostema am aquo que obro aquel, entro que caian les vayssels.	And the first thing that is done as we have recommended in the hernia which is with wine; the which is that you sew the vessels at the edge of it with ease of it; and then dry up in the middle around it by the abscess with what causes that, so that the vessels fall.
E cura la plagua segon que havem dit entro que sia sanada.	And heal the wound according to what we have said so that it is healthy.
Capitol .lxvii.	Chapter 67.
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	On the rupture which is made in the anus.
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Sometimes a rupture occurs in the anus as we have said, and it protrudes the place.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And do not let any cause of the intestines occur to the anus; and if it occurs, then it is little; and return in all hours.
Mays si es prolonguat le temps am aquo, es ajustada fissura en le ciphac entro que deysenda le budel en le ciphac; e accideys aquo per la extencio del ciphac le qual es en le angonars ayssi cum havem dit, la qual causa es quar le ciphac es estendut, e aprop es mollificat e·l loc es apostemat e emineys.	But if time is prolonged with it, then a fissure is made in the chest through which the intestine extends into the chest; and this occurs due to the extension of the chest which is in the anus as we have said, which cause is that the chest is extended, and then it becomes soft and the place protrudes and is abscessed.
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And the cure of it is with cautery as it is preceded by the narration of it.
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And sometimes it is healed with a needle according to this manner: and the patient hangs onto his own chest between your hands, and then dry up the place of the rupture of the abscesses protrude by an opening with sewing according to the length of three fingers.
E aprop strenh le ciphac blanc que es jos la codena entro que sia descubert.	And then strengthen the white diaphragm which is under the scrotum so that it is uncovered.
E aprop pren le ray e pausa aquel sobre le loc eminent del ciphac, e prem aquel al preon del ventre.	And then take the needle and apply it to the protruding place of the chest, and press it against the abdomen.
E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	Then cut the two prominent spots on top of the head's crown, and sew one to the other.
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	Then pull out the end of the bone, and don't cut into the skull at all, nor stretch the nerve, or any other cause as well, as you will learn in the treatment of intestinal hernias.
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And then cure that with the treatment of ulcers, and when you insert the needles, cleanse it and restore the ulcer within so that it is consolidated; for the skull is contracted and not adjusted to the突出 of the rupture.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cautery is better in this place, because it is closer to health.
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter 68:
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	Of the softening of the cords of the testicles.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Many times the cords of the testicles in some men are softened because the flesh that is between them is softened, and the guarding of it is relaxed.
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	Then it is necessary for the one who is being treated to lie on his back, and to heat all the cords which are softened over the natural cords; then sew two lips together.
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if you want, cut in the beginning of the surplus of the softened cord with three cuts or four and with a firm suture.
E aprop inscideys entre las suturas; e aprop cura per curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat e caian les fiels.	And then insert between the sutures, and cure through the treatment of other ulcers within so that it is healed and the needles fall out.
Capitol .lxix.	Chapter 69:
De castracio.	Of castration:
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	You should know that castration in our law is excommunicated, but for two reasons I have been asked to include it in this book; one of which is so that the doctor who is questioned about it knows how to cure it if it happens, and the other reason is that many times we need to castrate other animals for our own purposes, like mules, oxen, pigs, and similar beasts.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And so I say that castration is done in two ways: either by crushing or by cutting through to a section.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	But in the one that is done by crushing, the way of the operation is to have the beast cut into cold water until its testicles are softened and loose and hanging.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take those with your hand so that they are dissolved and do not appear below the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	But in castration done by cutting through, catch hold of the beast and press the cords of its testicles with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And then cut the suspenders, and insert into each one a section so that two holes are made.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And then insert those after you have scraped off each one.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not put anything on the skull over them except for the thin skull which is above the vessels.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this way of castration is better which is done by crushing, because crushing strongly leaves no cause in the testicles so that the beast desires coitus.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And then cure the ulcer within until it is healed.
Capitol .lxx.	Chapter 70:
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	Of the cure of hermaphrodites:
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphrodites in men are according to two ways: one is when they appear to have a space between the cords of the testicles, in that which is between the two testicles there is a figure like a woman’s vulva in which there are hairs.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And sometimes from it urine flows from that which is in the cords of the testicles.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	But in women there is one type: and it is that the clitoris of a woman on the foreskin is like two testicles of a man, a little bit of all of them at the beginning of the penis, just like the foreskin of a man and two testicles.
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the cure is of three types: two from men and one type from women.
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	And it is so that you insert those flesh parts joined together so that the impression of them flows out, and then cure those with the treatment of other ulcers.
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	And in the second type from men from which urine flows and which is in the cords of the testicles, there is no cure or operation for it.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 71:
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	Of the hymen and prominent flesh from causes in women:
Lentige fort leu es ajustada sobre causas naturals entro que es etressat e es fayt leg le reguardament; e alcunas veguadas es magnificada en alcunas femnas en tant entro que es spandit ayssi cum en les homes e perve entro al coito.	A strong hymen is firmly attached to natural causes so that it is strained and made tight by the guarding; and sometimes it is enlarged in some women as much as in men, and it comes into coitus.
Adonc cove que tu tenguas la superfluitat de lentinge am la tua ma o am unci e inscidas.	So then take hold of the surplus of the hymen with your hand or a needle and insert.
E no ultimes en inscizio, majorment en le preon de la razit, per so que no endevengua flux de sanc.	And do not pierce all the way through, especially in the root of the vein, so that it does not draw out blood.
E aprop cura aquela am curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanada.	And then cure it with the treatment of other ulcers within until it is healed.
Mays carn nascuda es carn que nays en le horrifici de la mayre entro que umple aquel, e fort leu es eyssit a las partidas deforo segon semblansa de coa (e per aquo alscus primiers appelero aquo “malautia caudada”); donc cove que nos inscidam ayssi cum inscidem lentinge, e curem aquela entro que sia sanada.	But a born flesh is flesh which grows in the womb of the mother so that it fills that place, and often it comes out at the openings in front according to the appearance of the vagina (and for this reason some first called it “tail with a head”); therefore we insert as we insert the hymen, and cure it within until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxii.	Chapter 72:
De curacio de alratica.	Of the cure of anus.
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	Anus is when the clitoris of a woman is not perforated, or has a small hole.
E es o natural o accidental.	And it is either natural or accidental.
