And the quality of its phlebotomy is that the patient tightens his neck and then hold his nose with your left hand, and take the phlebotomy subtile and long, and insert it into the middle place of the head of the nose according to straightness, because the vein does not appear here to the sense, and because the blood begins to flow immediately.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Believe that you finish your hand with the phlebotomy little by little and let the blood flow out according to your need; then tie that for one night, because that is restored quickly.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	But the youthfulness of phlebotomy of the two ears is for constriction of ale and for beginning of leprosy, and for many diseases, and impetigo, and bad festering corrosive ulcers like with hydropathy.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of phlebotomies of these is that the patient tightens each one in his neck with a bandage; then let the artisan stand over him, and the patient sit on a stool.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	And then phlebotomize the vein in length with wide and little phlebotomy; then draw blood according to the amount of temperature or according to what you see is needed, and then do likewise for the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And then loosen the bandage and strengthen these two veins with mild constriction so that the patient is not suffocated, and let it be until the wound is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the youthfulness of phlebotomy of the veins of the ears, confers to small abscesses and pustules of the mouth and corruption of the gums and bad ulcers, and to bad ulcers which are in the nose and its circumference.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of phlebotomies of these is that the patient opens his mouth in front of you, and tighten his neck with a bandage, and then turn back his lips and look at two veins from which one is on the right side of the lip and the second is on the left; and its demonstration is by the darkness of both of them, and it is more so because in the circumference of those are small black veins; then cut each one with an appropriate incision.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	But if doubt is under you, and you do not know which one it is, then pay attention to the incision of the largest one of them, and to the pus that is manifest from them.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And do likewise for the two veins that are in the lips below.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	But custom is more to cut the two veins that are in the lip below.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	But for two veins that are under the tongue its youthfulness is appropriately phlebotomy of the cephalic one for constrictions which are in the gullet, for disease of the uvula, and diseases of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	And the quality of phlebotomies of these is that you follow the patient between your fingers in front of the sun, and raise his tongue, and look under his tongue, from one side of him there is a vein, and from the other side there is a vein, and the color of each one declines to black.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And then phlebotomize each one; and pay attention that you do not finish your hand in phlebotomizing them because below those are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your veins which are phlebotomized in the head are those which flow in all men, and phlebotomy of them is done according to two manners, either by putting on the phlebotomy myrtilat or olive at declining subtility; or cut with a pointed scalpel, and it is called if it is not fast, and this is its form:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this not-fast one is that it convenes to incision and of those are special sides and sub-thin according to the amplitude of the veins and according to the constriction of them.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	The method of bloodletting from the vein:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	It is better to open those veins that are on the side of his body, and it is fitting to open those concave veins that contain thick blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the method of bloodletting from the olive vein:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this bloodletting is of lesser width and more subtle extremity, and it is fitting to open the more delicate veins that contain less thick blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	But the advantage of bloodletting from the basilic vein, which is one of three veins: because it draws out the blood of maladies that are beneath the throat and neck, and that affect the feet and belly.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is fitting for the bloodletter, when he performs that bloodletting, to guard well against that artery and be very careful, because beneath it there is an artery, and if he err and pierce into the puncturing of the bloodletting, it will cut into that artery and cause a flow of blood, so that one must not perform that bloodletting with a piercing instrument, but rather with a cutting instrument.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilic vein does not appear through a manifest appearance, then one should leave it and move to the other, or seek out its branch; or that one should bloodlet in the end of the arm, for that is manifest. And one should cut that with a cutting instrument as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	But if you wish to perform the bloodletting from the vein of the forearm, then one should touch the location between the wrist and the location of the pulse, and one should press hard upon it with a ligature; and one should tie off the arm and cut the vein with a concave cut with a piercing instrument as we have said, and be careful that you do not pierce into the artery in any space within the location of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see, while tightening the ligature, that there is a swelling in the location which you have pressed with the ligature, then that swelling is of the artery and therefore you should avoid it.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flowing in the bloodletting as though it were an infant's urine, and the blood is a thick red, then know that it is of the artery; and therefore you should stop it and place your finger over it for a long space, and one should press hard with the finger, and if the blood is stopped, even after several pressings, then one should tighten the arm and leave it.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And one must guard against the movement of the patient, and be very careful with him and not harm him for several days until he is healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the blood is not stopped and you see that there is no medicine for it, then one should cut into the artery if it appears to you; because its extremity is contracted and the blood is stopped; or take a piece of linen and bind it around the location of the vein with a descending binding with a ligature between the days.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And if the blood is stopped then it is good, and if not, then one should cure that with what it came from, to the reminder of the location of the powders that stop the flow of blood.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the stopping of the blood is difficult in many dispositions because of the small location of the vein and the possibility of binding of the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But from the dark vein bloodletting is advantageous in that it draws out the blood from the superior part of the head and the inferior parts of the body; because it is composed of a branch of the basilic vein and a branch of the cephalic vein as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And one must be careful in the bloodletting of the arm, for beneath it is a nerve; and therefore if you pierce into the puncturing of the bloodletting and cut the nerve, stupor will occur to him, and it is difficult for him to heal, and sometimes he does not heal at all. And this nerve sometimes appears to certain men and is subtle and not manifest, then one should pause in the bloodletting with the instrument by which one bloodlets with a cut, and avoid the nerve with one's strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then one should cut the vein in its length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The advantage of bloodletting from the cephalic vein is that it draws out the blood from the head and aids in maladies of the eyes.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And one must be careful in this, if you wish to bloodlet with a piercing instrument or with an olive instrument; for it is the safest of all veins because it does not contain any artery or nerve beneath it.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	But nevertheless one must be careful in the bloodletting to guard that with the piercing instrument one does not pierce the head of the elbow so solitarily, but seeks out the location more distantly and does not note it if it is not struck by the first piercing that one makes over it with the bloodletting.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	But nevertheless it rarely occurs in some men when it is not bloodlet over the first piercing, but rather one notes that apostema over it.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	But the quality of the bloodletting of that and its accidents are many, in which one must consider their rectification.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of these is that one must know that bloodletting is not administered save in the conservation of health and for hope of it and precaution against occurrence of maladies, and that bloodletting be made in one of the veins which are in the head: cephalic, dark and basilic; and that bloodletting be made at the commencement of spring, over breakfast in spring and autumn, and in winter near to the eating, when signs of fullness appear.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And it be made bloodletting and the third day or the first more that three hours of the day have passed.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	But bloodletting which is administered, but when it provokes convenience and necessity for it, or at night or by day, at any hour and at any time.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And let the infant not be bloodlet until he has reached twelve years, and a woman who is pregnant not be bloodlet except in her fourth month between the seventh month; and the aged should not be bloodlet who have passed sixty years.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And when someone wishes to be bloodlet for any reason, one must cleanse the intestines before bloodletting with a lion clister, if in them there is a deep split, so that the veins do not push out the superfluities in the bloodletting of the intestines which are cleared and that they do not harm the principal members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And let the bloodlet not be made for patients who are new sick with a fever and vomiting, nor from any malady or drunkenness unless it has been removed from them, nor from bad breath nor from an ache in which there is a pain of the colon and vomiting, nor from a headache or colic, nor from throwing up, nor from a bellyache, nor from multiplication of cough or of work or of watching over meals or of vigils, or from any cause that dissolves the virtue, nor from a body or animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And consider in the subtlety of humors before that if the blood is thick with food and drink, with medicines if it is possible for it.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And enter into a bath if any cause does not prohibit it, or be exercised by some exercise so that the blood is sottilized.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And pause the bloodletting of him in the afternoon, so it is around the hour of terce, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And let the foot of him be guarded in that day from all accidents of bodily things, as though it were anguish, anger, fear, and from all accidents of members, as though it were travail and excessive pain and cough and appearance to them.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And in his service let the causes be present, in the use of which men usually have aromaticity and odorant, and balsams and likenesses according to the quantity of possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And follow the bloodletting person on a cushion that is placed higher than the cushion of the one who should be bled.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	Then pull out his arm, and the bloodletting person rubs it with his hand two or three times; then tighten the bandage and wrap the patient two times.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And the constriction should be moderate, because when the constriction is uneven, or the constriction is due to superfluity, then blood flow is prohibited; or it is due to softening, and then the body's blood-letting is prohibited.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And for the constriction, let the one who is to be bled rub his hands together between which the veins are swollen and are made clear by feeling.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And let the bloodletting person anoint his blade with a little ancient oil properly; and then place his finger of the left hand over that vein, below the place from which he wants the phlebotomy, so that the vein escapes a little, and the pulse is quieted because some veins are compressed like cords when they flee from the phlebotomy, and from those is full of windiness, and when you pause the phlebotomy over that one it is contracted due to the phlebotomy, and is revealed the bloodletting person; and the phlebotomy does not open the vein, and if it opens that one is constricted.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And therefore, let the bloodletting person be stopped and be solicitous in all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And then pause the phlebotomy, but if the vein is opened in one go, then good; and if not, you iterate that or another go below that place a little, or on it with compression, if the place is not apoplectic.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the place is apoplectic, or the patient becomes frightened, then you leave it for one or two days, and do not tighten the bandage, because soon the apoplexy will be cauterized, nor enter the bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And then iterate the phlebotomy if it is needed.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the incision is small and the blood flows subtley, and you fear that it will not draw blood in the quantity that you want, then you iterate the phlebotomy in that wound according to rectitude and adjust in the incision a little, and do that with compression before the place is apoplectic, because the place is apoplectic in most men due to small incisions.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if you have already apoplectic that one, then do not iterate on it, because it does not excuse you for any cause; and pause over that some part of the wound-oil, because it stimulates the body's blood.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better in that place than other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And similarly administer the wound-oil in all phlebotomies by which phlebotomize the veins due to the prohibition of the body' blood, and they do that theriac and almandine when it is paused of one of those over the place, because the blood is subtilized and is rolled when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if in the place of phlebotomy a large apoplexy is engendered, because many goings-over happen, and more so to that one which has not been bled but that going-over, or in the incision of the vein little, then you cut it, and pause over the place sponge infused in water and salt, a little scorched, and tighten that for one hour, because it is dissolved.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And let him do that who makes the letting of the blood from that vein with completion of it or another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if there remains in the place for several days some blackness or green, do not mark that; and if you want, pause over that some cause of aloe and myrrh dissolved, or some cause of juice of mallow or of galangal or similar to it.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And many times happen apoplexies and eminences due to phlebotomy of the basilic.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And therefore pause your hand over that, and if you then cause softness due to your compression over that, then that eminence is wicked and bad; and so guard yourself from pausing over that any cause of what we have said, because it will soon flow blood from the artery.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And do plaster with that in which is stipitated, so that the place be hardened, and then cure that with the other cure until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And let him withdraw blood from all men according to the quantity of his strength and according to the colour prevailing over the blood according as it appears.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	For if the blood is black, then let it be let out until it is red; and similarly if you see it thick, then let it be let out until it is subtilized; and similarly if it is sharp, let it be let out until the acuteness of it is eased.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	And let him to whom it is full and strong and has need of withdrawal of blood in one go that the phlebotomy of the vein be amplified and the phlebotomy be long.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And in him who is feeble, let the contrary of that be done, and let him withdraw that in several goings-over, and let the incision be tight.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best that is administered in phlebotomy of vein is that it be the transverse section, not puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this manner of phlebotomy is safe from flow of blood and incision of nerve, and it is more possible and safer than phlebotomy according to length and breadth.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And to whom is accustomed to occur syncope due to phlebotomy, and let you cure that before the phlebotomy with a little bread infused in wine of grains or of simple unheated oxymel; and withdraw from him blood in three or four goings-over.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if it is paleness of complexion, then take before the phlebotomy bread infused in myrrh syrup or in aromatic syrup and many spices thus with pepper, cinnamon, ginger and similar, or in aromatic syrup and many odorous things.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if there occurs syncope due to phlebotomy and it is cause of it withdrawal of much blood, then let him take drinking water of meat and syrup odorous subtle; and use of aromatization with alder-tree, and may his feet be wrapped in that.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes that we have said in the division in the chapter of syncope for evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And who wants to vent his arms and dissolve his blood second going-over, let him of whom the phlebotomy is for great evacuation, and whose strength is feeble, let him evacuate blood little by little according to the quantity of his strength in the continuing days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But who wants to vent his arms and let his blood second time, and whose body is strong, then do that properly seven or nine hours or ten from the first phlebotomy.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But who wants to withdraw blood from his body contrary to the part to which he declines, let him be vented on the second day or third.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	But the body in which there is much blood already scorched and is acute and fever occurs, let him be bled once going-over and may great quantity be taken from him and the incision be amplified where syncope happens, because you have preserved all the conditions of phlebotomy; and let your hand pause over his pulse due to the body's blood, so that it does not fall into death in place of syncope, for many times this happens when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	When you want to release the arm and evacuate the blood a second time, when the opening of the vein is already closed and the flow of blood has become difficult, you should press firmly on it with your hand, and its extension should be bent slightly, for this is very bad.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	If the bleeding has not stopped completely, and there remains some quickness of the flow due to coagulated blood in the opening of the vein, put on it a little teriaca or sageneum, and press gently over that until the blood has been extracted.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is inflamed, then leave it untouched until the inflammation has subsided.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if you are compelled to evacuate the blood a second time, and there is no excuse, then you should open it in that place or on the other arm into another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called "sleeve of the arm" is opened near the crease or the basilic, when they are not found or are hidden, for it consists of these.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of the phlebotomy for him is that he immerses his hand in warm water until the vein becomes distended and appears visibly.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	Then it is pressed tightly over that with a ligature, not longitudinally but according to its small cross-section.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And the opening should be ample, and your phlebotomy should be at the junction of the hand, a little one.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is prohibited, then you should immerse his hand in the warm water and let the blood run into the water until you achieve your need.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are in the days of summer, then you are excused from immersing his hand in warm water; and the blood is put into warm water in wintertime.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than all other veins, for beneath it there is no pulsating vein nor nerve.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the crook of the right hand is related to diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of the phlebotomy for him is that you should press his hand with a ligature or your hand, after immersing it in warm water, until the vein becomes distended and appears visibly; and phlebotomize it transversely; and if you cut into it it will not harm it in any way.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And beware of not completing the phlebotomy with your hand, for beneath are the nerves of the teeth, bared of flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And you should immerse his hand in the warm water and let the blood run into that, for if you do not immerse his hand in the warm water, the blood will coagulate at the opening of the vein, and flow is prohibited.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when the blood has been extracted according to the quantity of need, then you should put oil and salt over the vein so that it is not congealed tightly; and similarly, do this in every branch that is cut.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	But the youthfulness of the phlebotomy of that of the left hand is related to diseases of the brain.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do similarly in the phlebotomy for him as you have done in the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the youthfulness of the vein sephena of the phlebotomy is to diseases that are in the lower part of the body, as well as diseases of the mother, and to retention of menses, and to diseases of the lungs and ulcers of thighs and legs, and their like of diseases.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the quality of the phlebotomy for him is that he immerses his foot in warm water and makes friction over it until the veins appear; and tie over the crease of the foot with a ribbon; and the location of the vein is indicated by the tip of your finger, and from that it branches into the facia of the foot.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And therefore phlebotomize the most ample branch, or beneath the leg just below the ankle, for that is better and more useful.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you phlebotomize that in the facia of the foot, then beware of the nerves which are beneath it on the facia of the foot; and put your phlebotomy at the place where you would phlebotomize it across, as if you were cutting into it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the phlebotomies be mild.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the flow of blood is prohibited, then you should immerse his foot in the warm water and let the blood run into that until it has been evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomizer has erred in the first time, then repeat with the phlebotomy a little lower, for the location is safe; and do not fear him at all, but beware of the nerves as we have said before.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly do to the sophena of the other foot likewise.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, the location is as we have said before, just below the ankle of the hind part.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the youthfulness of the phlebotomy for him is to pain in the hip when it is from blood-heat.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of the phlebotomy for him is that he should enter into a bath, and hasten to strike the head of his toe of the broad side underneath four nails in one slender band, for it does not appear except by this.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And when it appears, then phlebotomize that according to whatever angle is possible to you and according to the transverse; and it is better; or cut into it with an incision or pierce it by piercing, for the location of him is safe.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in most men hidden; and if you cut into that, and it does not appear at all to your feeling, then phlebotomize some branch of him, and it is that which appears on the top of the foot between the little finger and the ring finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And beware of the nerves; and let the blood run in the quantity that you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then loosen the ligature and put a bandage over the location of the phlebotomy tightly, for usually it heals quickly.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of wind-making and of the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Wounds are of horns, or of nails, or of a stone.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And wound-making is done according to two methods; one of them is with scarification and drawing out blood, and the other is wound-making without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this wound-making that is without scarification is according to two methods, for there is with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And to the wounds that are administered with scarification and drawing out blood there are xii locations of the body, one of which is where ventozas are paused on the forehead, and it is the hindmost part of the head; and the middle location of them is between two parts of the neck, and the front location of the face below the jawbone just below the mouth; and ventozas of two spatulas; and ventozas of alohoster, and it is over the end of the throat; and ventozas of two fingernails, and they are on two arms; and ventozas of two cavilhas.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And wound-making without drawing out blood is only of the veins slender and scattered in the flesh, and for that there is no virtue by them, as it is cauterization; nor should wound-making be done with fire or without fire in any disease made from repletion until the whole body has been evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity provokes wound-making for disease or for continuous, administer it at the beginning of the month and in the end of him, and in the middle location of him and in whatever time it is.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause is that in some men, blood is multiplied within them, indigestion due to wind and heaviness in their head; and from these, fullness and redness in their face and head, and in their neck; and from these, puffiness in their face and forehead, darkness and dullness in their eyes; and from those who emit wind from the place of their windiness; and from those whose laughter is multiplied; and from those who taste blood in their mouth, or when their tongue is swollen and they spit blood; and from those whose sleep is multiplied, and those who see blood in their sleep, redness and boils, and other causes that appear to them.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore, whenever it happens due to one of these causes, and especially if it occurs on the third or fifteenth day of the month, then they command that a bloodletting should be performed after two or three hours have passed during the day.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And it is helpful to let blood from the nape of the neck when there is heaviness in the head and when it sinks into the eyes; but make sure that it is a complete evacuation of the entire body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this bleeding is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not recommended to use bloodletting on someone who has a complicated fever or catarrh, as it will cause great harm to them.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And because of this, one should not use bloodletting on the elderly and on those with cool diseases.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But if someone is experiencing continuous fainting due to it, then you should command the bloodletter to place his hand lightly on the wound with the cup, fearing the occurrence of fainting.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But bloodletting from the elbow is in the place of phlebotomy of the basilic vein and the cephalic vein: and because of this, it helps with asthma, and with the constriction of the larynx and the split of the instrument of the larynx, and with coughing, and with fullness.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it should be applied lightly to the elbow, because if it is applied too low, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And bloodletting from the temples helps with accidental pains in the head and with ophthalmia, and emigration, and pre-fainting, and pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in the place of phlebotomy of the basilic vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And you should command the bloodletter not to press his hand after scarification so that he does not cut the artery and cause excessive bleeding.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And bloodletting below the chin helps with a cough in the mouth, and corruption of the gums, and appearances of diseases that are in the mouth, and they stand in the place of phlebotomy of Aliheric which are on both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But bloodletting that is performed above the two spatulas helps with headache, which is caused by fullness of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And bloodletting from the two sides of the inside of the lips provides relief from phlebotomy of three veins, namely the basilic vein, the cephalic vein, and the small veins in between that bring blood to those three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the bloodletter not to cut too deeply in scarification, because the place is deprived of flesh, and below it are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a bloodletting performed above the anus, and it helps with hemorrhoids of the buttocks, and with ulcers that are lower down.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And you should command the bloodletter to make a large cupping glass, and that it be of earth, because the place needs strong incision; and strongly draw with subtle cupping glasses, and let it be scarified with scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But cupping glasses of the legs should be made smaller for obvious reasons, because they will draw blood from throughout the body, and help with old pains in the knees and the hip, and the bladder; and they provoke menstruation, and help with constipation and diarrhea; and they stand in place of phlebotomy of two saphenous veins, and the groin vein, and two small veins.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, they weaken the entire body and can cause syncope in many people.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And the benefit of cupping glasses on the groin is similar to the benefit of cupping glasses on the two legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the cupping glasses is that you should apply the cupping glass at the beginning while the skin is dry and suck with a gentle suction, and not prolong the position of the cupping glasses, but apply them gently, and let the humors come to the surface evenly.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to repeat this and continue until he sees the place already turning red and inflated, and appearing with redness of blood.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	Then you should scarify and gently apply suction little by little, and then consider the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because a person who has tender skin in few places, you should scarify him once and not more, so that the place is not ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the bloodletter to deepen the scarification and take a little, and moderate the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, then let him scarify two cupping glasses, because in the first cupping glass, he opens the way to the flow of blood and moisture within it.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second, he pursues the extraction of thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very foul, then let a third cupping glass be performed so that he achieves the end.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Finally, when we want to extract the blood little by little or a little at a time, it is enough to have one scarification.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want an extraction of much blood, let us scarify with many cupping glasses; and if we know that the blood is thick, then let us scarify with deep scarification.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of scarification in which it is the depth of the incision so little only.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if that of which the skin is thick, tough, dark, and its pores are narrow, let the places of the cupping glasses be anointed gently, opened widely, and resolved; if it is in summer time, also with oil of aloe or oil of violets, or oil of bitter almonds, or oil of cedar wood; and if it is in winter time, then oil of nutmeg, or oil of larkspur, or oil of camomile, or blood, and to those similar.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is thick, tough, then let the oil be of myrrh, or oil of balsamita, or oil of aloe, or oil of anise, and to those similar.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the bloodletter has ample pores of tender skin, then let oil be prohibited from him, and let the places of cupping glasses to which the cupping is applied be washed with water or warm water of saltpeter, or water of cedar wood, or water of camomile, or water of borage, and similar.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for the one whose blood is of great humidity, wash their cupping glasses with sharp wine, or water of myrrh and sumach, and similar to those.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for the one whose superfluities are thick, wash their cupping glasses with old wine, or water of sage, which is marjoram, or of fennel, or of camomile, and to those similar.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And let the cupping be kept before bathing; having them let it be administered close to taking a bath for one hour or two, and let him sleep after the cupping.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is it that must be regulated, the wind or phlebotomy before windsucking?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Now consider at the beginning: if the windsucker or he who is to bleed is choleric and has hot blood and inflammation on him, then take causes of cooling, such as with milky acetic things, and endive in wine, and lettuce, and sesame, and julep, and like things.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And serve him foods such as poultry, and meat from birds that are served whole, and seasoned foods with vinegar, and like things.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for one whose complexion is hot, take in drinking honeyed water or water of sesame seeds with hemp seed, and sumach, and wine with a little scent between vinegar and oil; and let him be commended to use restraint in drinking and eating, and serve his food poultry and meat and peppers and small birds and pigeons.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And let him drink more than he eats on the day of windsucking and bleeding.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And let him be given to drink at certain hours by some men thyme, or medicine of musk, as it is musked, or alcelite before windsucking or bleeding, so that the principal members are comforted and the blood is subtleized; and do not take what wounds them.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the wounds that are made without scarification are those placed upon the liver, and on the gallbladder, and on the umbilical region, and at the joints of the bones, and on the navel, because these members do not suffer scarification.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired for those but attraction of blood from members, as they put a cupping glass on the breast in a sickness of flux of blood of the blood of the nose; and they use that so that subtleized windiness viscous inside the member, as they place it upon the belly and navel; because that rarefies the member and cuts it and removes pain because it resolves windiness.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is also placed on the testicles when they grow in their swelling or pimple, because by virtue of strong attraction, their hernia is quickly reduced and the pimple is eradicated from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it does when it is placed on the liver and gallbladder, it removes windiness in those who are enclosed.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these wounds are administered dry with only sucking; and some are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some are administered full of water in illnesses of the gallbladder.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is why the cupping glass is filled and that there is great pus, it is water with herbs in which are cut according to what is convenient.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of a cupping glass administered with fire: let the aperture be the width of two fingers, according to how we have formed it; and let the quantity of the wound be the size of the palm; and let it be on its side, in the place where there is circuit, the size of itself, the cut be small according to the quantity that goes into it a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let it be made of copper or citrine, with thick margins, lion, enemas and tertian fever so that it does not harm the member over which it is placed.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And let there be at its center a transverse wedge of copper or iron, where is placed a candle with fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And let this cupping glass be greater than that which we have recommended; and the little less of it according to illnesses and the state of him who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cupping glasses for children and weakened ones are smaller than those for the young and large-bodied ones.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of placing this cupping glass with fire on a member is that it extends the heat with fire from wood decently before a little candle of wax, and place that over the center of the transverse wedge in the middle place of the cupping glass, so that the fire is lit around the bottom part so that the patient's body is not burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it is placed on the member of the patient, and the finger is over the cut we have said, as long as when we hold the cupping glasses and do not feel the finger and that the vapor rises over that cut, then the cupping glass dissolves immediately.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And propine the heat according to his manner, and repeat that if he feels need of it.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in a cupping glass that is administered in the illness of pleurisy with water, in which there is no transverse wedge or cut, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is placed on the member only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its form: And this cupping glass when it is greater, so much the better, because it can receive great quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter .xcvii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leechwort is not administered in small members but in members in which it is not possible to place cupping glasses, because of the smallness of those, as with the finger and gingiva and like things; or in a member stripped of flesh, as with the toe and nose and like things.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that if you have found leeches that are in the doubled waters of boiling and cleaning.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then they are left the day and night in water doubled so that they become fat, and that no cause is broken in their bellies from those; and then the body is evacuated at the beginning with bleeding and with cupping glasses; and then the member of the patient is rubbed so that it reddens; and then they are placed on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and closed.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suck the place with a cupping glass, it is better afterwards in youth.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the place with wine and then with warm water; and let it be rubbed and squeezed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the course of the blood is prolonged by the placement of leeches and that is oozing out, then you pour a cloth of linen in warm water, and place it over so that it covers the oozing; and let this be done repeatedly until it is stopped.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is profuse, then powder is sprinkled over it vitriol bruised, or gallnuts and like things of the causes astringent, so that the blood is stopped; or they are placed on the place the greatest pods of beans roasted, and they are left so that the beans adhere to the place, and the blood is stopped.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if it is necessary, repetition of leeches is possible when it can be moved.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from suspension, then let the place be rubbed with fresh blood or stick a needle in the places where blood oozes out; and then they are placed, for those when I feel some blood it is stopped immediately.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to stop, powder over them a little aloe bruised, or salt, or ashes, and stop immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the treatment of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is many times necessary in the art of medicine; and it is restoration of fracture and of dislocation accidental in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Or, son, wise ones that know themselves of this chapter the foolish physicians and the vulgar ones and those who some time did not guard the books of the Ancients nor read from them a letter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this cause is made that this manner of the wise ones in our land is private; and I have not obliged it at any time by anyone; and I have not used it except through length of reading of the books of the Ancients and study on the understanding of those, so that I extracted the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I have directed my attention towards experience and study throughout the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	I have already described in this chapter all that my knowledge and experience tell me about this subject; for I have now shortened it for you and relieved you of the trouble of reading a long passage, and clarified it by summing up its meaning, just as I have done in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter One:
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collection of the things that must be known beforehand about fractures of bones, from which precedes the discussion of the healing of broken members, each according to its kind.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Let us therefore take up in the proemium of this chapter those things pertaining to speech, and those chapters that are necessary for understanding the truth about these matters; you and those who are skilled in this noble art will be able to understand them promptly, as well as others who may be learning it.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And so I say that when a fracture or dislocation or twisting or displacement occurs, you must first consider using cauterization, or bandaging it, or any other treatment, unless some other condition prohibits it, as well as considering the debility of the patient's strength, or whether the injury is to an infant, or an elderly person, or whether it happens during a period of intense heat or intense cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	Then the patient should eat a diet of fresh herbs and bird flesh and crab meat; and he should abstain from fatty meats and starchy foods, and from all foods that fill the veins with blood, as long as you can be sure that there will be no pus forming in cauterized wounds, and unless you fear the effusion of matter into the affected limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	Then return the patient to his usual diet, from which he deviated because of his illness.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And so when the broken bone begins to heal, then let the patient be fed with nourishing and substantial foods that are moist and heavy, such as those made from wheat flour cooked in water, rice, peas, beef, mutton, chicken, fresh fish, wine, and similar drinks; and by following this regimen, the fracture will heal sooner and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that the bones of old people and children will never completely heal and be consolidated according to their nature due to the drying out of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and healed according to their nature all the time because of the moistening of those limbs; and they are healed and consolidated in the end because of the softness, just as the bones of small children are.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But Nature adjusts and brings together the broken bone from every side by a kind of glue that adheres and binds it together until it reaches the end of its strength and firmness, just as fire does at first, unless some condition prohibits it from doing so.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary to feed the patient foods that are heavy and viscous and thick, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There is a difference in fractures according to the difference of the affected limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.
