And know that the kinds of fractures are different according to the difference in limbs, for a fracture of the bone in the leg is different from a fracture of the bone in the head; and a fracture of the bone in the foot is different from a fracture of the bone in the hand; and likewise all the other limbs differ among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I have covered the recollection of every kind of fracture, expounded in its own distinct chapter from the others.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There is a difference among fractures according to where they occur.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the kinds of fractures of bones differ according to their locations; for some occur in an arched manner and others in stars; and there are fractures according to the length of the bone, such as those that happen in the fingers, and these are the fractures of the metatarsus and phalanges, whether proceeding or not proceeding from another, just as they are when writing is prepared on a pen, and there are fractures with splitting and disruption in the head, and fissure-like fractures.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And each kind has its own inherent pain or torment during healing according to the location that will be recounted later, distinct from others in their locations.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	There is a sign of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by this is bone fracture known; there is crookedness of it, and an appearance and sensation of it to the touch, and also when you press on it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when there is no crookedness in the location nor an appearance or sensation when you touch it with your hand and the patient does not feel great pain when you press on it, then there is no fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	But it is possible that there is crookedness or a small fissure, and yet you do not feel pain when you touch it with your hand nor when you press on it; then pause over it the medicines about which I will make mention later at this moment, and appropriate for that location; and let there be tightness by subtle compression.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that the location when it is arched and not split into two or otherwise that has occurred in the metatarsus, as a whole part of its bone is torn off, then you must begin to straighten it by cauterizing the wound; then let there be strictness by subtle compression.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it has cauterized the wound, then leave off that for several days until the cautery stops; and appropriate according to whatever manner you can lift it up and move it around.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the healing of it and its setting is more gradual than in the bone where the metatarsus occurred.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And let there be tightness according to what will be recounted later.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if in the bone of the metatarsus, then extension of this broken limb from two parts is necessary, whether it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the limb is small; or with two strings or one string and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And let your position be such that you hold the limb in its natural posture while the parts are extended from the broken limb, then press that you may force them to return to their original state and according to whatever manner you can in their locations.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And beware according to your strength that you do not apply too much force over the patient through your operation of them nor harm him; and press according to your power that you apply one bone against another according to their various forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And let you touch it with your hand in that hour profitably and if you see any diverse cause, straighten it and equalize it according to the amount of your strength.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid violent extension and compression, just as some foolish doctors cause cauterization of the wound through their operation or cause contraction in the limb just as we have seen this happen through their operation many times.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And appropriate extension and equalization of that limb, and decent operation and compression of it, and rest and tranquility; instruct the patient about this and make him avoid striking against it in the hour of his wakefulness and sleep, and look to his revolution and movement, and let him avoid all his movements with all his strength; and beware that the position of the limb be such that there is pain, for that is the cause when one feels discomfort in the position of the limb or injury; then change it to another position without pain; and take care that its posture be straight and equalized, so that the limb does not become crooked when it is healed.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the constriction of the limb is that which I have described, so that you may know that broken limbs are distinguished by their smallness and their bigness and the shape of them.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And those that are small like the arm and the elbow and the wrist, let the wrapping be of a very thin cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those that are large like the thigh or the leg, let the wrapping be of hard, leaden cloth, for the tight binding of the heavy cloth connects and strengthens the large limb all around, so that no mark will enter it.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	Then, after your own evacuation, put a convenient bandage on it over the site of that fracture with three or four wrappings according to how the limb deserves it; and tighten your hand a little with the bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	Then go to that at the highest point of the site of the fracture and tighten so that your tightening with which you have tightened the site of the fracture is not slackened.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	Then loosen it a little with the wrapping at the site of the fracture and loosen the tightness little by little as you take a large part from the site.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	Then take another bandage and wrap the other side of the broken site with it, then go to the bottom part of the bandages at the fracture; and your operation should be in tightening the bandage and loosening it little by little as we said above about the first bandage.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	Then place between the bandages a piece of cloth or a bandage with which the crookedness of the fracture is equalized if there is crookedness; but if not, then do not put anything there for any reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	Then put another bandage over that and tighten it over these decently-wrapped bandages as soon as possible if there is no inflammation or abscess at the site, but if there is, then put on what stops the abscess and eliminates the inflammation; leave it for a few days, and then you can tighten the bandages.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And the bandages should be made of thin leaded cloth and skillfully formed, or of wood, or of palm-tree bark; and each bandage's width should be according to that shape and form.
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, the bandage that is put on at the fracture should be thicker and a little harder than the others; and the length of it according to how long the limb is in size and smallness. And tighten above it with another bandage as we said about tightening, and tie above it decently as we said about tying, and let your tightening be according to the site of the fracture more, and as much as the fracture is farther away from the fracture, the less the tightness should be.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And the threads should be medium-sized in thickness and subtlety, and they should be made of strong linen; and if the threads are thick, then as I have seen some foolish people doing their operations by tying their threads with rope, there is a great error when the tightness is not equal.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And thin threads are not convenient, for you will not achieve through tightness with them what you want, and there should not be more than a finger's width between bandages.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is hurt by the ends of the bandages when they are tight on the limbs, then put underneath them lead or wool that has been smeared with something to prevent injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture is accompanied by a plague and disruption in the tendon, and I have come to remember that one in the chapter according to its uniqueness.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that not every broken limb is tight with bandages on the first day; the cause of this is because when it is large, you should not put bandages over it except after a few days or seven or more, according to your confidence about the occurrence of an abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the plasters with which the Ancients restored, which were put on fractures and dislocations and twists.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Manner of plaster as a means of restoring fractures, suitable for many complications and especially for women and children, because it is that which does not come heat or rub: and you take from the powder of milling, and it is the meal's pith that comes out with the motion of the mill on the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And prepare that as it is, unless you sieve it with egg white, and do not make the preparation thick or subtle; then use that.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method of restorative ointment for fracture, dislocation and twisting: take assafetida, myrrh, acacia, enula, and mastic which is made from wild mastic trees, of all of these ingredients take one drachm each; of myrrh and aloe, take five drachms each; of garlic juice, take twenty drachms; mix them all together with honey water or with egg white if the patient's complexion is scorched; and use this ointment, for it is of good composition and quickly restores broken bones, and benefits many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method of ointment which benefits fractures and twisting: take mastic and white madder, both one drachm each; myrrh and aloe, five drachms each; acacia, six drachms; balsam of Armenia, twenty drachms.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All of these are to be pounded in a mortar with a pestle, and sifted, and mixed with water or egg white, and administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Manner of plaster for joints and bones separated from their sockets, and sore pain accidentally in those, and also for splits and fractures: take wool that is plucked and let it be soaked in wine that has been cut with oil, and let it be put on the site.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	But in this plaster there is not virtue of restoration, nor of an abscess, but it eliminates pains properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another manner of plaster which restores a broken bone: take figs' leaves and wild poppy leaves; pound them all together and make a plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Manner of plaster applied after the restoration of a bone fracture and when you want resolution of the residue of an abscess: take pounded white poplar bark, camomille and violets' flowers, and bran, all pounded .i. parts. All of these are to be pounded and soaked in wine if the limb is not scorched.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is scorched, then prepare that with water of henna or with water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another stronger plaster in resolution than that first one, when an abscess occurs after the restoration of a limb: take pounded white poplar bark and linseed, and myrrh, marjoram, violets' flowers, camomille, all pounded i alike; all of these are to be pounded and soaked in water according to the quality of the limb and its rest.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Ipocras does not dry in his own juice when it is put on a broken limb after its restoration unless it is made of wax and oil and nothing else; and let it be thinner between thickness and thinness.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But it has been seen that they are put on a broken limb after its restoration and the causes in which there is dryness with little heat are like myrrh, anise and similar to those causes that we have mentioned.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	A method of plaster that confers ease and relief from injury and pain: take a mixture of honey, sesame seeds, human hair or bird feathers, and aloe, and salt, all ground to a powder; strain and sift them, and mold them into a paste, and make a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	However, the amount of time it takes for the healing process to complete will vary depending on how severe the injury is; so you must consider whether there is still pain or swelling or if the bone is broken or displaced. If not, then do not remove the plaster for several days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there is intense pain or swelling or inflammation in the area, then you must cut or remove the plaster from it immediately.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a piece of linen and marine sponge, wet it in tepid water, and with that wash the area until the swelling and pain are reduced; then let the limb rest for an hour; then apply lanolin saturated with sweet wine or oil, and leave it on overnight so that the wound is protected from infection and the swelling of the limb subsides, and its pain is relieved.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat this gentle compression with a small plaster, but do not tighten it too much with your initial binding; do this gently so that it heals.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if all the swelling and heat and pain and inflammation and all the other symptoms have subsided completely, and you no longer need plasters or bandages, then repeat what you did at the beginning in the same way.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if none of the aforementioned causes occur in the limb, then do not remove it but rather leave it on for three or four or five or seven days. And sometimes it is left on for twenty days, depending on how well the limb responds to having the plaster removed, as we have said, so that the fracture can heal and the flesh can adhere to it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then tighten the bandage more than your initial bandaging, according to how well the patient remembers it, and adjust the padding around the patient,
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see that the fracture is dried out and weakened more than it should be, then know that nutrition is prohibited from reaching it; so soak it with tepid water every day for three days; loosen the bandage a little, and through this operation, nourish the limb, and it will heal quickly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what fools do when they restore a broken limb is another way when it is not restored at the beginning as it should be, and it is restored according to crookedness, is an error according to their operation, and great harm; and if this were known to the Ancients in their books, they would have used it.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do this, so it is more reasonable that it not be done.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter 2: On fractures when they occur in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are many, and the shapes of them are diverse, and the causes are distinct; for some fractures are made by the impact of a club, and the impact strikes all the bone within the skull, which is below the brain, just as it happens in an axe, and through this that type of fracture is named concussion; or the club strikes a part of the bone and penetrates into the flesh but does not go beyond its outer edge; and this type of fracture is named absolute elevation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the wound of these two fractures may be large or small, and they are either compressive or tensile; and the cause of them is impact with a fist or a hard object on stone, and similar objects.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is either penetrating that it approaches the membrane which is below the bone, or in the surface of the bone, and the wound of these two fractures may be large or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And another fracture is when it is hidden in the bone, in the sottlety of the hair, and through this that type of fracture is named capillary fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And another fracture is made either by impact or by the blow of a stone and similar objects, causing one of the bone's thin layers to enter into its hollows; and this occurs in the fingers when they are hit with a blow and are split from within.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And it most often occurs in the bodies of wet nurses, just as their breasts' nipples crack when they wean infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these types of fractures are bloodless, just as they are separated by membranes.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will come with the memory of all this in my mind.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And we know all these types of fractures by their detection over there and by the inquiry into them through touch and the appearance of corrupted flesh that is over them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And capillary fracture is known by what appears after it is uncovered on the bone; when it is wiped and oiled, for the fracture then appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the treatment of fractures, you must first consider the patient's conditions; and then if you see through these conditions that something signifies by manifest indication regarding fear, just as it happens with vomiting in cholera, and extension, and loss of understanding, and lack of speech, and fainting, and acute fever, and heat and redness in those, and appearance like theirs in the more serious dispositions, then it will not heal.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see that these conditions are not present, then you may begin its treatment.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason for this is that if the wound comes to you in the beginning as it is wounded, and it is in the winter days, then you must study the appearance of the bone before the fourteenth day according to every disposition.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the summer days, then you must cut off the bone before the seventh day, having seen that what is below the membrane is corrupted, and that the conditions we have recounted occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has reached the membrane covering the brain and is in small pieces with tension, then you must insert the fractured piece, according to what I will recount to you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And it is that you cut open the head of the patient who has been wounded, and uncover the bone according to custom and method known to you according to the appearance of the wound, and let it be easy on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it happens to you that you must make the detection of the bone, and there is blood or pus, then you must stop it with what comes over it, and it is that you apply a poultice of cloths soaked in wine and oil to the wound, and let it rest so that the pus is reduced; and then begin the circuit of the bone and its removal.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And it shall be according to one of two methods of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one way is that you insert the bone with a tight and narrow chisel, and this is its shape: And then administer another chisel, a little wider than the first; and this is its shape:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then apply the chisel wider than the first.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And it must be that you have a number of various chisels, some of which are wider than others; and some of them are sharper than others and are in the shape of aiguilles, and they are of iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And you must use them with ease when hitting the incision so that it does not bruise the head or lead to that.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong and hard, then you must drill through it before administering the incisions with the chisels, which are called non-penetrating chisels.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called that because they do not reach the end of the bone but remain above it; for the chisel is round at its tip or edge below the sharp point, which prevents it from being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take many of these chisels, each suited to the thickness of a different bone, while keeping in mind, in all parts of the skull, that its extremity should be sharp, and its quantity in length and breadth should be according to the quantity of thickness of that part.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three kinds of chisels: The quality of drilling through the broken bone is that you place the chisel on the bone and turn it with your fingers while knowing that the bone has been penetrated; then change the chisel to another place, and place what is between all traces of the quantity of thickness of the thread or around that.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	Then insert with chisels what is between each crack of the bone, and make that as subtle as you can, in the end of lightness, thus as we have said, while you radiate the bone, or with your hand, or by some other means for which you have prepared tools, such as forceps and subtle tongs.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And you must be careful that the chisels do not touch any part of the brain.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And when you have drilled through the bone and separated it from the brain if it is still attached to it, and have extracted that, then scrape and gnaw at that in the asperity of it with another tool resembling a chisel, but however make sure that it is more thin and more subtle than the other chisels.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any small bones and fragments remain, then pick those up carefully with the tools you have prepared for that purpose; then cure the wound with poultices and ointments as we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other manner of operation is lighter and more distant from fear, which Guiana praises and washes with great praise; and this is its speech: it is necessary for you at the beginning to begin to expose the part of the bone in the location in which there is the most violent and most manifest fracture, while when you have exposed that part and placed below it the extremity of this chisel, slow and gentle, of which this is the form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And the lenticular part is lion-like and does not enter anything, and the acute part is of it in two sides in length, thus as a wedge; let the lenticular part be applied to the brain with the acute face of it drilling into the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	Then strike upon the chisel with a small mallet while you drill into all of the bone with ease as it is turned, and be secure about the membrane not happening to him accidentally in any manner whatsoever, and if the patient was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he were sleeping.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Then if there remains any cause attached to the bone of the membrane in some places of the bone, cut that off from it with the extremity of that lenticular chisel, and deliver him from it with ease, for it is delivered from it without harm and without fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the membrane, and that which is cut off or remains of the bone is its face, and there remain in it asperity and subtle fragments, then scrape that asperity and pluck those fragments with subtle razors for which you have prepared a number, of diverse quantities so that it may be possible for you to administer those most conveniently in every place and most rightly according to where you wander in your operation on that broken bone.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And it is convenient that you apply in your reason with which you scrape the bone at the beginning the most edge of those razors, and then use that most subtilely, and do not cease doing that according to continuity until you come to administer the most thin and the most subtle of all those.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	But in any of the other little hairline fractures and subtle fractures, let you apply cure according to what you have wandered into its correction.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is a cause that is not diminished over all those who have studied in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And we have written about what we have shown in great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the membrane is stretched when you drill into the bone, then take cloth according to the quantity of the poultice, and soak that in rosewater, and place that over the orifice of the poultice; then take another cloth folded or doubled and soak it in wine and rosewater and place that over the first cloth and do that as gently as you can so that you do not weigh down the brain; then apply to that liniment, and do not strain that except for the quantity that the poultice has only as much.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave that with this cure for a day or two until you are sure of cauterized pus; then dislodge that and then administer medicines with which there is superfluous dryness, such as linseed oil and bran, and powder of onions and of aristology, and of similar things to those.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you make of these medicines powder which is powdered over the poultice, thus as they are dried; and universally, apply to that all medicine of a property of which there is that it cleanses and does not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And be careful according to your skill that the poultice in your cure is clean; and there is not in it thickness of ointment or other; nor do you leave virulence in it; for when it is applied over the membrane of the brain, it corrupts that and injures that, and there happens about the patient an evil malicious malice.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it injures the brain of the head when the bone is cleansed and chiefly when the cure of that is diminished, and there is blackness on the surface of it; then consider therefore if there happen to the patient the accidents which we have said, know that there are dangerous omens in all directions.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if blackness does not occur except from the medicine that is placed above it, and there is in virtue of that medicine that makes that blackness, then it is convenient that you take a portion of honey and portions .iii. of rosewater and with those lines a cloth, and then place that over the membrane; then cure that with the spices of cure which are convenient so that it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter .iii.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken except in two parts altogether most sovereign, or one of those some few times, because in it are two bones, for the part below is cartilage, and is not broken, and nothing happens to it except compression and crookedness and narrowness.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts of it is broken, then it is convenient that you put your finger in your nose and gnash that fracture between with your index finger and with your thumb outside, while you return the nose according to its natural figure.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And let that be done by you with ease, and be careful that it does not bruise the patient through that your operation.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the uppermost part of the nose, and the bone does not project out to that point, then it should be made even with the extremity of the bone in which there is a small protuberance.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you should make it like that.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And apply the plaster on him in the first day of the fracture if it is possible; and if not, then let him have the warm bath or the hot bath with the rest of the poultice cauterized.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	Then insert into the extremity of the nose a piece of linen if there is one fracture, or put two splints if there are two fractures; and let the splints have thickness of such quantity that it fills up the hole in the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And some of the old healers say that the splints be dipped in wax, and changed every day, but I have not seen it; it is better that the piece of linen is dipped in egg white cooked with honey like powder; then let the splint be placed inside so that the bone is secured and the cartilage is hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And sometimes instead of the splints, put in the nose a feather of an owl wrapped with linen; and let there be the most violent fracture of the nose and that the patient is not prohibited from inspiration.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause is not necessary for you; and if you want, do it, and if you want, do splints.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another poultice cautery happens again, plaster the nose with cerotom or with cotton dipped in sweet wine and rose oil, or with daryol.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if the poultice cautery does not happen, then let you plaster that defect with sesame flour and powder of anise cooked with egg white; and place on it a piece of linen, and do not touch the nose for any reason.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or are crushed, then let you split them and extract them with instruments that are convenient for them; and close the split and cure it with something that carnifies and consolidates, and plaster them with something convenient.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if there is pus inside the nose, then let you cure it with splints and administer lead tubes so that it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter .iiii.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Of restoration of the jaw when it is dislocated.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken and there is no pus in it, then examine if the fracture is only outward and not broken into two and bent inward in its parts, then its understanding is easy.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, then you insert your left index finger in the patient's mouth; and likewise if the fracture is on the left jaw, then insert that left index finger; and displace with that the displacement of the fracture inside with ease to its parts outward with your other hand on the outward part of the bone; with that decently equal it.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jaw is already separated into two, then let you administer extension of its two parts according to straightness so that its equalization is possible.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is commotion of teeth to disruption, then strengthen those from which you expect that they will break with thread of gold or silver or silk; and plaster on the broken jaw cerotom, and place over it doubled linen, and place on the linen a great star decently made, or a weight of only lead at the length of the jaw; and tie that above according to how the fastening of it is equipped to you and convenient to its application, so that it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient that he uses rest and tranquility, and feed him with a soft diet.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you think that the figure is already altered in some way, then you untie and loosen it on the third day; and correct what has already been altered from him and plaster him with powder of anise, with egg white, or with sesame flour, after having taken off his plaster, and place over the plaster linen wool.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And once you have stood and tightened that plaster over it, and the disposition of the bone is not altered, leave it, so that you do not loosen it until it is healed and the fracture is strengthened; for many times this fracture is tightened in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another poultice cautery happens again, then administer what we have said many times in the healing of it so that the pus is evacuated from it.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is with pus, then consider whether the bone mass is separated or shattered; then you subtilize and remove those shatters with what is convenient for it in the removal of them with instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the hole of the pus is narrow, then you amplify it with phlebotomy according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And when you have removed those shatters and from them no pus has been evacuated, then close the hole of the pus if it is wide; and if not, place over it one of the plasters that are convenient for it and carnify it, so that it is healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter .v.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of restoration of the collarbone when it is dislocated.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Many times the collarbone is broken from in front of the muscle, and that fracture is done in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	For it is broken or separated, or is separated into two parts other than the shatters do not happen; and its restoration is easy; or it happens that the fracture is with pus, and its restoration is difficult; or the fracture is with pus.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in it, when the fracture is with pus, is that you have two ministers present, so that one has an assistant and follows the collarbone broken, and the other extends its collar to that broken part.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then join the fracture with your fingers so that it is made in its form according to how it should be, and do not leave in it a little prominence or concavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then let you place below the chin of the patient a pillow of linen or wool, and let the size of it be according to the quantity of your need; and extend and raise the collarbone and contract the pillow with your hand so that you join the fracture according to how it should be.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot bring the extremity of the collarbone to its parts outward because it is reached at the breast, then let the patient recline on his neck, and place over his chest a pillow on which he leans with his right shoulder, and place on his left shoulder a pillow in size.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the minister presses the muscle of it to its parts downward so that the bone of the collarbone is elevated that it is in the breast below, and then you correct the fracture and join it with your fingers.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	But if you feel shatters of the collarbone and swollen, then let you split over it and evacuate those shatters with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, then you make an incision of it with one of the knives which you have equipped for it, after having placed below the collarbone the instrument that serves the saw; and the instrument is of wood or of iron of which this is its form:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to an awl of which this is the concavity; and let its length be according to what you need from it, according to the size of the bone or the weakness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	May the length of the patient be according to what is possible for the operation; let there be two extremities as well as times, and one extremity be ample and the other tight.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the wound you have cut is wide after you have extracted the dead bone tissue, and it is certain that pus will collect, then you should close the two lips of the wound with a stitch.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the wound is small, or you fear pus will collect, then fill the wound with cotton and powdered drugs according to the amount of the cut wound.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if pus does occur, then moisten a cloth in warm wine, rose oil and wine, and place it over the area.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	And the constriction of the bone when there is no wound or break is that you apply a plaster made of wheat flour with egg white, and place a lion's tooth over it, and then place your hand underneath his neck if he shudders from it, and then take an ice pack, the kind that holds the Turks' ice, which should be very long, and its width one palm or thereabout; and then sprinkle powdered drugs over the plaster and the ice pack; and then take a thin wooden rod whose width is three fingers in length, wrap the cloth around it, and wrap the cloth with the rod at the site of the fracture; and then apply an ice pack as often as the constriction of the fracture allows, and that's what you shouldn't hide from me.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And all of this should not be applied to the broken bone; and so that you can see the patient every day, if the binding becomes loose or you see the rod has become loose, then correct it and tighten the binding.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then place the patient's pillow under his neck, and place another small cushion under his chest when he lies down at night so that with that his helper on that side is elevated, and therefore the broken clavicle is elevated due to the elevation of the muscle; or his arm is bent around his neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And don't loosen the binding unless pus occurs in the spot or it becomes swollen, for up to twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then renew the plaster if you have seen his face turn that way, and adjust it in the constriction and restore him and leave it be until it is restored and the clavicle fracture has coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is strengthened and comforted according to the moon in 28 days, and in some people it is done in less time than that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Of the restoration of a shoulder fracture.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The spatula is broken on the lateral side and not from him but from the margins.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And therefore when it is broken — and it is broken in the middle of him — and it is not known except by touch, then according to how the fracture is spread out you prepare it and reduce it according to its natural figure in every way that is possible for you.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And then place over the spot powdered wheat flour with egg white and lion's tooth; and then sprinkle cloth powder doubled over it; and then place over him a thin wooden rod according to the amount of the spatula or more.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if under the rod there is a concavity in any of the places of the spatula, then you fill that concavity with lion's tooth, and then push the rod according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then strengthen it above with a long ice pack with decent constriction and the firmness of the rod so that it is not loosened from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the binding every day; and if it is loosened, then bind another looseness and tighten it and adjust the rod if it has loosened from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And keep the patient on his right side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the spatula is restored in 20 days or in .XXV.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And therefore when that number is completed, then you dissolve the binding, and know that of those bones whose beginning is not feared nor their dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if the spot of the bone weighs down and puts pressure underneath the collarbone, then you cut it there, and stop it, and act according to what we have said in the clavicle fracture about pus collection if it occurs here.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	Of the restoration of a leg fracture.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The leg sometimes breaks in the middle and that is usually how it ends up; but its ends are very often crushed and broken.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And of its accidents when it is broken in the middle there is decline to the inside parts and occurs in him great pain, and difficulty in walking, and cough, and strong fever and vomiting of blood; and it is declared in the cavity in the broken bone and is not hidden from sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And its restoration is that the patient is laid on his back, and a cushion placed between his shoulders, and then press against his muscles, and adjust his ribs with two hands, and act subtly in his operation and according to all ways that are possible for you and convenient to him, until he returns the bone' s figure according to how it should be.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And then place over him plaster and a towel, and place under it a thin wooden rod of ash or linden or similar in thickness, which you wrap in cloth; and then act subtly on it over the broken bone so that it is not loosened; and go around him with binding according to roundness at his back sometimes, and tighten it with decent constriction; and consider the binding at all times, and when it is loosened, tighten it.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessity requires that it be loosened because of swelling or pain, or pus occurs in the spot, then you cut and loosen it and eradicate the plaster and correct what occurs to him by way of his cure; and then tighten the binding, if it occurs, according to his face; and adjust the constriction so that he is healed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	Of the restoration of ribs when they are cracked.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that rib fractures do not occur except in large places that follow the chest; and of their ends from the front part, no contriction occurs to them except by that which they are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And its sensation is not dulled in feeling because of the inquiry into it with fingers.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And its restoration is that you join the fracture with fingers according to the possible way, so that it is swallowed according to how it should be, and then plaster and tighten the broken bone with a rod if it occurs.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the rib fracture inclines to the inside parts, then occurs to him violent pain and piercing, as well as piercing that occurs to him who has wept, and because of it that puts difficulty in breathing, and cough, and vomiting of much blood; and this is of difficult cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And now the Antychus are born in him with many warts.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And from them you will say: let the patient who engenders inflammation and swelling abstain from foods that cause flatulence and distention, so that his belly is distended and the fracture is driven to the inside parts.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	But we abstain from it so that it is not the cause of producing pus collection, if it has not occurred; and if it has already occurred, then help it.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And some of them say that it should be stopped above the vent and then sucked with strength; and it seems like a good idea, but it is feared that the wind may push out the superfluities to the location because of the weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And some of them say: that the location should be covered with wool that is already dipped in hot oil, and there should be powder placed between the ribs where it is filled, so that the binding is equal to the roundness; and then the patient should be treated with a pleurisy poultice of food and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if there is violent constriction that the patient cannot tolerate, and the bones puncture the membrane with their points, we fear for the patient; then we open the location above the broken rib, uncover it, and then place an instrument that conserves the pharynx on top of it, whose memory is preceded by incision of the bone with ease, and extract it.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then we should sew both lips of the wound, if it is large, with a stitch, and treat it with poultices until it is healed.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if blisters arise inside, then you cut and pour powder into rose oil and place it on the location, and the patient should be treated with what is appropriate for the blister inside.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And it should be re-bandaged on the side on which he sleeps, so that it may heal.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	Of the restoration of a broken spine and collarbone.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Sometimes there is fracture of the bones of the neck, and they hurt in their traction, and similarly the vertebrae of the spine.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when it happens to someone and you want to know if it will heal or not, then consider that if you see the fingers soft, numb, and dead, and they cannot move those or stretch them, and when you press on them with your fingernails or puncture them with a needle and there is no pain in them, then you will know that it will not heal, and in most cases, this is fatal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if there is constriction in them with the fingers and puncture, then you will know that the bone's neck is saved and that the patient will recover with treatment.
