E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see the vertebrae of the collarbone like this and want to know if it will heal or not, then consider his feet.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Now if you see that they are already soft and what happens to the fingers happens in his feet, and when he lies on his back, he has wind and involuntary defecation, and sometimes he is re-bandaged on his back and wants to urinate but cannot, then you will know it is fatal, so do not treat him.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	But if none of those happen, the cause is better and it will heal more quickly.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the treatment for him is to pierce the blisters with a needle and pour into them rose oil only, or with mallow leaves; place it on the broken vertebra some time during the day when the blister is settled.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	Then place one of the comforting and soothing poultices on it and strengthen it with a bandage; and command the patient to take rest and tranquility, and not to sleep on the side that gives him pain until he is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if it happens because of the traction of the bone, or for some other reason that it is already separated from him, then dry over the wound and tie that bone; then sew both lips of the wound if it is large, and treat it with some ointment of the gums, so that it may heal.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	But if the end of the bone of the hip is broken and it is the end of the socket, then you should insert your left finger into the anus, and grip the broken bone with your other hand as much as possible by second force; then place a poultice on him and splint him, if he has indigestion from them, and strengthen it.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if you feel broken splinters in him, then open that and tie it up, and treat the wound with the treatment that is preceded so that it may heal.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De restauracio de la ancha.	Of the restoration of the shoulder.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the shoulders are usually broken, and if they are broken, then their fracture is not but communication in their extremities and they are inserted into the length and decline to the parts within; and it happens to the patient that there is pain in the location and puncturing, and the arm is numbed when it is broken.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And its restoration is that you extend your hand over it so that it is above the fracture which is the figure of it.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is only in its extremity, then grip it according to how it appears to you by second force so that it is assembled into its natural figure.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is in the length and inclines to the parts below, then you make the patient lie on his belly so that you may prepare for its restoration.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And when you have gripped it, place a poultice on it, and then place a splint of wood or of cord on it, and strengthen it by compression over which you should not fear puncturing of the fracture nor removal of the splint.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And grip the hollow with whatever fills it so that it takes the compression according to equality, and command the patient to sleep on his back or on his side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	But if blister arises, then cease from extension of it and its restoration until the blister is settled, and place on it what settles that according to what precedes; then return to its restoration, and strengthen it thus as well.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if they happen in the bones or are crushed, then you treat them.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the helper.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The helper is what is between the neck and goes to the head of the shoulder.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is broken, then its restoration is in one of two ways, of which the first is that you take wood of sea pine according to this form:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And let them be tied at both ends with two cords, and then it should be suspended from the raised location.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And let the patient lean on a crutch, and then bend his broken arm outward over the wood so that it reaches the tip of him in the middle location to which the curve of the wood is attached.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And then let him lean on it for some reason heavy, or the servant extend that to the parts below; and then the bone grip with their fingers, so that the fracture returns as it should.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other way is that the patient lies on his neck and suspends the hand of his collarbone with a bandage, and then command two servants so that one of them holds what is above the fracture with their fingers, and the other holds the feet below him; and each of them extends to his party.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then strengthen over the fracture with a bandage and over that with another bandage, and each of the two servants extends to their two parties.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And if the fracture is close to the extremity of the muscle, then let half of the bandage be placed over the tip and the other below the fracture, near the neck.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	And similarly if the fracture is close to the collarbone, then let the bandage be placed over that location and over the collarbone.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Swallow it easily and without effort, and then when the throat is swallowed according to how each person is, and is applied with a good application, then strengthen it if an abscess does not occur.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	But if an abscess occurs, then loosen the stricture within seven days, and place on it soft wool soaked in warm vinegar and rose water until the abscess heals, and then you strengthen it.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the way to strengthen it is to place a plaster over the fracture, and then place a new cloth wrap over the plaster; and then adjust the arm to that support, and place your open hand over his muscles.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And place the cloth and strengthen it over the support of the arm so that the arm is in its place unless prohibited by any cause of the broken bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then use splints.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And it is that you place over the fracture that splint which is wider and stronger than the other splints; and place between each splint the width of a finger, and let the length of the splints be according to the break with an addition of three fingers all around.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then strengthen the splints with the stricture which was described at the beginning of the chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And it is that your stricture over the site of the fracture be tighter.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And when the fracture has healed, let the stricture be less.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And so if you see the arrangement of the splints and the stricture as we have said in the time in which you are restoring the limb to its setting, then you do.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear an abscess will form, then you loosen the stricture and the splints within seven days as we have said.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And then consider the ligament in all parts for three days so that no inflammation or swelling occurs at the site, or food is prohibited from coming to the limb due to the disposition of excess stricture; and then rectify all this as we have said.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	But if you are certain that none of this will occur, then do not loosen the ligament but wait three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And let his sleep be on his back, and let his hands be over his stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And place over the support a full poultice of wool which is moistened, and consider throughout the night or day that it not be loosed nor dissolved the figure of the broken limb, or that the ligament be softened, therefore rectify all this with your skill.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	And give the patient food according to the order which we have given before, so that the food is subtle at the beginning until it is strengthened; and then increase the food for him.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	For the custom of the support and his bed is that they are tightened for 40 days, and then let them be loosed and a bath administered to him and he is medicated with ointments which rectify this.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is dry, then you do not loosen from it the ligament and splints within two months or 60 days.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	Of restoration of a broken arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	An arm is made of two bones which are called two ulnas; of which the one is small and is that which supports the little finger, and the other is large and is that which is placed below the small one, from the part more below.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And often only the larger ulna is broken, or the smaller, and often they are both broken together.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the smaller ulna is broken above, then its restoration is easier, and its healing is even easier.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when it is broken below the fracture is difficult to restore, and its healing is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And worse than this is when both bones are broken together.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore if the bone which is broken is the smaller ulna above, then it is convenient for the doctor, during its restoration, to place a small extension with ease so that it be moistened.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	But if the larger ulna is broken, then let him place an extension more vehemently.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if both ulnas are broken together, then let you place the extension even stronger.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And let you place the figure of the hand in its restoration and extension stretched out over a pillow, and let the wrist of the hand be above the parts more up, more than all the other fingers, and let the auricular finger be more below than all the others, and let the patient be lying on one side.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And let one pillow be under him in the height or bend of him, so that he does not fall to one side.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	And then the servant extends the arm from below with his own hand or with a ligament, and another servant extends above similarly.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	And then the doctor moistens the bone so that he reduces it according to the best figure that he can.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if in the setting of the bone there are bumps, then pierce through all the bumps at its site with your skill.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if a separate bump appears that pricks the tendon and is not to your hope in its restoration, then you file it away and stop it according to the way which we have said above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	But if the fracture is with a splinter, then I have already written about that particular chapter, and therefore take its cure.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	And if an abscess occurs at the beginning of your restoration, then you line a cloth with cerate made of rose oil and white wax, and let it be between specitute and subtlety, and strengthen the cloth over that with gentle stricture so that the abscess yields; and then remove the cerate and place a poultice prepared from powder of moly with honey, and then place splints; and let the splint which is placed over that fracture be wider and stronger.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	And know that the number of the splints of the arm is seen in the major dispositions, or it is the fracture in one ulna or in both ulnas together.
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	And then strengthen your stricture over the site of the fracture even more vehemently, and when it is loosed at the parts above the fracture or at the parts more below him, loosen the stricture a little more gently according to how it was preceded in the beginning of the chapter.
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And the cloths which are wrapped over the fracture be moist soft cloths, and not hard or rough, and the thread with which it is tightened be of linen properly wetted between subtle and coarse, as we have recommended.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	And consider the limb and the ligament after a few days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if there occurs any cause for which rectification is necessary, then as it happens to the limb, and then let you wind the limb with wet water so that it cease that swelling.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	And loosen the limb not tightly while it rests, and then tighten the stricture again.
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	And if the stricture is already softened and the bone is washed and similar to those, then rectify all this with your skill.
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	And consider if the food is prohibited from coming to the limb due to excess of stricture, then let you soften it a little and leave it for a few days so that it comes to it the food, and then strengthen it.
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	But if to the patient does not occur any cause of those which we have said, then do not let it be loosed for more than 20 days or from that time.
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	And then let the hand of the patient be suspended by his skill of moving, and let him sleep on his back.
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	And know that this fracture is restored in 30 days or in 32 days, or very soon it is restored in 28 days, and all of this is according to the disposition of the complications and dispositions of virtue.
Capitol .xiii.	[Chapter 13]
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	On the restoration of a fracture of the finger of the hand and of the teeth.
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	Know that in the finger of the hand and the nails of the teeth there should be few fractures, and they do not occur unless through great violence.
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	And if a fracture or sprain occurs in the hand, then you should have the patient lie down and lean forward, and then place his hand over that [injured] area which is extended.
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	Then the minister should extend the broken bones and the doctor should put together those parts that are dislocated with good conjunction.
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	And then he should apply plaster and bandages if there is no pustule, cauterized; and then put a poultice over it according to the quantity of the area, and you have wrapped that [area] in linen cloth.
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	But if the cut is on the edges inside the palm of the hand, and then make a spear-like shape out of cloth, and command the patient to stretch that  [area] with his palm which is cut; then it should be stretched with long cloth.
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	And the poultice of meat with cloth in which it is lifted, so that the meat is applied to the palm; and stretch it according to how it should be.
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	But if the fracture is on the outside edges, then you should put a poultice over it and another poultice under that   [area] on the palm so that the hand is open and straight; and then apply the compression, as the hand is rolled around between the teeth with laments.
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	And if a fracture occurs in one of the nails of the teeth, then if it is on the toe, it should be joined according to how it should be and then be bound with the palm; and if you wish, put a small staff over it straight so that the fracture is elevated and not bruised.
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	But if the fracture is on one of the other teeth, as well as in that of the middle finger or the index finger or the auricular finger or the little finger, then it should be joined and tied with the finger to which it belongs; or they are all tied according to continuity, and that is better; or put a small staff over it, as we have said for the toe.
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	And in your restoration, consider and oppose that, the disposition of pustule cauterization — by your operation — with that which occurs when any cause of those happens, according to how it is iterated in his narration of him.
Capitol .xiv.	[Chapter 14]
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	On the restoration of a fracture of the bone of the thigh.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The bone of the thigh is many times broken and it is declared to the feeling according to how it is converted to the front party and the superior pus.
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	And its restoration is done in that the ligament is bound over the fracture and another ligament under the fracture; and the patient should be prostrate on his belly and on his face.
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	Then the minister should extend all the ligament to its party according to quality when the fracture is in the middle part of the bone.
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	But if it is near the root of the thigh, then the ligament should be near to the bottom at the party of the pubic bone, so that the extension box on him; and the other ligament under the fracture.
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	And likewise if the break is near the bottom, then the ligament should be made near the bottom, and the extension at the bottom parties.
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	And then the doctor should join the bone with both of his hands until he reduces it according to the natural appearance and the bone is conjoined by good conjunction; and then he should apply plaster and compression if there is no pustule in the member.
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	But if a pustule occurs on it, then you should leave it for some days until the pustule cauterization is ceased; and then return to your cure.
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	The compression of it should be done thus: you should wrap a hard bandage over the fracture and fold that two or three times, and remove from him superfluous moisture; and then wrap the leg so that it reaches to the ankle and to the root of the thigh.
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	And insert long wool between the thigh and the leg near to the bottom at the bottom parties; and let the ends of the wool come from the top part of both parts, and then revolve over the leg and the thigh that which superfluously comes from the bandage.
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	And then put over the thigh in the place of that fracture ash-wood, and put one staff over the bone of the leg.
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	And then fill the emptiness between the leg and the thigh with soft cloths so that the compression is coagulated.
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	And then begin with strong compression over the place of the fracture with three or four wrappings; and as you are longer with ligament of the place of the fracture, your compression should be lesser and looser and moister.
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	And then extend to two ends of the wool at the bottom parties so that it reaches to the ankle of the foot; and strengthen both ends of the staffs on the other party so that the ligament is not removed from its place.
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	And then leave the compression over him as it is so that no pustule or cauterization or inflammation occurs on him nor emaciation and likewise to those; and if any of those happens then you should know yourself by dismembering him, and rectify what happens altogether, according to how we have said many times.
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	But if in the bone is a piece of bone which you put, then know that you join that according to what it is possible for you; and if not, then go over him and remove that and cure with that by which it is preceded so that he is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	And sometimes this fracture of the thigh is bound with another so that they are adjusted to him staffs, as we have said in the helper and the arms.
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	But in its restoration made in such a manner let no limp occur on him; and if it is restored alone, then let the other leg be applied to it, then it is necessary that he limps from which it is affected.
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios.	And know that the thigh is bound for 40 days or a little month or a little more than a month, and all of this is according to the diversity of the complications and other dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	[Chapter 15]
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	On the restoration of the fracture of the knee of the bottom.
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	Know that fracture of the knee happens many times, but it occurs on him many times with sprain.
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	But if fracture occurs on him, then it is not but fissure or crack in its parts, and that is with wound or wounds, and over all is placed with feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	And its restoration is thus that it is joined what is broken of its parts with the fingers so that it is added and conjoined according to what is possible by equation and facility and fabrication.
E aprop pausa emplastre e pausa sobre aquel stela redonda, si indigeysses de aquela; e strenh desus am strictura ad aquo convenient.	And then put plaster and put over it a round staff if it oozes from that; and strengthen over him with compression as is convenient.
E aprop considera totas las disposicios las quals havem recomtadas en las autras fracturas, ayssi cum es apostema caut e semblant ad aquels enaissi que se oppause a tot accident am aquo que a lu es convenient entro que sia sanat.	And then consider all the dispositions which we have recommended in other fractures, as well as pustule cauterization and likewise to those on which a staff is opposed to all accident with that which to him is convenient so that he is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	[Chapter 16]
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	Of the restoration of a broken leg.
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	Know that in the leg there are two bones of which one is thick, and is named after the name of the leg; and the other is thin, and is called the shank.
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	And it happens in both kinds of fractures that happen to the two bones of the arm, and for this reason, the restoration of it is also the same as the restoration of the arm, and the operation of it is one and the same.
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	And if two bones are broken together, then the leg is turned completely inside out.
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	And if only the thinner bone is broken, then the leg is turned inside out.
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	And if only the thicker bone is broken, you will see this from below, and it is of those causes that are not to you hidden.
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	Then administer extension and alignment and ligation of the bones according to what is mentioned above.
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	However, if the fracture of the leg is narrow having few gaps, then let the extension be less and shorter, and draw near with your skill.
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	And in the leg there is some cause of operation on the arm, and it is when you equalize the bones and complete all your operation, then you shall take weights of wood which is placed below the causes which are placed in soles, and they are made into fingers of palm-widths; align those to which there is a small thickness, and let them not be of the fingernails, and let the length of those be according to the length of the leg, and of the inner part within the most lowly.
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	Then wrap around each weight in two wraps according to the length of it, and place one over the gap of the leg from one side and the other from the other side, and let them be within the most lowly place of the foot.
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	Then tie the two splints in three places of two ends and in the middle place, for with this constriction the leg is prohibited from tilting to either side, and stands in good position.
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	And a brace of wood has been administered according to the length of the leg; and let it be placed in it so that it conserves that of movement.
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	And especially if you make this in fracture, and when with that is plague properly.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And consider in each day the leg and study it with that by final study, and you keep it from pustule and inflammation or other similar causes; and when any of those causes happens, then cease to do so until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter .xvii.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Of the fracture of the ankle and the bones of the foot and the toes.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	To the ankle does not happen fracture at all; but to the bones of the foot happen fractures some times; and to the toes of the foot happen little fractures, and do not happen to them but atrophy in the months of disposition.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if to the bones of the foot indeed fracture and see those bones being raised upon each other, then let the patient place his foot on the ground prepared in that way.
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	Then let him place one foot over that which is raised of those bones, and step on them, and press, and equalize them within until they return to their places.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	Then let him apply plaster and a stopper over it, and place below the belly of the foot a small board to which are two heads placed.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	Then strengthen that with the foot with gentle pressure, because you have wrapped it in bandages and other things of which you are ignorant.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And when three or four days have passed, then loosen the binding, for you will find the bones equalized, or broken, or displaced, and the operation in those is thus known.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	But if any toes are broken, then restore those, and equalize them thus as you were taught in the restoration of the fingers of the hand.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	Then place to the broken toe a splint according to the length of the toe, and let it be more bent towards it; then below the foot place this board which is told to you, and strengthen that with gentle pressure.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	But if that which is broken of the bones are two or three or more, then you shall place over each toe a splint of its quantity wrapped in linen bandage, and strengthen the board below the foot, and let it stand upon one of the heads of the board so that it has good retention.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	And it is convenient for you that you do not forget that you do not consider all the causes which I have told you in the other fractures of the accidents that we have said; and apply to every accident what is appropriate.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter .xviii.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	Of fracture of the knee-pan and the shinbone and the ankle of a man.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the knee-pan is broken, then let her sit in a chair, and let her lean forward a little, and let her be held back.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And the midwife fills the knee with cotton, and let it be done in the knee thus with sperm; and let the woman be bent down, and raise up her knees little by little, for all that is forgotten within when it is bent forward with sperm and the broken bone returns.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	And let them put powder on the knees, and when she wants to urinate, let her loosen the crotch with facility, and let it urinate, and reduce and return that according to the manner in which you measured it at the beginning, and let it return to its first powder.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And do thus for seven days or turn those, for that is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you want, take a bag of wool and strengthen over the crack of it a cannula of a reed-bed; and insert the whole bag in the knee, and let them insufflate in the cannula with skill until the bag is inflated within the knee, for the fracture returns.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And let it be filled with cotton and stay for some days according to what we have recommended, until it is healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the shinbone of a man or woman is broken, then administer in its restoration and healing of it what we have recommended in the bone of the hip.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And that which is straight is not hidden in these close fractures and which hardly turns out, most especially to that to which there is some study and understanding to this my free thought; for that fracture indicates to you in the major dispositions the straight way in the restoration and in the constriction of it, therefore understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But in the ankle of a man when it is broken, take a cow’s penis, and insert it into that; then let him apply plaster over it, and let it be wrapped up, and let it be left for three days or turn those, and let it be healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter .xix.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	Of restoration of the bones when they are swollen.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	Convenient is to that to which fracture happens with swelling, and especially if the bone is large as is the bone of the jaw or of the shoulder, or similar to that, that you treat it and fleabots that as soon as the conditions of fleabits to you testify to us thus.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the swelling and pain cease, then it is convenient that you apply to the retention of it in that way that you pulverize over it chalk ground with vinegar, if another cause is not present.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	Then begin to restore the fracture on that same day, and do not prolong it, if inflammation does not happen.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	But if an abscess occurs and you don't see its restoration within nine days, then the abscess has to be lanced by the third or fourth day at the latest, otherwise you will bring about harmful accidents.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	But if the broken bone is prominent above the uncovered skin, then you have to pierce and reduce it with your hands with ease and little extension.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	But if extension is not prepared for you and the adjustment by your hands, then you reduce it with this instrument; and this instrument is made of iron, whose length is seven or eight digits, and its width according to the quantity of the wound; therefore it is necessary for the doctor to use these three or four according to the quantity that he needs for that in all kinds of fractures.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And it should be round and not have much thickness so that it is not bent because of the pressure on it during the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And its tip should be sharp and its edges smooth; and the upper part of it should have a thick edge, and the lower half into the parts.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is the shape of it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is named in Greek "labre volentz atelarem", that is, a little palette.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	So that the tip of it may be placed elevated on the prominent end of the bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And push it into a hollow until the bone returns, and let it be adjusted by some position.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And therefore try to adjust the ends of the fracture between them, and if the broken end of the bone is thin, and does not take the instrument by a good exception, then you have to insert the end of that bone so that the instrument can do it.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	But if you cannot reduce the bone at all with what we have advised, then cut it with one of the cutting instruments which we have mentioned; or saw it with one of the saws in whatever way is possible for you.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	Then smooth the part that remains in the bone, and of roughnesses and small scars.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bone is reduced, and if the patient feels strong pain during the reduction, then know that the bone has not returned to its natural place; and therefore do what you confer on the patient great benefit.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When you have completed the restoration which you do to the bone, then soak cloth in black styptic vinegar, and especially if it is summer, and don't apply ointment or anything else on the wound that has oil, so that no putrefaction and corruption occur in it.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And especially administer stars in the hour of your completion of the restoration of the bone, and let the wound remain uncovered unless you insert the trauma with forceps and use bandages according to the quantity of the wound.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And guard yourself with all caution that you do not strain the wound with the fracture, for many times foolish doctors have done this and caused death or harmful corrosion or putrefaction on their patients, it is a matter of life.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if your tightness is loose, soft, different from the tightness of the other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the wound is great or it is bad, and you fear some harmful accidents which we have mentioned, and you feel pain in that place, then do not put stars on it, but make an envelopure of hard cloths in the place of stars and tighten it with those.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And when about a day or two has passed and the wound begins to mend, and in it is engendered pus, then remove above the cloth which you had placed on it with vinegar, and especially administer cauteries, of which according to our custom we medicine wounds, thus with cauteries of tetrafarmacon and alike.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And it is convenient for you to loosen the ligature and consider the wound every day morning and evening until it is consolidated and closed, and that the member be prepared in such a way that the putrefaction runs from it to its parts below with ease.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If after several days the wound is not consolidated or the pus is not discharged from it, then know that here are signs of the little ones because you touch the wound with a tent.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those signs which are separated and removed, those from whom the member is not separated and they cause pain, pierce them according to what you can do it.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if it happens to the wound that it suppurates or becomes light, so is stiomenia, or another kind of corruption and putrefaction, then do what convenes to its cure, of which a precedent is given in its chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o .xxx.; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And of that in which you have to stay the same word and make known your opinion: when a large bone is broken, raise it above the member thus with the bone of the thigh and of the support and alike of those of the great members, and do not presume traction on it, nor its extraction for many times death happens because of that; leave it so that pus runs from it, for if it is strong by itself it will fall after about xx days or .xxx.; And then cure the wound if you see it, and if not leave that.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter .XX.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	Of the cure of nodation which happens in the track of any fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Many times this nodation happens in the track of healing fracture, and especially it is near to the joints, and its figure of the member is affected; and usually the member is prohibited from its natural operation.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Then consider if the nodation is recent and administer in that medicines which have tightened as aloe, and milk thistle, and marjoram, and wild thyme, and alike; so take some or all of those, and mix them with vinegar, or with egg white, or with wine, and apply that on the nodation on wool, and constrict that on it by good compression.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And let the compression which do not remove that for several days; and then loosen it and repeat another, until the nodation is soft; or tighten on it a leaf of lead descending, because lead has property of softening all that is swollen in members.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if the nodation is already turned into stone and it is hard and necessary causes to bear that bandage on it tightly, then cut that by the part of pus which has risen from it, and insert the superfluity and prominent, or smooth that with some cauteries until it is soft; and cure that as it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .XXI.
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	Of restoration of fracture when it is restored and especially if that has happened to the member thin and frail, not according to its nature.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When bone fracture is restored, and especially if that happens to the member thin and frail, then that is not done but for several causes: of which one is multitude of solution of the ligature and of its binding made not according as it should; or by superfluity of compression of the ligaments within which the nourishment is prohibited from running to the member; or by multitude of effusion; or by superfluous movement, not in its hour; or by lack of blood in the body of the patient and by debility of it.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And cure of that is to make the patient eat and make his heart tender within which blood is multiplied in him; and administer bath; and insert gaultheria and licorice on it.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And then apply plaster to the affected limb, so that the plaster draws out moisture and continues to foment it with warm water until the swelling goes down and returns to its natural state.
Capitol .xxii.	Here is the next sentence:
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Translation:
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	Translation:
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	Translation:
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	If the limp and the nodule are recent, then they should be bathed in warm water containing soft herbs such as comfrey leaves and roots, sweet basil, and similar; or a liniment should be made with linseed oil, or a poultice of marshmallow root should be applied, either with woolen cloth or olive oil, and then bandaged with that; or fatty figures should be made and bound with dove droppings, and similar to those medicines named "brothers' consolidation."
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And sometimes it is dissolved by continuous gentle friction with the moistened hands, and motion of the limb in all directions at all times.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	But if tortuosity has already gone too far and become strong and turned to stone, and requires treatment with iron, then let the pus above be dried up, and the continuation of the bone be dissolved, and let that which is superfluous of the nodule be cut away from the bone with thin instruments, and ease be administered in that by solicitation and study.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De sermo en dislocacio.	Of speech in dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the displacement of one of the joints of its place, by which it is prohibited from moving, and the figure of the limb is altered, and brings great pain and injury to the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when dislocation occurs, let it be immediately forced back into place, and not delayed in being reduced, for if it is delayed, the joint will be inflamed and very strong, and the reduction of the dislocation will be difficult.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for that reason, one should not be bled or stretched during the hour of inflammation, because many times it brings on spasms and pain to the patient.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when this happens, let you resort to phlebotomy on the patient, and let him be laid flat so that he may rest the inflammation; and let the limb be bathed with warm water and oil, and let it be reduced with ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And every limb shall be cured by what its memory will return to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And now we have ordered the chapters on dislocation according to what was preceded in fractures, from the highest part of the body down to the lowest.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of the cure for dislocation of the lower jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	The two mandibles are dislocated if not bitten; and the dislocation of both is done in one of two ways: they are either dislocated from their places by a small movement and slightly softened, or they are fully dislocated and completed, so that they are softened at the joint where saliva runs down the patient's throat, and he cannot hold it in his mouth or close his mouth, and his tongue is wrapped around his words.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when the dislocation of him is slight, then in the greatest dispositions it returns by itself for a slight cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is entire and completed, then let the reduction of it be administered gently, and not delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And let the minister hold the patient' head, and let the doctor put one of his fingers in the root of the dislocation of the mandible inside the patient's mouth, if the dislocation is on one side; or that he put both fingers in together, if the dislocation is on both sides, and the others outside with which he grips; and command the patient to cease moving his mandibles and relax those everywhere; and let the doctor grip the mandible and press it in until it returns to its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction of it is difficult, and especially if both mandibles are fully dislocated, then administer evaporation with warm water and oil, so that the reduction of both is made gentle, and do not delay the reduction of both at all, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And therefore when they are returned and are closed, and the mouth of the patient is not softened, then pause upon them with a powder of linen with cerot, and let it be made of wax and rozat oil; and let it be bound with ease by mild bonds.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on his back, and let his head stand between two pillows, so that he does not bite to the right or left; and do not force him to chew for any reason; having his food be lion's paw, so that when the pains are increased and the mandibles are swollen, then let him bite what he will.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And that shall be administered with ease, and do not work upon the opening of the mouth after eating and drinking and waking, so that the mandible may be swollen and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of two mandibles is difficult when they are dislocated at any time and not returned to their places, then many times it happens that fevers and continuous fever occur, and very strongly the belly of the patient is swollen, and very strongly he vomits pure cholera.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see that, then know that it is a loss; and many times the one to whom that happens dies within ten days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	Of the reduction of the dislocation of the collarbone and the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The collarbone is not dislocated from the side within by its continuation with the shoulder; and sometimes it is dislocated at the outer part, and that is declared by feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And its restoration is that the patient hangs over his head and extends his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	And let it be pressed into place with your palm with strong compression, for it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And let plaster and powder be paused upon that and strengthened there.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the extremity of that which is connected to the collarbone and continued with it, is not dislocated in any day; then let it be reduced and closed as we have said and according to what is your apparatus.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And let plaster and powder and tightness be paused upon that, and command the patient to adhere in tranquility and rest until it is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And with this medicine of cure, the extremity of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Of the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, of which one is that it is dislocated at the tip of the tittil at the lower part.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated at the top of the muscle, and that is done quickly; and it is not dislocated at the sides by the shoulder; and it is not dislocated at the front by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And most of all it is dislocated and out from the lower parts beneath the tittil, and most of all in those whose flesh is thin, it is dislocated quickly; but in those in which there is much flesh, it is forced out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And very often it happens to some men by blow or fall, and the muscle of him is inflamed with inflammation from inflammation, and it is healed by that which has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore, let you inquire about that while you are on top of him, and let the process be in his cure.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is known that the dislocation of him is when it is at the lower parts beneath the tittil; so that you distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the uninjured muscle, for you press upon them with manifest difference; and you press in the head of the muscle concavity and beneath the tittil from the touch of the head of the muscle just as a nail, and let the patient not be able to reduce his hand to its shoulder, nor move that by any movements.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated, you must obviously feel a click and it cannot be hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And from this dislocation, there is an easy reduction when it is fresh and the patient is young.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of this is that the minister lifts the patient's hand to his shoulder; and then places his fingers under the patient's chin, and lifts the joint with strength back into its place; and the minister lifts the patient's hand, and stretches it upward; and then he places it underneath so that it returns more easily.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if it does not return after what we have said, and because of the beginning of how the dislocation occurred, many days later, the patient should be bathed in hot water and given an ointment that softens and lubricates like a mixture of oil from tall plants, fenugreek, and melilot in water, and it should be applied.
